story:
The Story

The Little Catering Co. Brisbane started as a little personal project to spend more time doing the things I love. From there it has blossomed into something more and I would like you to help me get it there!

I've been a cook for over 15 years and for the last decade as a Food Studies and Hospitality teacher I have been lucky enough to teach a LOT of teenagers how to cook and have mentored many to become passionate about food and the hospitality industry.

This little brainchild I hope will one day come into its physical form and turn into a cafe and catering school - supporting local the local community by sourcing local and seasonal produce, providing apprenticeships, employment, as well as a place where locals can convene and where artists can show their wares.

Though, for now - one must start small - with cakes and mobile catering!

 

What We Need:

All funds (even if the goal is not met) will go towards equipment, supplies, tools and licensing to ensure our customers are well fed and happy!

Equipment, supplies and tools: trestle tables, outdoor shade, mobile fridge, two large eskies, mini bain-marie, mini-roasters and a commercial grade fridge and freezer.

 

What you get:

$10 donation – A massive THANK YOU!! and a 20% discount on your first order.

$25 donation - 1 dozen gooey brownie squares *locals -pick up- only*

$50 donation - 1 dozen cupcakes *locals –pick up- only* (choose from: vanilla and blueberries, red velvet, raspberry and coconut, mixed berries, dulce de leche, chocolate and hazelnut.)

$100 donation - 1 x 8" tower cake *locals only*

$300 donation - 1 x 10" tower cake or a private cooking lesson for 2! *locals only*

$500 donation - 1 x 12" tower cake or a dinner party for 4! 3 delicious courses cooked and served in your own home, matched with sumptuous wine. *locals only*

$1000 donation - Having a party? Need a cake? Catering for a private party of 20! Package includes a grazing table and a 10" tower cake *locals only*

DO NOT WANT A PERK?

If you simply want to support the campaign without receiving a perk, click on a designated contribution amount listed.

If you want to contribute an amount not listed, just click BACK IT and enter the amount of your choosing.  

 

The Impact

The funding will provide me with the means to provide catering to festivals, fetes and markets  as well as freely operate as a caterer from home. This will enable me to invest more funds back into the business and make it a cornerstone for a physical location.

Risks & Challenges

Food and beverage businesses are always fraught with risk. With perseverance, business management experience, over a decade in the Hospitality industry and also almost a decade teaching I have the tenacity to see this come to fruition. I have received numerous positive reviews from people whom have tasted the products and have been encouraged to make this hobby become a business reality.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone is in the position to contribute to my campaign, though you can still help by spreading the word about my campaign!

Thanks so much for your support!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What's better than coffee?? Absolutely Nothing. ...Okay, some thing like family and friends, but when it comes to beverages, coffee is where it's at. As two friends who met while working at a coffee shop, we found we spent a lot of our time going out for coffee, even after a whole day of working with it. One day it clicked, why not bring something that we enjoy together out on the road and share with those around us. 

 

Coffee was never meant to be boring. We are trying to create a truly unique experience. Today coffee is on every corner, but the truck demographic is still fairly uncharted territory. But, aside from that, we hope our quirky and optimistic attitudes will really captivate the Los Angeles area. A cup of great tasting coffee served with a bit of humor and a smile can absolutely change one’s day. To us, this is more than just another coffee spot, this is who we are.

We are requesting help from the public to help lower initial costs and give our coffee truck a chance to progress quickly. We like to think that each person who helps promote or fund our business, will feel empowered knowing they have helped two people build their dream. Ultimately, our goal is $60,000, which helps cover the cost of the truck, business licensing, registrations, product, insurance.

Of course, any amount donated can help. If $1 is all  you can give, then we are eternally grateful. If you want to give us a full lump sum of our $60,000 goal, that's OK too. We won't stop you. Either way, please share this campaign with your friends and family, the more that people see it, the better chances at success we can have.  Please and Thank you! 'Cause they're the magic words.

Coffee wasn't meant to be boring. Help us keep it fun!

story:
My name is Victoria and I'm an artist. I've always been into creating, for an audience, online, or through making something with my hands. I knew I was destined to make a living doing something that involved creating. This campaign is to help make this dream a reality! Your donations will help me create my designs but also to help promote and sell them as well. By donating you will also get something in return!

My goal is to reach $500.00. The money will go to help buy the supplies to get me started making the products plus business cards to help promote my line. If you donate you will get a something from the line depending on your donation. I will continue to do my best to make the line even if I don't make my funding goal. You will still get what you donated for no matter what the outcome.

If you can't make a donation I totally understand. If you spread the word and share this then you still made a contribution to getting me closer to my goal. 

Thank you for taking the time to stop by and check out my campaign!

story:
Hello Backers/Supporters,

I'm on Indiegogo seeking crowdfunding for a product that I personally created and later perfected with the help of my friends and family members. 

I'm seeking $75,000 to help with the development, manufacturing, marketing, advertising and operation cost for our invention, Buffet Bag On the Go.

I created Buffet Bag On the Go, because I felt there was a strong need to bring families together through food and fresh air LOL, but also because of my grandmother who died of diabetes. 

When I was younger my Grandmother use to give these great big barbecues in front of our apartment building in Harlem. 

Grandma would serve her famous potatoes and macaroni salad, the music would be blasting and everyone would be dancing in the street, like fame. It was absolutely amazing. I truly miss those days.

As we grew older and after my grandmother passed away, we grew apart, but the one thing that has always brought us together was a good outdoor barbecue. 

Now days since we are all older now we barbecue a lot less. Through the years of barbecuing as we aged it seemed like the responsibilities (preparing for outdoor barbecuing) became a lot more. 

The organizing, cooking, cleaning and packing. Getting to our outdoor destination (the park not allowed to barbecue in from of the buildings anymore ) with all our items just seemed like a stressful task.


Buffet Bag On the Go will make family outdoor dining more fun and stress free. My family and I feel that Buffet Bag on the Go will bring families closer together.

If we had the support of backers like you, we could immediately start production on our bags as well as pay for the cost of development, manufacturing, marketing and advertising.

We are hopeful and have faith in God that we will reach our goal.

Contributions from backers/supporters like you, determine how far we go with our product.

If we don't receive backing, all we will have is our prototype and our prototype will not bring families across American and the world closer together.

We are sure there will be numerous hurdles, obstacles and challenges we will have to face when trying to produce our product however we our also sure we will overcome them.

One of those obstacles may be product manufacturing in the USA (something we are highly considering), our manufacturing cost may be slightly higher, therefore we may have limited number of funds for other business cost.

Another obstacle may having a hard time finding a manufacturing company that lives up to our expectations and that can deliver our product on time.

We are very confident that we will deal with any issues that may transpire, accurately and efficiently.

If you cannot contribute financially to our campaign, we kindly ask that you share our campaign on your social media page(s).

We sincerely thank you again for all your help and support.

story:
What is 8-Bit Retro?

8-Bit Retro will be Concord's first Arcade Bar. I plan to feature amazing food, great brews (domestic, imported, and craft) on tap and classic arcade games.

I started working on this idea a little under a year ago, and now feel I am ready to make this happen. I have a really great team of talented people helping, but to get us over the hump I need the help of Concord!

Many of us have been gaming lovers since before we can remember. For my team and I, this will be a dream come true and the greatest job we could possibly hope for. For Concord, this will be a fun and interactive bar where you can play classic arcade games, try the latest in local craft beers (along with domestic and imported) along with weekly promotions like trivia, tournaments and so much more!!

We think Concord needs more locally owned and unique places like 8 Bit, with your donations, we can make this a reality! The idea of doing this grassroots style is we wanted the bar to be a part of the community; to work with as many local businesses, friends, artists and groups as we can to really make 8-Bit a place that feels like home.We  all live here and we love this city. 8-Bit will be our contribution to the city that we love.

What We Need & What You Get

I've got a few games and I'm continuing to hunt down more. What we need from you is some extra funding so that we can pay for the other necessities of opening a bar. We need a space, a bar, tables, chairs, bathrooms, coolers, and initial inventory (you know, the beer!)

With your help, Concord can have a unique place to go that is different from any other night club or bar than what we currently have. Let's get these games into a place where everyone (over 21, sorry) can come and play them!

The Impact

Concord is trying to grow and is developing into a better city every day and 8-Bit wants to be a part of this growth; I also want to help develop a market I feel needs improving. The Arcade. 

Arcades are getting harder and harder to find, the classics have basically disappeared from the public eye. Today, most of them are either collecting dust in warehouses or in the basements of collectors' homes, with your help we can bring these (lost treasures) (golden relics) (hidden treasures) back into the limelight for Concord and the surrounding communities to enjoy.

Putting them in a bar is really a no-brainer. After all, arcade games have been found in bars since their conception. We want to provide that experience for people again.

Risks & Challenges

Of course, owning and operating a bar is a risky business venture. I have been around the city and in other cities talking with bar owners, arcade bar owners, small business owners and anyone else who I thought could give me some insight. I'm confident that my team and I have what it takes to run a successful bar.

I think our number one challenge will be keeping these classic machines in working order. For this reason, I have created a network of expert gaming techs who know the insides and outs of these beloved machines. 

Low on Funds? That's OK! 

It really is ok! Any contribution will do. Also, helping us get the word helps us in a major way. The more people that know about this project, the better. Just telling your friends helps us get closer to achieving our goals. Every dollar counts, every contribution helps, and we truly appreciate any help you can throw our way! We will be stretching our dollars as far as we can to make this a reality. With your help, we can do this!

Thank you from the 8-Bit Retro Team!

story:
Steve Jobs once said that “A lot of times people don’t know what they want until you show it to them.” And so it befalls the innovator to create products that customers don’t necessarily need, per se, but will want once the developer creates a desire.

This revolutionary device completely transforms the beer drinking experience by maintaining the head (aroma) throughout the beer. It uses a finely calibrated, ultrasonic vibration to activate the gases and create consistent sized bubbles. The science behind a foamed beer is that over 75% of what you taste is in your sense of smell, a foamed head will bring out the flavor of beers to delight and amaze beer lovers.

 

How does it work?

It comes in handy when you leave your beer out for too long and it loses its froth. Pour two teaspoons of water in the activation tray, switch it on, place your drink on the tray and you can see the bubbles rise up.

The beer gets its head back. The Sonic Foamer uses ultrasonic vibrations to create the perfect head to enhance the aroma and flavor.   As a result, it ensures consistent taste throughout and delivers the ultimate aromatic experience.

Through the burst of an ultrasonic wave, the beer immediately brings forth a quick cascade of bubbles created from the bottom of the glass, rising up to form a great looking, uniform head on your beer. 

The Sonic Foamer looks like an electronic coaster. It has two buttons for operation towards the front. There is also a multi-colored LED light under the front face which allows you to change the color as it works.

 

Every time you share the Sonic Foamer on social media you will help educate beer drinkers throughout the world. Support Sonic Foamer by taking 2 seconds to share with your friends!         

What is the press saying about the Sonic Foamer?         

The product has received rave reviews from CNET, Beer Advocate, and The Hop Review. In addition, the product has been featured on the Jay Leno show and is scheduled to be featured on additional shows this fall. The product is also currently selling at the Sonic Foamer website.

"Definitely a tech gadget that works and is a crowd pleaser." The Food Network 

“The aromas...more enveloping and enjoyable than those poured into a glass." We Like Drinking 

"If you really really love a frothy beer, then it could be for you." The Brew News

 

Aleheads – aren’t we all? - Brother Barley

Roadtested the Sonic Foamer - Australian Brews News

Home Brew Answers - Home Brew

Who needs a Sonic Foamer?

People who love great beer.

People who love gadgets. 

People who like to impress others at parties. 

People who want to maximize the flavor while they drink their beer. 

The Sonic foamer creates the perfect head to enhance the aromas and flavors. As a result, it ensures consistent taste throughout and delivers the ultimate aromatic experience.  

 

Sonic Foamer to the Rescue! 

CALLING ALL BEER DRINKERS.

 

 

Risks and challenges

Every Crowdfunding campaign has its risks and challenges.

Sonic Foamer production has already started. A portion of the money we raise here will go to fund the production of more Sonic foamers.  Another portion of our funding will be used to grow our Sonic Foamer team to meet production demands.

Another challenge and part of funding will be used in getting the word out through social media, Bloggers, and retailers. We have worked hard over the last year to reach Beer advocates and key bloggers to get their feedback which has been incredible so far. We want to continue building these relationships and plan accordingly. We expect to hit all of our delivery deadlines.

Initial Goals: 
1.AWARENESS - Increase visibility and awareness for the Sonic Foamer online. 
2.ACTION – Engage, excite and drive beer enthusiasts to the product website for more information and purchase. 
3.ADVOCACY - Generate online press and influential users to talk about the Sonic Foamer.

FAQ:

Why do I want a head on my beer?

Beer foam is important for two reasons. First, the bubbles popping is what releases the aroma of the beer. What you smell is a large part of what you taste when you consume anything including beer. The second reason is the foam creates a barrier that keeps the beer from oxygen. Once the beer is exposed to oxygen, it allows the active yeasts and other living organisms to grow and literally eat your beer. This will reduce the taste and flavor.

Does it work on all types of Beer?

The SF works on any beer that you can pour and has a normal frothy head. It does not create a head on a beer that does not normally have a head or if it has a Champagne type head (Example: Barley Wine, Lambic etc.)

Does it work with any glass?

No, it works best with a pub type glass with a flat bottom that is not thick. The glass should also not be stemmed. The base of the glass must fit flat with full contact to the activation tray.

Does the beer Temperature matter?

There are correct temperatures to serve every kind of beer. These temperatures are available on line from many sites. If you serve a beer too cold, the gases will contract and there will be less foam. If the beer is served too warm, the gases will expand and too much foam will be produced.

Will the SF flatten my beer?

The SF is designed to manage the foam on your beer. It should only be used when you need more foam. There is a limited amount of gases in any beer. If you activate the gases too many times, ultimately the beer will go flat. Usually, you should not use the SF more than two or three times for any one beer.

Why do I put water in the tray?

The SF uses finely calibrated, ultrasonic sound waves to create beer foam. It is a safe sound that humans cannot hear. All sound is a vibration. By putting water in the tray, it contains the sound waves or vibrations and directs them into the glass. Without the water, the SF will not work.

What is the light for?

The light is mostly fun and decorative. It does however change to a white light when the tray is activated. The second button to the left on top of the unit allows you to change the primary blinking color to different colors.

Should I test the SF before pouring a full glass?

Yes, always test each beer you plan to use the SF on. This will allow you to see the reaction of that specific beer. Brewers are putting a lot of new ingredients into beers. Some of them have additives like wheat that naturally promotes more foam. They will have a bigger reaction. We suggest that you pour about two fingers of beer in the glass to test before pouring a full beer. Note: Look up a two finger shot, if you don’t know what that means.

Should I pour to the top of the glass?

Never. Always leave room for the aroma. It is strange that everyone has been taught how to pour a nice glass of wine. You know to not pour to the top to leave room for the aroma. It is the same for a good beer.

Why doesn't my SF work?

Here are possible reasons: 
· No batteries 
· No water in the tray 
· Wrong type of beer that does not foam normally. 
· Wrong type of glass that is either too thick at the base or does not contact the tray (like a stemmed glass). 
· Your beer is too cold
story_txt:
Steve Jobs once said that “A lot of times people don’t know what they want until you show it to them.” And so it befalls the innovator to create products that customers don’t necessarily need, per se, but will want once the developer creates a desire.
This revolutionary device completely transforms the beer drinking experience by maintaining the head (aroma) throughout the beer. It uses a finely calibrated, ultrasonic vibration to activate the gases and create consistent sized bubbles. The science behind a foamed beer is that over 75% of what you taste is in your sense of smell, a foamed head will bring out the flavor of beers to delight and amaze beer lovers.

 
How does it work?
It comes in handy when you leave your beer out for too long and it loses its froth. Pour two teaspoons of water in the activation tray, switch it on, place your drink on the tray and you can see the bubbles rise up.
The beer gets its head back. The Sonic Foamer uses ultrasonic vibrations to create the perfect head to enhance the aroma and flavor.   As a result, it ensures consistent taste throughout and delivers the ultimate aromatic experience.
Through the burst of an ultrasonic wave, the beer immediately brings forth a quick cascade of bubbles created from the bottom of the glass, rising up to form a great looking, uniform head on your beer. 
The Sonic Foamer looks like an electronic coaster. It has two buttons for operation towards the front. There is also a multi-colored LED light under the front face which allows you to change the color as it works.

 
Every time you share the Sonic Foamer on social media you will help educate beer drinkers throughout the world. Support Sonic Foamer by taking 2 seconds to share with your friends!         

What is the press saying about the Sonic Foamer?         
The product has received rave reviews from CNET, Beer Advocate, and The Hop Review. In addition, the product has been featured on the Jay Leno show and is scheduled to be featured on additional shows this fall. The product is also currently selling at the Sonic Foamer website.
"Definitely a tech gadget that works and is a crowd pleaser." The Food Network 
“The aromas...more enveloping and enjoyable than those poured into a glass." We Like Drinking 
"If you really really love a frothy beer, then it could be for you." The Brew News


 
Aleheads – aren’t we all? - Brother Barley
Roadtested the Sonic Foamer - Australian Brews News
Home Brew Answers - Home Brew
Who needs a Sonic Foamer?
People who love great beer.
People who love gadgets. 
People who like to impress others at parties. 
People who want to maximize the flavor while they drink their beer. 
The Sonic foamer creates the perfect head to enhance the aromas and flavors. As a result, it ensures consistent taste throughout and delivers the ultimate aromatic experience.  

 
Sonic Foamer to the Rescue! 
CALLING ALL BEER DRINKERS.

 

 
Risks and challenges
Every Crowdfunding campaign has its risks and challenges.
Sonic Foamer production has already started. A portion of the money we raise here will go to fund the production of more Sonic foamers.  Another portion of our funding will be used to grow our Sonic Foamer team to meet production demands.
Another challenge and part of funding will be used in getting the word out through social media, Bloggers, and retailers. We have worked hard over the last year to reach Beer advocates and key bloggers to get their feedback which has been incredible so far. We want to continue building these relationships and plan accordingly. We expect to hit all of our delivery deadlines.
Initial Goals: 1.AWARENESS - Increase visibility and awareness for the Sonic Foamer online. 2.ACTION – Engage, excite and drive beer enthusiasts to the product website for more information and purchase. 3.ADVOCACY - Generate online press and influential users to talk about the Sonic Foamer.
FAQ:
Why do I want a head on my beer?
Beer foam is important for two reasons. First, the bubbles popping is what releases the aroma of the beer. What you smell is a large part of what you taste when you consume anything including beer. The second reason is the foam creates a barrier that keeps the beer from oxygen. Once the beer is exposed to oxygen, it allows the active yeasts and other living organisms to grow and literally eat your beer. This will reduce the taste and flavor.
Does it work on all types of Beer?
The SF works on any beer that you can pour and has a normal frothy head. It does not create a head on a beer that does not normally have a head or if it has a Champagne type head (Example: Barley Wine, Lambic etc.)
Does it work with any glass?
No, it works best with a pub type glass with a flat bottom that is not thick. The glass should also not be stemmed. The base of the glass must fit flat with full contact to the activation tray.
Does the beer Temperature matter?
There are correct temperatures to serve every kind of beer. These temperatures are available on line from many sites. If you serve a beer too cold, the gases will contract and there will be less foam. If the beer is served too warm, the gases will expand and too much foam will be produced.

If you activate the gases too many times, ultimately the beer will go flat. Usually, you should not use the SF more than two or three times for any one beer.

What is the light for?
The light is mostly fun and decorative. It does however change to a white light when the tray is activated. The second button to the left on top of the unit allows you to change the primary blinking color to different colors.
Should I test the SF before pouring a full glass?
Yes, always test each beer you plan to use the SF on. This will allow you to see the reaction of that specific beer. Brewers are putting a lot of new ingredients into beers. Some of them have additives like wheat that naturally promotes more foam. They will have a bigger reaction. We suggest that you pour about two fingers of beer in the glass to test before pouring a full beer. Note: Look up a two finger shot, if you don’t know what that means.
Should I pour to the top of the glass?
Never. Always leave room for the aroma. It is strange that everyone has been taught how to pour a nice glass of wine. You know to not pour to the top to leave room for the aroma. It is the same for a good beer.
Why doesn't my SF work?
Here are possible reasons: · No batteries · No water in the tray · Wrong type of beer that does not foam normally. · Wrong type of glass that is either too thick at the base or does not contact the tray (like a stemmed glass). · Your beer is too cold

story:
Hello, I`m Mr. Hickman. The proud founder of Black Rose Corp. I was born and raised in NYC the mecca of sneakers some may argue. While living in the city one thing almost never changed. The fact that you can and will get your fresh pair of J`s dirty. Whether it be someone accidently stepping on them while riding on the subway and even riding in crowded buses. Along with everyday wear and tear, whether you`re pounding the pavement in the city or jogging in the burbs. The beating your shoes take is an unfortunate but inevitable occurrence. But it can be a manageable occurrence.

With the aforementioned events occurring throughout everyday life. Black Rose Corp wants to provide a service that will help people not have to break the bank in those situations by spending money they don’t necessarily have. Especially if those shoes consist of any Yeezy boosts, Jordans, and even Addidas ultra boosts. By contributing to the campaign. You can help create a service that can help everyday people manage the ever changing world and ever more expensive world of athleisure fashion. Let’s face it, nothing is getting cheaper. And being able to hold onto your 1 or 2 pairs of high end sneakers just that much longer. Can definitely help you the reader and others keep more money in your pockets.

I`m sure you want to know how much funding will be needed to achieve greatness. $5,000.00 at the very least is what will be needed in contributions. This will go to helping Black Rose Corp getting fully incorporated. Buying much needed and more supplies. What kind of supplies you`re wondering? Well paints and dye`s that will be used for custom and refurbishing work, from known and trusted companies like Angelus direct. Airbrush kit that will also be used for custom work. Athleisure cleaning supplies from known and trusted companies like Reshoevn8r. An ecommerce site will also be implemented with the use of your contributions.

Even if you are unable to contribute monetarily at the moment. Getting the word out can be just as valuable a resource. Word of mouth is an intangible gold that must not be taken for granted.

story:
Hey everyone, Hasan is like a brother for many of us and because of everything that's happened, he is at risk of losing his bar. Hasan has dedicated so much to this project and it's a place many expatriates call home.

He is now in Sweden finishing a project which makes things even harder for him. No amount is too little and anything can help Hasan and the bar get back to its normal operating condition.

The money will be used to pay the rent and fix some deficiencies in the ventilation system along with revamping the kitchen a bit so that food delivery start up. Unfortunately, the funds are needed within 1 week because after that, the landlord will nullify the rental agreement which will mean losing the bar.

I would be so grateful that even if you don't know Hasan, you could still kick a little something towards this fundraiser because he is the most decent human being I know and he does not deserve to see his hard work disappear from under him.

story:
Background

Howdy!  My name is Raven and I created the cleaning products lovingly referred to as Pyoure.  I am a lawyer by trade, but please don't hold that against me.  By the time I saw the light, I was already $100k in student loan debt and figured I might as well have a go at salvaging my degree.  

I started Pyoure, not because I liked to clean, but because I hated it.  I hated the time it took out of my day, and I especially hated the guilt I felt as I sprayed the toxic solutions throughout my house.    Funny enough, I equally detest it when things around me are dirty.  You can imagine my torture.  

To ease my cleaning pain, I began to search for something that would make my own cleaning routine green, enjoyable, and go a lot faster.  The cleaning products that are on the market today just suck.  They're full of toxic chemicals that poison our families and waterways, the packaging is excessive, and they smell boring.  The only other alternative to these problems was to make your own green cleaning products.  The DIY recipes on the internet were green, but they didn't clean worth crap, and I couldn't trust the end product on the really tough jobs like when a family member got sick.

So I started to tinker (and I looooove to tinker), and ended up creating a concentrated product that combined hydrogen peroxide with organic detergents and beautiful fragrances.  I chose hydrogen peroxide because it is as effective at killing household germs as bleach, but it safely breaks down into oxygen and water when it's finished.  

I started using this new creation in my own home for everyday cleaning in addition to the occasional bout of diarrhea and vomiting that my two beautiful children would bestow upon me.  Surprisingly, sicknesses in my household didn't spread!  I also gave some away to my friends and neighbors who loved it and encouraged me to sell them online.  

This past January 2016 I opened an online store and we started selling Pyoure products to the masses!  Our customers love Pyoure and have consistently given it 5 star ratings across the board (and let me just say that we have the most loyal, encouraging, and all-around amazing customers on the planet).  Our customers have repeatedly raved about how Pyoure has drastically improved their cleaning routines because it cleans so well and smells so good.   (I highly recommend you check out our website and read the product reviews for yourself at www.PyoureCleaning.com.  None of the reviews were paid for or compensated in any way.)

Here's what makes Pyoure extra special:

  • Our cleaning products contain zero toxic ingredients.
  • Pyoure uses hydrogen peroxide to safely kill germs without harming our waterways.
  • Pyoure takes the guess work out of environmentally friendly, non-toxic cleaning.
  • We offer the largest variety of unique non-toxic scents that freshen your space for hours.
  • We are constantly innovating and have created an exclusive line of products:
    • sprayable hydrogen peroxide cleaning gel
    • designer reusable glass spray bottles that not only offer UV light protection, but are guaranteed to not chip or fade
  • Our soaps are organic and ultra concentrated.
  • Our skin-safe fragrances are beautifully complex, and are the same premium grade as those used in perfumes and body sprays.
  • Most of our finished products are concentrated.  This saves valuable cabinet space and allows the user to customize the strength of the cleaner based on their needs.
  • Pyoure reduces waste by using minimal packaging that is 100% recyclable.

What We Need

Pyoure products are wonderful, but we want to make them even better by doing the following:

  • Expanding our product line by adding specialized products for toilets, grout, carpet, and laundry
  • Adding biodegradable hydrogen peroxide wipes
  • Adding more premium custom fragrances that are cosmetic grade and phthalate free
  • Reducing our packaging even further by adding bigger and more concentrated quantities, and exploring additional biodegradable options
  • Improving our bottle filling equipment to stream-line the process
  • Improving our administrative tools such as label printers, software, computers, camera, shelves, and carts

Folks, all of this costs a LOT of money, but your funding will help us get there! 

What You Get

Ahhh.  Finally the good part!  If you invest your money with Pyoure, in return you will get some really awesome cleaning products.  Since you're going to needs cleaning products in the near future anyways, this is a pretty sweet deal!  Just one 8-ounce Concentrate will last approximately 2 to 3 weeks.  But beware, once you start using our products, you won't want to use any other cleaning product again.  

You will also receive a discount that you can use an unlimited amount of times, for the entire year of 2017, on absolutely anything on our website.   This is huge because we use discounts SPARINGLY.  And when I say sparingly, I mean almost never, and certainly not to this magnitude.   The only thing that I ask is that you use the discount code for only one household, but you're more than welcome to give it away as a gift.

Finally, two of the perks include a funny t-shirt, designed by moi.  (You can tell from the t-shirt that I have a slightly raunchy sense of humor, but if you met me in person you would think that I am the most boring person on the face of the earth.  I guess the raunch only comes out when I write.  Muahahahahah....)

Please note that legally, we can only ship products containing hydrogen peroxide within the lower 48 states.  If you are in Hawaii or Alaska, please choose the "Overseas Perk."   Don't worry, this perk is just as cool as the others, just without the hydrogen peroxide.

We will start shipping packages out absolutely no later than February 1, 2017, but I anticipate we may start before that.   Your packages will be well in hand in time for your spring cleaning!  If you want some of our products sooner than that, you are welcome to place an order through our website www.PyoureCleaning.com (mention Indiegogo in your order notes and we'll be sure to hook you up).  

All of the discount codes will be emailed by January 5, 2017.

Scents we offer:

  • French Soap
  • Bamboo Verbena
  • Coconut Lime
  • Sandalwood Apple
  • Laundry Day
  • Fragrance Free
  • Winter Spice
  • Cherry Blossom
  • Ginger Citrus Mint
  • Seaside Bloom
  • Sweetheart Bouquet
  • White Tea & Ginger

Perks Offered:

 

Risks & Challenges

Fortunately for you, there is little risk involved since a majority of our products already exist and we are fulfilling orders daily.   We manufacture and ship all of our cleaning products ourselves, and we do not have any of our items drop-shipped by another manufacturer.  

Of course it will suck if we don't receive all of our funding, but it will not prevent any of the perks from being shipped out.  It will just mean that it will take a bit longer for us to bring our new products to market.  All of the products in the perks are existing products.

If we get inundated with backers, that would be a dream come true.  But a large influx may mean some backers will experience a delay getting their packages.  But rest assured, regardless of the number of backers, we will still start shipping packages out no later than February 1, 2017, and everyone should have their rewards in time for spring cleaning. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that's cool - you can help us get the word out about our campaign!  There are so many good people out there looking for healthy ways to clean their homes, and Pyoure might just be the ticket.  Use the Indiegogo share tools and help us make some noise!

Regardless, thanks for reading this, and thank you for your support!

story:
We need your help.

My name is Chuck Borden and i have been working  as a stuntman for over 30 years,
Together with my wife Karin we started Stuntcamp 3 years ago, 
Where kids and adults can experience for a day the life of a stuntman!
Seeing kids do stunts and enjoying it and feeling great about their achievements, that is, for me the main reason to keep Stuntcamp going. We started of in a rough financial period but we are getting there!

We are trying to give Stuntcamp a boost with a commercial broadcasted nationally in the Netherlands. This will give us exposure and more and more bookings like kidsparties and school trips.

With your donation we will pay a young excited production team, the editors of the commercial,  the broadcast network and a small part for upgrading our website.
After broadcasting we expect to get busy!!

This also means some job oppurtunities for young men/woman who aspire a career in Stunts.

story:
Who we are:

Digital Beachhead is comprised of two military veterans; Mike Crandall, CEO and Principal Owner is a Service Disabled Combat Veteran with over 20 years active duty military service and Howard Zach, President and Co-Owner is a 7 year military service veteran.   After retiring from the military in 2010 Mike went to work for a large IT Government contracting company where he met Howard who has over 20 years of Government contracting experience.

After multiple corporate mergers and acquisitions we found ourselves unemployed and looking for "what's next".   Looking at available job opportunities we decided that our working relationship, knowledge of the field and connections we had garnered over the years the best opportunity would be to take the leap and venture out on our own.  This is how Digital Beachhead was formed.  

Since the formation of our company less than a year ago we have had the same finance issue repeat itself and is the reason we have ventured into crowd funding for support.  Working capital to pay employees while we wait for the Government to pay the company is the long pole in our small business tent.   Your support towards our goal means that we can bid on larger contracts which in turn will allow us to employ more people.   You will be supporting a Veteran's Administration Certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) AND all those we can employ because of that same support.   

In short, your support in what ever amount goes directly to supporting a small business grow and allowing us to hire more people in areas around the country thus supporting the community as a whole.

What We Need & Why

Currently, Digital Beachhead is limited in the size of contract we can pursue due to operational income.  As owners we have had to fund our operations out of pocket as banks are unwilling to loan monies because we have no collateral.  Since we are looking for business loans we are unable to even put our own homes up as collateral and the business itself has no assets.  No donation is too small.

As a Government contractor our job is to bid on contracts the Government puts out via a number of sources.  Our focus is on IT and other Professional Services which means we would be hiring people to fulfill the requirements of the Government as outlined in their Request for Proposal/Quote.   We are competitive in this market as we have low overhead costs as a small business and due to our experience understand how to respond to these Government requests. 

Our biggest concern is covering our employees salaries while we await the Government to make its first payment to the company.  As an example; if we were to win a contract that hired 10 IT professionals at $80,000 a year we would need roughly $112,000 a year per employee to cover salary, taxes, benefits etc.   This equates to $1,120,000 to cover a year worth of salaries and expenses.  Sounds great you say and we agree, however, the problem is the first 90 days of the contract.  

Starting day one of the contract the company is responsible, of course, for paying the employees.  The Government, however, does not pay in advance but instead at the 30 day mark allows for the first invoice to be submitted.  So Digital Beachhead is responsible for paying for those first 30 days before we are even allowed to invoice the Government.   If the Government is on time we could expect payment within 30 days.  In other words by the time we are sending our SECOND invoice we may get payment for the first.  This means the company has now paid for 60 days of our employees salaries before we see any return from the Government.  Our experience shows that is often is closer to 60 days before payment and thus 90 days total required in cash available in order to support a contract of this size.  With the scenario above we need roughly $94,000 a month to cover payroll for 2 to 3 months or a maximum of $280,000 before we see any return from the Government. 

As you can imagine this is not something we have readily available.  Our first thought was to gain loans from the bank.  We know that once the contract is awarded the funds WILL be forthcoming from the Government we simply need the upfront cash infusion to cover expenses until the invoices start getting paid.  Banks, however, do not see a signed Government contract as collateral for repayment.  

Worst case scenario is that the Government cancels the contract for what ever reason earlier than expected.  The employees stop working yet the time they have worked is still covered and paid by the Government so invoices will be paid 30 to 60 days AFTER the stop of work which covers any/all costs.  In other words, no risk to the investment.

We are seeking a portion of the scenario estimate in this campaign.  Currently we have smaller  contracts that we have won which have taken most of our working capital.  These contracts, while showing our ability to succeed have impacted our ability to go for larger 10+ employee contracts.  Any monies gained from this campaign are going to go directly into our operational budget to cover employee costs upon contract award.  

The Impact

Supporting this campaign is supporting Veterans.  Currently 100% of our employees are military veterans.  While we know this may not be possible to achieve going forward on larger contracts, as veterans ourselves we remained focused on hiring veterans when/where possible. Your donation also directly supports a Veteran's Administration Certified Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business.  Your support allows us to go after larger contracts so that we may hire more employees and grow into a company that can give back and help the next generation of veterans as they transition into the civilian work force. 

While Digital Beachhead is new to the Government arena the owners have worked this space for over 25 years on both sides of the equation.  We are certified by the Veteran's Administration and have won small government contracts within our first year.  

We ask for your support in our venture to grow so that we in turn can give back to those who have served.  Any support is appreciated and ALL proceeds will go to winning future bids and the hiring of new employees.  If we can get a small donation from a large number of people then our dream can become a reality.  No donation is too small.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not support with a donation please forward to those you know.  Help us spread the word to make this campaign successful.   If you work withing the Government and know of future contracts we may have the opportunity to bid on please do forward those to us as well. 

Your support is appreciated!!!  Thank you for taking the time to read over our campaign.

story:
Coming to Brookings, SD in April, 2019!!

Have you been looking for a unique yet affordable activity to do with your friends? Well, put your party shoes on and pedal with us on Bum's Bike & Brew (BBB).

Bum's Bike & Brew is Brookings' first & only party bike that gives pedalers a fun perspective of our downtown district. Our 14-person, human-powered, bar on wheels is here to expand the activity selection the Brookings community has to offer. 

Booking a party bike tour with Bum's Bike & Brew reserves the entire bike for you and your party for 2 hours. BBB provides a sober driver for you throughout the tour. A minimum of 8 pedaling passengers is required. 

** Photos/videos courtesy of Cycle Pub-Bend, OR & Black Hills Party Pedaler-Rapid City, SD**

 

 

 

 

Why Support Us? 

BBB is all about community involvement so we wanted to give you an opportunity to contribute to a new, local venture from the very beginning. As a thank you, we have created some incredible perks in return for your generous support. These perks are the best deals you'll be able to get on BBB tours all year! 

 

The Bike: 

Party bikes were invented in the Netherlands in 1997. The bikes made their way to the U.S. in 2006 and have been becoming increasingly popular.

Bum's Bike & Brew's party bike is currently being built in Bend, OR by a reliable and experienced manufacturer. BBB's party bike is estimated to arrive in Brookings around the end of March, beginning of April.

While a minimum of 8-pedaling passengers pedal their way through Brookings' downtown district, our owner will be steering you and your party to a good time. Not only will our sober pilot drive for you, they are also responsible for using our brake pedal to override your pedaling when we need the bike to stop. So you don't need to worry about having to drive the bike, we have professionals for that. 

 

The Brews: 

BBB will have beverages available for pedalers to purchase when they arrive for their tour. We plan to have an extensive beverage selection for our pedalers to choose from.  

Below is our current Brew Menu to use as a reference for now. Let us know if you have a specific beverage you'd like us to add to the menu and we'll see what we can do to make it happen! 

 

 

The Boss:

Jessica Herrboldt owns Bum's Bike & Brew. She was inspired to start BBB because growing up in a small town, her and her friends had to get creative when they wanted to have fun. Now that Jessica has grown up, graduated from college and started working, she noticed Brookings could use more outdoor activities for adults to participate in. 

 

The Background: 

The idea to bring a party bike to Brookings was conceptualized at a 1 Million Cups-Brookings meeting we attended in the spring of 2018. After hearing a local bicycle shop present, we started brainstorming what bike related service Brookings was missing, and BAM, the idea for Bum's Bike & Brew was born.

 

Other ways to be a BBB Backer: 

We understand that some people might want contribute in other, non-financial, ways. You can show your support by spreading the word about Bum's Bike & Brew and this campaign to anyone and everyone you know on Facebook and Instagram. 

 

 

In the Community:

Party by bike - The Brookings Register Article

 

 

 

Bum's Bike & Brew Interview

Owner, Jess Herrboldt talks about bringing BBB to Brookings with Shane Andersen from Century 21 Brookings Home Team - Krogman & Co. Real Estate. 

 

 

 

 

Council approves pedal cars - The Brookings Register Article

Commemorating City Council's approval of pedal-cars operating in Brookings with a photo of a few of those who helped make it happen. 

From left to right: Councilman Oepke Niemeyer, BBB owner, Jess Herrboldt, City Manger Paul Briseno, Councilwoman Patty Bacon, and Major Keith Corbett.

 

 

 

Party Bike Coming to Brookings - KELOLAND News

story:
Hi everyone,

Trisha and I are the new owners of The Clubhouse. When we took over in February, we had hoped that we could make the changes necessary to keep it up and running for our community. We have been working diligently and believe that we are slowly getting there, but as some of you know, we have been struggling and there is quite a bit over-head and many expenses. The bills are starting to add up and we are moving into slow months for our business. We are not ready to give up and close the doors, as we know that the community needs a place like The Clubhouse, so we’ve decided to appeal to our community for help keeping it open.

Let me explain in more detail why we decided to do this campaign.

When we decided to step up (and try to be heroines) and rescue The Clubhouse from closing, we didn’t realize how difficult it was actually going to be. We were (and still are) full of excitement and great ideas, but implementing them is proving to be difficult. Changes to improve a business takes money, and unfortunately the government is not making it easy for two working moms to get approved for a business loan. This is why we have come down to our last chance; asking you – our community – for help. It’s you who understand the value and importance of keeping this little gem alive and running in our town. We have met some amazing people and families in the few short months since becoming owners, and you have expressed your gratitude to us for taking it over and how much The Clubhouse means to you. Please help us put those words and emotions into action! With your help and support, we can keep The Clubhouse open.

We know that it sounds like a lot, but the reason we have set the amount at $15, 000 is that it will help us cover rent and utilities through September, when business starts to pick up again. We are confident that with this head start we will finally be able to get our feet on the ground and run with our amazing ideas, to make The Clubhouse even better in the fall. We are heading into nicer weather and business slows down significantly when kids can spend time outside again, and parents choose to have backyard parties. But remember, The Clubhouse is still a great place to come and play in the summer as well, as we have air conditioning, WiFi, and an outside area with toys, water/sand table and a large open grassy area where the bounce house will be set up from time to time. This is where we plan to put some of the funding raised to use. There is so much we can do with this outside space so it will be somewhere you can come and enjoy all year round, inside and out. Our dream is to have a place that kids and parents will want to come even in the nice weather, a place with access to fun stuff for kids, access to washrooms, appliances, running water, and to come in if it gets too hot or starts to rain. It will also be a

great option for birthday parties, if you want have to have it outside but would like have the inside as a backup plan for inclement weather.

Last Ditch Effort

So again, this is our last resort, our final pleas for help to save this amazing place. Every little bit helps. Ask yourself, what does The Clubhouse mean to you and your family. We know some of you have met lifetime friends here; my daughter who is two has met her bff here, too. As a parent, there is nothing more exciting than watching a friendship develop. We also know a lot of you meet here as a hallway place with friends who live far away. Many of you have had your child (or children’s) birthday party with us, and priceless memories have been made here. There is nothing like The Clubhouse; we have a special and unique space that provides so much more to the community than just a place to go.

Our vision is to increase employment, support other local small businesses, sponsor and support the schools and sports teams, and so much more. Please help us keep this dream alive. We know that it is achievable especially with your help. Since we took ownership over 4 months ago, we have been able to increase Facebook members by over 300 people; we have been marketing, advertising, and promoting like crazy, and we have many more amazing ideas we are ready to start implementing. We know our efforts have had a positive impact in helping The Clubhouse grow and be recognized by those who hadn’t discovered us yet. Unfortunately, it just hasn’t been quite enough, which, again, is why we have decided to try this crowd fundraiser.

We also understand that not everyone is in the financial position to support monetarily. Even by sharing this campaign and sharing your story about why The Clubhouse is so important to you would help immensely. Word of mouth is so important, especially in a small community like ours.

We have been completely transparent about why we are doing this campaign, what we will be doing with the funds, and how much it means to us. Rest at ease knowing that even when we reach our fundraising goal, we won’t stop working diligently to implement our ideas (and yours), to increase awareness and traffic to The Clubhouse as well as increase revenue to that it will a successful business that can stand on its own and grow.

We thank you so much for taking the time to read through our campaign and we hope with all our support we will all be able to love and enjoy The Clubhouse for decades to come!

From our hearts to yours,

Amy & Trisha

story:
What is a Circus School?

Many teachers will tell you to stop clowning around, but here at the circus school we are doing the complete opposite. We are a circus with a purpose to change peoples lives and inspire social and economic development. The Circus School of Lancaster is an alternative gym that provides classes and events around the circus arts. We want everyone to experience circus on a personal level through exploring their strengths in circus arts training. Each act or skill holds a deeper symbolic meaning that’s beyond just a great exercise experience. 

Not Just for Kids

There is a growing trend of circus arts coming into the gym scene and we are seeing places like Philadelphia, New York, DC and other bigger cities taking on and embracing the expansion of their circus communities. It leaves people from smaller towns, like Lancaster, having to travel up to 2 hours away just to find a gym that accommodates their needs. We already have many different circus communities growing in Lancaster County and what we want to do is bring them all together.  Our focus will be on facilitating community around play and creating a network for people professionally.

Circus for Everyone

Whether you are circus curious, only beginning, or a lifer we will have classes accessible to all levels!

  • Acrobatic Yoga
  • Juggling/Poi
  • Hooping
  • Aerials
  • Handstand training
  • Open Gyms
  • Special Events

And MORE..lots more!

Social Circus

As part of our mission to serve the community we will facilitate social circus events throughout Lancaster, in neighborhoods, street corners, on First Friday, at schools and other institutions. Clowning around and performing circus tricks on streets brings local communities together and starts a conversation on social and political issues. We also want to deliver the message that anyone can do circus, no matter race, size, class or gender.

Children & Youth Workshops

The circus arts transcends all boundaries and pushes physical limitations. It is our belief that through attending these workshops children will be able to explore their strengths in performance arts while accessing their creativity and building up their confidence, discipline and self-esteem.

  • We have already announced 3 different circus camp workshops for this summer! They include hooping, acrobalance and aerials! We want to give a one of a kind circus experience to the youth of Lancaster this summer.

    To learn more CLICK HERE.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The amount raised will go towards ensuring our space at a beautiful co working space in downtown Lancaster, as part of the Lancaster Art Studio. As well as the proper gym equipment to make your circus experience as safe and enjoyable as a circus gym should be. Let's break it down!

The Break Down:

  • $5,000: Basic gym equipment such as, crash mats/tumbling mats, aerial silks, lyra, rigging equipment, flow toys, glow toys, handstand canes
  • $700: Down payment for co-working space at Lancaster Art Studio
  • $200: Basic marketing material such as shirts and print material
  • $200: Insurance coverage for one year

To give an idea of what some of this gym equipment will look like:

We are so excited about our perk opportunities and look forward to having your participation in the circus. And who doesn't like cotton candy?! Win. Win.

Meet the Circus Crew

Sheena Good - Founder
Sheena began her love for movement at an early age when she was accepted for a scholarship at a dance school in Atlanta, GA. After settling down and having twins with her husband she found a new found art in acrobatic yoga. She was able to use her knowledge of movement in a new profound way. Finding AcroYoga has opened the doors to other circus communities and Sheena is looking forward to bringing them all together for Lancaster to enjoy. She believes that everyone should play, no matter what their age!

 

Chris Tamburro
Chris began his circus journey in 2013 as a poi spinner. Since then he has learned several circus skills including, juggling, hooping, fire dancing and his specialty, fire eating. He has traveled and performed throughout Thailand with Spark Circus, a volunteer humanitarian circus project, for the past two years. Now that he has returned he plans to bring the circus arts to Lancaster city with The Circus School of Lancaster and PhosphorEssence Productions.

 

Jenny Hill
Growing up in a theater family, it was natural for Jenny to go into writing and creative writing in college. In 2008 her theatrical upbringing was revived when she found hooping. Since then she has made a career doing clowning, circus-style multi hoop performances, and variety shows, all with one focus: making a real, human connection.

 

Autumn Cornell
Autumn Cornell is a multi talented visual and performance artist. She began her journey in 2011 as a hula hooper and continued on to study belly dance in Portland, OR. While there she began street performing with fire. Fire arts opened the door to many different style of circus performance. Autumn currently teaches aerial hammock at Aerial Fun & Fitness, a student at Philadelphia School of Circus Arts, performs with Fractal Fire, and PhosphorEssence Prodductions. She is excited to share her passion for circus arts with the city of Lancaster.

 

Nick Polini
Nick Polini is a Penn State graduate with a wildlife biology degree. He has been practicing and performing with footbag for 8 years, contact juggling for 1.5 years, and buugeng for about half a year. He loves to perform and entertain people and looks forward to what he can bring to The Circus School of Lancaster.

Kathleen O'Donnell
Kathleen O'Donnell is teacher certified by The Circus Arts Institute and Sky Gym and current performer with The Off Centered Project, and specializes in fabric, chain, and lyra

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page with your friends!
  • Know anyone that may be interested in sponsoring events or donating circus equipment? Bring them our way!
  • Donate any of your old circus toys/equipment that you don't use anymore!

And don't forget to follow us on FACEBOOK for updates!
story_txt:
What is a Circus School?
Many teachers will tell you to stop clowning around, but here at the circus school we are doing the complete opposite. We are a circus with a purpose to change peoples lives and inspire social and economic development. The Circus School of Lancaster is an alternative gym that provides classes and events around the circus arts. We want everyone to experience circus on a personal level through exploring their strengths in circus arts training. Each act or skill holds a deeper symbolic meaning that’s beyond just a great exercise experience. 
Not Just for Kids
There is a growing trend of circus arts coming into the gym scene and we are seeing places like Philadelphia, New York, DC and other bigger cities taking on and embracing the expansion of their circus communities. It leaves people from smaller towns, like Lancaster, having to travel up to 2 hours away just to find a gym that accommodates their needs. We already have many different circus communities growing in Lancaster County and what we want to do is bring them all together.  Our focus will be on facilitating community around play and creating a network for people professionally.

Circus for Everyone
Whether you are circus curious, only beginning, or a lifer we will have classes accessible to all levels!

Acrobatic Yoga
Juggling/Poi
Hooping
Aerials
Handstand training
Open Gyms
Special Events

And MORE..lots more!


Social Circus
As part of our mission to serve the community we will facilitate social circus events throughout Lancaster, in neighborhoods, street corners, on First Friday, at schools and other institutions. Clowning around and performing circus tricks on streets brings local communities together and starts a conversation on social and political issues. We also want to deliver the message that anyone can do circus, no matter race, size, class or gender.
Children & Youth Workshops
The circus arts transcends all boundaries and pushes physical limitations. It is our belief that through attending these workshops children will be able to explore their strengths in performance arts while accessing their creativity and building up their confidence, discipline and self-esteem.
We have already announced 3 different circus camp workshops for this summer! They include hooping, acrobalance and aerials! We want to give a one of a kind circus experience to the youth of Lancaster this summer.To learn more CLICK HERE.


 
What We Need & What You Get
The amount raised will go towards ensuring our space at a beautiful co working space in downtown Lancaster, as part of the Lancaster Art Studio. As well as the proper gym equipment to make your circus experience as safe and enjoyable as a circus gym should be. Let's break it down!
The Break Down:

$5,000: Basic gym equipment such as, crash mats/tumbling mats, aerial silks, lyra, rigging equipment, flow toys, glow toys, handstand canes
$700: Down payment for co-working space at Lancaster Art Studio
$200: Basic marketing material such as shirts and print material
$200: Insurance coverage for one year

To give an idea of what some of this gym equipment will look like:

We are so excited about our perk opportunities and look forward to having your participation in the circus. And who doesn't like cotton candy?! Win. Win.

Finding AcroYoga has opened the doors to other circus communities and Sheena is looking forward to bringing them all together for Lancaster to enjoy. She believes that everyone should play, no matter what their age!

He has traveled and performed throughout Thailand with Spark Circus, a volunteer humanitarian circus project, for the past two years. Now that he has returned he plans to bring the circus arts to Lancaster city with The Circus School of Lancaster and PhosphorEssence Productions.


 
Jenny HillGrowing up in a theater family, it was natural for Jenny to go into writing and creative writing in college. In 2008 her theatrical upbringing was revived when she found hooping. Since then she has made a career doing clowning, circus-style multi hoop performances, and variety shows, all with one focus: making a real, human connection.

Autumn currently teaches aerial hammock at Aerial Fun & Fitness, a student at Philadelphia School of Circus Arts, performs with Fractal Fire, and PhosphorEssence Prodductions. Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with your friends!
Know anyone that may be interested in sponsoring events or donating circus equipment? Bring them our way!
Donate any of your old circus toys/equipment that you don't use anymore!

And don't forget to follow us on FACEBOOK for updates!

story:
What follows is our fund raiser letter which describes the goals for our Founder in Cognito pre-sale, then a summarized vision of Cognito Brewing's place in the existing market.  Please read through, and feel free to contact us if you would like more information.

Dear Friends,

Our approach to brewing began the same way as most - by what we liked in other breweries, and what we wished was available.   Most breweries are great at explaining each of their beers from the basics of what style they are, to the subtle differences that make them unique.  We wanted to take this one step further, and when we found our pilot system, the model emerged.  Our pilot system is a dual, meaning side by side system where two batches can be made at one time.  Ours is 1 barrel on each side which is about 1000 pints of beer total.  

Often when brewers are creating recipes and particularly when they are trying new ingredients or techniques, they make a single change to a batch in order to evaluate just what that change contributes.  You see this on beer lists as a “SMaSH” or “single malt single hop” when the flavor of each is left alone to evaluate, or sometimes just to shine on its own as a success. Our dual system allows us to either try two different new things side by side, or to follow a more empirical model and use one side as a control with no change for comparison.  We, as craft beer customers and brewers were excited about this, and thought that our customers who brew or just want to understand brewing better would likely appreciate it as well.  Our vision is to have paired taps for tasting and to elicit feedback from our customers to help us decide which direction to go with the recipe - kind of a “choose your own adventure” beer. Eventually, after a series of changes, a beer that a lot of people enjoy will be the end result.  When the recipe is perfected, the dual system can be easily switched to cross circulate and make a single 2 barrel batch of the beer we know we want a lot of.  

As luck would have it, Colorado Brewing Systems started making a micro brew sized model of this same system, and it is getting stellar reviews.  We would like to order the 10 barrel version this system to be built and shipped about this time next year, after we prepare the annex portion of the elevator to hold its weight in the fall. Because of the demand for brewhouses, we need to submit that order with sizeable chunk down very soon in order to get it when we want it, and because the timing coincides with the purchase of the building, that’s a slightly challenging task. That, friends, is why we decided to offer lifetime memberships now, before and only before we are open, to our early supporters, at special rates.   We won’t sell lifetime memberships once we are open, so this is a limited opportunity to save big for years to come.  You get an awesome deal, we get to avoid brewing 24 hours a day, and we all get beer. Good idea, no?

Cheers!

Mike, Shanna, Amber, Rich, and Erik

As we built our business plan we reviewed hundreds of brewery models and their business structures.   Several things became clear.  

1. It is a rare brewery that with good beer and solid management can’t succeed.  Brewery start-ups are still launching successfully in places with a dense concentration of breweries like Portland, OR and Grand Rapids, MI, and tiny towns in the middle of nowhere that wouldn't inspire even the most prolific big box store, are the surprising hosts of breweries with busy taphouses.

2. With high population comes high overhead so the idea that breweries are best off in high population density areas like Grand Rapids or summertime South Haven is not necessarily true.  By taking advantage of the very low overhead of a place like Bangor, MI yet benefitting from the populations of neighboring cities and the considerable traffic between them, we have found a relatively low risk model compared to that of breweries paying big city or tourist destination real estate prices.

3. Because the traffic going through Bangor in the summers includes a proportionately high number of tourists going to or from vacations and day trips in South Haven, they are uniquely prepared to be excellent customers. Here's why:

A. They have flexibility with their time.

B. They are generally prepared to spend money

C. Vacationing customers’ money is mentally allotted from the more liberal “leisure budget” vs. the more conservatively managed “grocery budget”.

D. People on vacation tend to be more open to trying something new.

E. They are aware that South Haven food merchants are or will be very busy

 

4. By creating impetus (beyond the speed limit and the train) for these customers to stop, the door is opened for increasing other revenue in Bangor such as gas station, grocery, and leisure shopping sales. Because Cognito will follow the model of all the great breweries by being involved in and supportive of its community, customers will learn about trail town and train tourism and all of the wonderful reasons there are to make Bangor more than a short stop.


3. The existing event rental business of the Bangor Elevator further mitigates the risk of this as a start up with its history of bookings that cover the building expenses with very little marketing.  There is clear room for increasing this revenue with added services, and simply by having the goal of being fully booked.  (Bob didn’t push the bookings because his goal was understandably to cover expenses without it being too much extra work.)  Saturdays in 2017 are currently at 50% booked with signed contracts and deposits, which puts us very close to the break even point for the building expenses, even though we have just begun increased marketing and added services.  

4. There is strong local support for this endeavor, in evidence most recently at our Founder in Cognito party. We are both humbled and impressed by the enthusiasm and wholehearted commitment to our success that the community has shown us.  We saw this at this incredible party, through our social media following, and we see it in the willingness of city officials to work with us.  The decision to call Bangor, MI Cognito Brewery's home has been our foundation in so many respects.  It is the choice we have the most confident in, and that we draw the most positive energy from.   Each day that we spend working within this community, we feel more sure that we are on the right path together.  We promise to follow the lead of great Michigan breweries before us and to be stewards of the community,  a force for meaningful change, and the very best neighbors.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, my name is Geric Sambo and I was born and raised in Curaçao. I had been studying in Dallas since 2013 and just moved back to the island this past May.
  • Unexpectedly, I had to move back home in Curaçao and was in need of a job and quickly realized the shortage of job opportunities that there were on the island. I was aiming for finding a job that I can be more hands on towards tourism and it seemed that nothing was happening. One of my main concern was that I wasn't at peace as to working for someone else, yet this has always been the norm to have a boss, in my perspective. And here I was more and more wanting to start my own business if that were possible. Then I remembered I stumbled into an idea I got when I was living in Dallas of an all organic/ artisan ice pop shop that I had come across and daydreamed of, of starting something similar if I were ever to move back to Curaçao. Starting this business will not only help me business-wise, but I will be able to reach out to the tourists that visit the island as well. ( I will be stationed at the gate of "The Floating Bridge" on the Punda side)
  • Helping me achieve this goal, will not only help me provide for a job and hopefully create more job opportunities for others as well. I also have more ideas on reaching out to the community as well whenever I'm possible to give donations and free ice pops to institutes that have kids who are in need of lots of love and attention and creating a full event for them as well while partnering with different churches and youth groups.

 

What We Need

  • To get things started, I'm asking for $1500 to start with. My biggest purchase is going towards buying an ice cream cart and cold plates to keep the ice pops to freezing temperature. Ice cream carts can cost from $600 to $3500 and this is just based in the U.S. I would still have to ship it to the island. And shipping can cost over $200 which is not even included the price of import tax, which is why my financial goal is "so high" being that I'm "just making ice pops". Other main purchases are: chest freezer for storage and of course making the ice pops to freeze and one buying wood branded popsicle sticks that will definitely make the products stand out and of course packaging for the ice pops. And a high-quality blender for mass quantity production and lastly a Patio Umbrella for setup outside at downtown with the "POPCULTR" cart.
  • The idea is to have a "stand/ice cream cart" setup in downtown, selling and interacting with the locals and the incoming tourists and promoting the island, but as well doing with catering service for corporate events, weddings, birthday parties etc. It's definitely something that has never been done before on the island and I know that it will be a great hit.

 

The Impact

  • I know that POPCULTR will be completely different than the rest of the businesses on the island is, that it's a first of it's kind, making and bringing great quality and an out of this world experience in taste bud's wise customer service wise.
  • I have been studying, researching and working on menu/recipes towards the Gourmet Ice Pop business ever since I've moved back and have set short-term and long-term goals. This is just the beginning of what's more to come in the near future.
  • Once you've donated and given your part and pledge into this vision/business, you are not just making an impact in my own life, but in the lives of everyone that I will encounter and putting a smile on their face and giving them an experience; One ice pop at a time !!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I would love for you to get the word out and make some noise about the "POPCULTR" campaign.
  • Share with at least 5 people that would love support a small business like this: parents, friends and family...all of them !!!
  • Even if you can only support with $20 and share the link with 5 or more people and at least one of them donate, then we will be able to reach our goal so much quicker.

 

  • I can't thank each and everyone of you enough for your patience and all of the love and support and can't wait to reach the goal for this campaign with all of you !!!

story:
Uwe Rath, 25 years in the Dominican Republic, has designed his company Uwescuba for individual, technical and cave diving. In order to make the individuall diving more attractive and stand out completely from the mass of the other diving schools, Uwescuba likes to offer very special day and multi - day tours.  Here some examples:

Day trip for wreck lovers with 4 wrecks in two dives

Multi - day tours for Cave Divers around the island

Day and multi - day tours for virgin reef lovers

Day trip and multi - day tour for large fish lovers

This trips needs a different logistics in transportation and equipment. The dive guests must be transported to the appropriate locations across the country. Depending on the tour the equipment / tanks must be also transported for several days.

An investment of approximately USD 35,000 is necessary to get this business running.

The investments will be:

Transporter with trailer for persons and equipment, transportable compressor, special tank valves (right / left) for sidemount configuration, tanks, diving equipment, rebuilding the trailer as a small diving center. Approvals and insurance.

We certainly not want to give us money and have nothing instead. Depending on the amount of the deposit, we will give you different perks, which can be redeemed by us. If we do something like that, you should have a benefit from it, whether divers or non - divers.

Since most of you are connected to us via the social networks, we will inform you about the progress of the campaign. When we are not reaching the required money, we will try with the money received to start the project until the rest can be financed.

We are very confident that our campaign will work, because all the guests we spoke, told us to do more individual excursions .
