story:
About us

Many Annapolis Valley locals may already know Ariell from her years at the Wolfville Farmer's Market.  For those who don't know her, she is the owner and culinary engine who drives all things food related at the Edible Art Café.  Following a fateful trip to Hawaii, with her husband Jesse in tow, the Edible Art Cafe was launched on the grounds of the old Horton High School.  The first year was filled with not only the business launch, but Jesse's immigration, and the birth of their first son Dax, culminating with being awarded "Outstanding New Business of the Year" by the Annapolis Valley Chamber of Commerce. 

While this made for very full 2014, things have only accelerated since then, with the birth of baby Gavin in 2015, and all the incredible collaborations with the community.  The result is something truly unique and complementary to Ariell's culinary passion, along with Jesse's passion for hospitality, art, and music.

The Edible Art Café is not only the creative expression of its founders, but also the many members of the Annapolis Valley community who provide a diverse array of local art for sale, live music from 12-2pm 7 days a week, and all sorts of events.  As a home grown phenomenon in every sense of the word, this tapestry of creativity is fueled by 100% local people and products, which recirculates money back into the local economy with nearly every dollar spent. 

By helping to achieve our goals, you can have a hand in not not only ensuring this amazing process continues, but helping to create something with an even larger and more sustainable impact in the long term... read on to find out how.

With our landlords facing foreclosure before the end of 2017, the purpose of our campaign is to purchase our 6000 square foot mixed-use commercial building.  The success that we've had in business has helped to qualify us for a mortgage, but we still need the down payment required at auction.  With previous plans to purchase the building in 2019, we've now been forced to raise funds in the short term to save our home and business. 

Since we've never been the types to ask for help, preferring to focus on work and community collaborations, it was a difficult choice for us to do this campaign.   It was ultimately our many loyal and longtime customers who gave us the inspiration to share our story.  So many have shared that they can't imagine us leaving, and neither can we. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to secure the building, and deter other bidders, our goal is to raise 80k in down payment funds. 

Since our business has been literally bursting at the seams since the first year, our second goal is for any surplus along with future profits to be allocated to much needed equipment upgrades and future renovation plans.  

There is also a third goal for the long term, with the scope of potential on the property extending far beyond our walls, encompassing the remaining 10 acres of of undeveloped former school grounds.  Any local movers and shakers are encouraged to get in touch about this third tier long term strategy.

Please check out our perks to the right, and be sure to use the share buttons at the top of the page.  There are also lots of other ways to help at the bottom of the page if you choose not to contribute financially.

Our main perks are self evident in what we do, transcending the material level for our loyal customers and the many other people involved.  For those who may have never visited, or haven't experienced a Nova Scotia winter, imagine this:

The snow drifts are 10ft high, and the thermometer is reading -40.  You venture out and notice Edible Art is open as usual.  Upon entering you're greeted with bright smiles, splashes of colorful art, and uplifting live music as you sit at a beautiful open pore black walnut live edge table.  With your winter blues erased immediately, you enjoy the best home cooking imaginable with your closest friends, then bring home a weeks worth of food for $20.  This is Edible Art in our busy season, and this is what we hope to continue with your support.

Our secret ingredient has always been love... to fuel you within our space, as well as between visits... and it has been an honor for us to do so.  We joke about going back to Hawaii for the winters, but we sincerely hope to be here this time around. 

If we're unable reach our goal of securing the building, the funds will be used for equipment upgrades, limited renovations, community projects, and other endeavors to benefit artists, musicians and entrepreneurs in the valley.

 

The Impact

By contributing you can help to:

 

  • Ensure that folks will still be able to enjoy what we offer, including innovative specials, fresh baked goods, breakfasts, lunch, brunch, catering, art, music, and our popular line of frozen 5 for $20 frozen Grab & Go meals.

 

  • Open up opportunities for small business and people in the community.  We are currently utilizing only 25% of the building.  One example of this is our plan to help top farm market vendors sell their products seven days a week within our space.

 

  • Ensure the future growth and security of our small business and community, while also fueling the local multiplier effect on over 50 employees including cafe workers, local artists, and musicians.

 

  • Allow for much needed equipment and kitchen expansion, helping to produce a lot more of our affordable Grab & Go meals for fixed income families, single parents, retirees, etc...  (already producing hundreds of these daily)

 

  • Support the development of more local businesses and producers as we expand into the surrounding ten acre former school grounds in the long term.

 

*Help ensure that local money fuels local interests vs. corporate interests* 

Our unique property sits directly between the New Minas "big box store" commercial district, and the village of Greenwich, which has farm markets galore.  Your contribution will benefit the future direction of our property and community!

 

Our Challenges & Commitment

Many people seem to see us as a wildly successful business with the parking lot always full.  While this is true to a point, the fact remains that we are in the poorest and highest taxed province in Canada.  Having started the cafe with literally nothing, we're proud to have had so much success, but growth and long overdue improvements have been painfully slow.

If you have never seen our facilities, just imagine operating at a commercial level from you tiny home kitchen.  The good news is that this has forced us to be extremely efficient in other ways.  Having to be profitable from day one, along with our ability to overcome adversity, has made for a potent combination relating to both expansion potential, and impact within the community.

As the growth of our family and business accelerates, we're gradually starting to work more on the business than in it.   Ultimately, being able to jump in and run things at any given moment has made all the difference, along with the amazing people who continue to show up.  With the vision now more clear than ever, we hope you'll join us.

Thank you for your time and consideration,   

Jesse, Ariell, and the Edible Art team

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides contributing financially, there's a lot you can to help with our campaign:

* Email links for this IndieGoGo fundraising page to your family and friends.

* Help us spread the word! Post links to this fundraising page on Facebook and Twitter. This makes an absolutely HUGE difference! The more people who learn about this, the better chance we have of raising the funds we need.

*For those who are not technically savvy, or even the folks glued to phones and computers... word of mouth is the most powerful...  this was how our business was built with almost zero advertising dollars.  Spreading the word throughout your day can be a huge help, along with helping to keep all of our tables full during open hours.

story:
By Supporting This Campaign You Can Help Make That Happen!

The Facts

Of the top 25 metro areas in the country, Pittsburgh ranked 24th for creation of new female-owned firms since 1997 and 23rd according to revenue growth for women-owned business.

In the last 20 years, the number of women-owned businesses in Pittsburgh increased 19%, compared to the national growth of 74%.

Yet, the average venture-backed company run by a woman has annual revenues 12% higher than those by men using, on average, ⅓ less capital.

The Pitch
Invest in Her is the region's only all-female pitch competition. What started out as an event designed to bring awareness and encouragement has turned into an organization dedicated to supporting female entrepreneurs.  We are once again hosting a pitch competition set to take place October 19th at BNY's Innovation Center in Downtown Pittsburgh. The competition  will help create a region that can boast an impressive rate of newly formed and formidable women owned business enterprises.This year we set the goal of reaching more businesses and driving more capital to help those businesses become successful.

story:
Steve Harms here, I have been in the bowling industry for over 30 years. I love bowling and helping others to enjoy the sport is what I live for. I started from the ground up as a pin chaser and progressed through the ranks to control desk for large centers all the while chasing the professional bowlers tour. I began bowling ball drilling back in 1987 and haven't stopped since. The reason for "Harmsey's Bowling Service" is the amount of interest for me to keep drilling from a large customer base that keeps calling me after losing my position at the bowling center due to the owner's decision to manage the center himself.

I’ve spent the last month working on a solution to service all my bowling clients’ needs.  I have talked to colleagues, family members and friends and with their help, I’ve decided to do something that’s never been done before in Salt Lake City.  This is something unexpected, but will give my clients the service they have come to expect from me.  I will be opening a business offering a pickup and delivery service for all my clients.  This means if they want to order equipment such as balls, bags or shoes, I’ll take their order and then personally deliver it to them.

My business will be a free-standing bowlers pro shop (my garage at the present time). Hopefully business will grow enough to open a store-front shop where current and new clients can visit if they want to.  With the influx of Family Entertainment Centers (FECs) growing in Utah that do not have bowling pro shop services, we feel that a free-standing pro shop could become a very  viable service to the bowling community in the next two years.

What I need is some help getting this project started. The strongest need is a drill press, so I can drill balls, a Cook's Sphere to refinish balls, and a ball spinner to handle the many aspects of bowling ball maintenance, and If I’m able, to get the free-standing space. There will be requirements for that:

            Office equipment and furniture

            Point of Sale equipment

            Display wall

            Product

            Signs

We need your help no matter what.  Your support of any kind will always be appreciated. There are many ways to support my efforts to bring my services back for you, my clients.

Please share the campaign with your friends and families any way you can, through social media, word-of-mouth or giving out my phone number or email address (h.harms@att.net), especially if they live in Utah.  The tentative date for opening of HARMSEY’S BOWLING SERVICES will be the first of October, 2017.

PERKS

For those of you contributing to our campaign, we will send you a certificate that will entitles you to one of our free perks, or if you choose one of our other items such as the logo sticker, t-shirt, hat or beanie, we will send those directly to you.

story:
La nostra storia:

Ciao da Verona, siamo Francesca Bortolaso e Mima Petrovic. Desideriamo condividere in poche parole chi siamo e lo scopo del nostro progetto: MANUFATTO. Francesca è un artista del vetro e Mima artigiana che crea gioielli coi tessuti. Ci siamo incontrate durante un evento a Verona e ben presto è nata la nostra collaborazione con la forte intenzione a dar vita a questo progetto. Nella nostra esperienza lavorativa abbiamo spesso riscontrato grande interesse ed apprezzamento per le creazioni autenticamente fatte a mano ma anche molta difficoltà nel trovare luoghi e situazioni adatti a promuoverle, oltre agli ingenti costi per  un eventuale  spazio proprio. Siamo consapevoli  che  aprire uno spazio dedicato all’artigianato oggi in Italia richiede molto coraggio ma siamo anche fermamente convinte che il nostro progetto possa crescere ed avere grande successo, anche con il vostro sostegno.

 

The story:

Hello from Verona Italy, we are Francesca Bortolaso e Mima Petrovic. We would briefly like to share with you who we are and the offset of our project:  MANUFATTO. Francesca is a glass artist and Mima a craftwoman who makes fabric jewelry. We met during a craft event in Verona and soon our collaboration was born with the strong intention to give birth to this project. In our working experience we have found a great deal of interest and appreciation for authentic hand-made craftsmanship but a very hard and often frustrating  uphill  work in finding the best way to promote and sell our creations, due to the economic power of large scale mass production and the high costs of running a dedicated space of our own. This happens to be a common issue shared by most of the artisan community in Italy and stands at the base of our project idea. We are firmly convinced that our project will have great success and grow, also with your very significant and essential help.

 

 

Cosa ci muove e l’impatto:

Mima e Francesca sentono l’importanza ed il desiderio di fare business in modo nuovo e stimolante. MANUFATTO sarà un luogo dove molte “teste creative” potranno esporre e vendere le loro creazioni ed avere l’opportunità d’incontrarsi, dando vita anche a nuove sinergie e progetti. Desideriamo che MANUFATTO diventi un luogo attivo, un’oasi nel campo delle arti e mestieri. In tre parole: connessione, condivisione e relazioni. Siamo entrambe determinate nel fare co-working e nel condividere gli spazi con altri artigiani ed artisti. In questo modo potremo sostenere parte dei nostri costi fissi ed allo stesso tempo altre realtà avranno l’opportunità di vendere ed esporre le loro creazioni a costi sostenibili. Una strategia vincente! Il nostro obbiettivo è quello di contribuire a conservare, sostenere e sviluppare l’arte e la maestria del saper creare con le mani, la testa ed il...CUORE!

 

The core and impact:

Mima and Francesca strongly feel the urge and desire to do business in a modern way. MANUFATTO will be a place where artisans and artists will be able to show and sell their creations and have the opportunity to meet and share ideas with other likeminded  people, possibly creating new synergies and projects. An active point and an oasis in the network of Arts and Crafts. In three words: connectdeness, sharing and relations. We are committed in co-working and sharing with other craftspeople, doing business with each other.  In this way we will  be able  to sustain part of our management costs meanwhile giving the opportunity to others to sell and exibit their work at sustainable costs. A win-win! Our possible aim will be to preserve, sustain and develop the art and mastery of creating with your hands, your mind and your...HEART! 

 

Dove:

Abbiamo trovato un luogo davvero speciale in un edificio di pregio,  affascinante ed antico. Uno spazio elegante nel centro storico di Verona molto vicino alla famosa Arena. Durante la recente ristrutturazione, nel basamento, è stata ritrovata parte della città romana e con sorpresa proprio una zona che era dedicata alla lavorazione dei metalli!  La posizione del negozio è davvero strategica per attirare sia i residenti sia molti turisti che dimostrano spesso grande apprezzamento per l’artigianato genuino e di qualità.

 

 

Location:

We have found a special location that sits in a stylish historical building with large spaces and wide displays. It is beautiful, fascinating and antique, a fine space in the historical center of Verona, close to the famous Arena. During the recent building restauration archaeologists have found in the basement part of the ancient Roman town and surprisingly… an area specially dedicated to the manual work of metals. Our location is strategic for attracting local residents as well as many tourists always showing their deep appreciation and interest for authentic and original Arts and Crafts.

 

Cosa offriamo:

MANUFATTO, oltre ad ospitare i laboratori e le creazioni di Francesca e Mima, offre degli spazi espositivi in affitto ad artigiani, artisti e creativi italiani ed  internazionali con le seguenti modalità:

1)      Temporary store (1 settimana /max 1 mese).

2)      Isole espositive dedicate  (3 mesi/ max 1 anno).

3)      Sala per  mostre ,conferenze, laboratori ed eventi.

 

What we offer:

MANUFATTO, besides hosting Francesca and Mima  workshops and creations, will offer rentable display spaces to the Italian and international artisan and artist community with the following modes:

1)      Temporary store (1 week to max 1 month).

2)      Dedicated exposition and selling corners (long term: 3 months/up to 1 year).

3)      Hall for exhibitions, conferences, workshops and events.

 

Cosa chiediamo:

Chiediamo gentilmente il Vostro contributo per portare a termine la parte finale del progetto nell’equipaggiarlo, arredarlo e farlo partire. L’arredamento per MANUFATTO è stato disegnato e progettato con creatività e gusto e verrà prodotto a costi contenuti. Tutti i fondi raccolti saranno di grande  importanza e noi ci impegniamo ed essere trasparenti nel farne uso, condivideremo foto ed informazioni sull’avanzamento dei lavori e sul risultato finale. Vi terremo informati! Qualsiasi contributo sarà molto apprezzato e riceverà un ringraziamento.  

 

 

What we need:

We kindly ask for your help in bringing our final part of the project to good, equipping, furnishing and decorating our space,  allowing the whole project to take off. An aesthetic and trendy furniture has been expressly  designed  for  MANUFATTO and will be produced at reasonable costs. The raised funds will have an ultimate role at this time and we are committed to being transparent and promise to share pictures and information with you throughout the working progress and the final outcome. We will keep you updated! Any contribution will be very important to us, appreciated and thanked for.  Please share our page via email and social media.

 

Cosa ricevete: ricompense

What you get: perks


 

Altri modi in cui potete aiutarci:

Se non siete in grado di contribuire finanziariamente ci sono altri modi in cui potete aiutarci a raggiungere il nostro obbiettivo! Diffondete la nostra campagna di raccolta fondi condividendo la nostra pagina via email e sui social media.

 

Other ways you can help:

If you are not able to contribute financially please help up spread the word about our crowdfunding campaign and share our page. 

 

 

Seguiteci su Facebook ed Instagram: Manufatto Verona. Restate in contatto e venite a trovarci, inauguriamo a fine Settembre.

Please follow us on Facebook and  Instagram: Manufatto Verona. Stay in touch and come visit us, the official opening will be at the end of September

In our working experience we have found a great deal of interest and appreciation for authentic hand-made craftsmanship but a very hard and often frustrating  uphill  work in finding the best way to promote and sell our creations, due to the economic power of large scale mass production and the high costs of running a dedicated space of our own. This happens to be a common issue shared by most of the artisan community in Italy and stands at the base of our project idea. We are firmly convinced that our project will have great success and grow, also with your very significant and essential help.
 

 

Cosa ci muove e l’impatto:
Mima e Francesca sentono l’importanza ed il desiderio di fare business in modo nuovo e stimolante. MANUFATTO sarà un luogo dove molte “teste creative” potranno esporre e vendere le loro creazioni ed avere l’opportunità d’incontrarsi, dando vita anche a nuove sinergie e progetti. Desideriamo che MANUFATTO diventi un luogo attivo, un’oasi nel campo delle arti e mestieri. In tre parole: connessione, condivisione e relazioni. Siamo entrambe determinate nel fare co-working e nel condividere gli spazi con altri artigiani ed artisti. In questo modo potremo sostenere parte dei nostri costi fissi ed allo stesso tempo altre realtà avranno l’opportunità di vendere ed esporre le loro creazioni a costi sostenibili. Una strategia vincente! Il nostro obbiettivo è quello di contribuire a conservare, sostenere e sviluppare l’arte e la maestria del saper creare con le mani, la testa ed il...CUORE!
 
The core and impact:
Mima and Francesca strongly feel the urge and desire to do business in a modern way. MANUFATTO will be a place where artisans and artists will be able to show and sell their creations and have the opportunity to meet and share ideas with other likeminded  people, possibly creating new synergies and projects. An active point and an oasis in the network of Arts and Crafts. In three words: connectdeness, sharing and relations. We are committed in co-working and sharing with other craftspeople, doing business with each other.  In this way we will  be able  to sustain part of our management costs meanwhile giving the opportunity to others to sell and exibit their work at sustainable costs. A win-win! Our possible aim will be to preserve, sustain and develop the art and mastery of creating with your hands, your mind and your...HEART! 
 
Dove:
Abbiamo trovato un luogo davvero speciale in un edificio di pregio,  affascinante ed antico. Uno spazio elegante nel centro storico di Verona molto vicino alla famosa Arena. Durante la recente ristrutturazione, nel basamento, è stata ritrovata parte della città romana e con sorpresa proprio una zona che era dedicata alla lavorazione dei metalli!  La posizione del negozio è davvero strategica per attirare sia i residenti sia molti turisti che dimostrano spesso grande apprezzamento per l’artigianato genuino e di qualità.
 

 
Location:
We have found a special location that sits in a stylish historical building with large spaces and wide displays. It is beautiful, fascinating and antique, a fine space in the historical center of Verona, close to the famous Arena. During the recent building restauration archaeologists have found in the basement part of the ancient Roman town and surprisingly… an area specially dedicated to the manual work of metals. Our location is strategic for attracting local residents as well as many tourists always showing their deep appreciation and interest for authentic and original Arts and Crafts.
 
Cosa offriamo:
MANUFATTO, oltre ad ospitare i laboratori e le creazioni di Francesca e Mima, offre degli spazi espositivi in affitto ad artigiani, artisti e creativi italiani ed  internazionali con le seguenti modalità:
1)      Temporary store (1 settimana /max 1 mese).
2)      Isole espositive dedicate  (3 mesi/ max 1 anno).
3)      Sala per  mostre ,conferenze, laboratori ed eventi.
 
What we offer:
MANUFATTO, besides hosting Francesca and Mima  workshops and creations, will offer rentable display spaces to the Italian and international artisan and artist community with the following modes:
1)      Temporary store (1 week to max 1 month).
2)      Dedicated exposition and selling corners (long term: 3 months/up to 1 year).
3)      Hall for exhibitions, conferences, workshops and events.
 
Cosa chiediamo:
Chiediamo gentilmente il Vostro contributo per portare a termine la parte finale del progetto nell’equipaggiarlo, arredarlo e farlo partire. L’arredamento per MANUFATTO è stato disegnato e progettato con creatività e gusto e verrà prodotto a costi contenuti. Tutti i fondi raccolti saranno di grande  importanza e noi ci impegniamo ed essere trasparenti nel farne uso, condivideremo foto ed informazioni sull’avanzamento dei lavori e sul risultato finale. Vi terremo informati! Qualsiasi contributo sarà molto apprezzato e riceverà un ringraziamento.  
 

 
What we need:
We kindly ask for your help in bringing our final part of the project to good, equipping, furnishing and decorating our space,  allowing the whole project to take off. An aesthetic and trendy furniture has been expressly  designed  for  MANUFATTO and will be produced at reasonable costs. The raised funds will have an ultimate role at this time and we are committed to being transparent and promise to share pictures and information with you throughout the working progress and the final outcome. We will keep you updated! Any contribution will be very important to us, appreciated and thanked for.  Please share our page via email and social media.
 
Cosa ricevete: ricompense
What you get: perks

 
Altri modi in cui potete aiutarci:
Se non siete in grado di contribuire finanziariamente ci sono altri modi in cui potete aiutarci a raggiungere il nostro obbiettivo! Diffondete la nostra campagna di raccolta fondi condividendo la nostra pagina via email e sui social media.
 
Other ways you can help:
If you are not able to contribute financially please help up spread the word about our crowdfunding campaign and share our page. 
 

 
Seguiteci su Facebook ed Instagram: Manufatto Verona. Restate in contatto e venite a trovarci, inauguriamo a fine Settembre.
Please follow us on Facebook and  Instagram: Manufatto Verona. Stay in touch and come visit us, the official opening will be at the end of September

story:
PROJECT BACKGROUND

Our mission is to provide an Eco-friendly and efficient cleaning service that provides a value to customers as well as a living wage to the cleaners.

Growing up in Washington, DC with a single mother of five, I know first-hand how not making a living wage creates a scarcity of the most basic resources. As a service-disabled veteran of the United States Army and a homeless veterans social worker. I now witness veterans working multiple jobs, many of them as cleaners and see how the lack of a living wage effects the ability to have a sense of housing stability.

The Problem:

The average wage for a cleaner is under $10.50/hr.(https://www.bls.gov/oes/current/oes372012.htm), the living wage for an adult and one child in Lancaster, PA is more than $21/hr. (http://livingwage.mit.edu/counties/42071).

The Solution:

A membership based, monthly flat-fee business model that utilizes mobile technology to deliver a cost-effective, Eco-friendly cleaning solution to consumers as well as a thriving wage to employees!

How does it work?

Our flat fees are transparent and based on the size of a home. We listened to consumers through market research and found that most consumers generally only have the common areas of their homes cleaned on a regular basis.

This is what we came up with:

Pay a yearly membership and a flat monthly fee: Get one deep cleaning of living room, dining room and kitchen, plus a bathroom. Bi-weekly a Sage & Shield cleaner will come to the home to maintain those areas.

  • Ex: 1500sqft home= $110 yearly membership and $75 monthly fee.
  • Ex: 2000sqft home= $140 yearly membership and $105 monthly fee.

Why our model works:

Typical cleaning companies can charge a minimum of $50/hr. with a three hour minimum to clean negotiated areas of a home one time and Eco-friendly cleaning costs more! 

A deep cleaning of a 2000sqft home (common areas) can cost $300 or more just for one cleaning with competitors. Remember, the cleaner on average is only making under $10.50/hr.!

Our business model not only is a value but it also makes a cleaning service financially feasible to more consumers.

Impact:

We use technology in such a way that it serves as a logistical tool and a vehicle for efficiency. Combined with a comprehensive cleaning method, our business is saving time.

Our flat-fee system also means flat-compensation. Our cleaners receive roughly 45% of the tiered monthly fee per bi-weekly cleaning. This means that our employees can average at or above the living wage!

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funding $8,000 in funding to assist in startup expenses. A large part of the business is based on the development of our mobile application, website, training  and devices which will account for $5,000. The remaining $3,000 will go to  industry certifications, licensing, cleaning equipment and administration.

Though knowing your dollars will strengthen the community and provide opportunity, there are some fun perks available as a reminder of your contribution!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate at this time, you can still support our mission and campaign by sharing on your social media sites like Facebook or Twitter, or with your family and friends. Please spread the word about what Sage & Shield is trying to accomplish and encourage others to share!

--------

This crowdfunding campaign is part of The Great Social Enterprise Pitch, a friendly competition facilitated by ASSETS and the Lancaster County Community Foundation. The Pitch consists of social enterprise ideas based in Central Pennsylvania. A Social Enterprise is a market-based, income-generating enterprise that aims to solve a social and/or environmental problem through its business activities. Social enterprises focus on a trip bottom line: people, planet, and profit. Upon completion of the Crowdfunding phase of the competition, 5 ideas will be chosen to move on to the Live Pitch, during which the contestants will present their ideas to a panel of judges, with winners receiving a package of cash and pro-bono prizes. In 2017, winners received over $65,000 in cash and pro-bono prizes. Please visit www.lancasterpitch.com for more information. To access to the crowdfunding sites of all participating social enterprise ideas, click here: www.indiegogo.com/partners/SocialEnterprisePitch.

By contributing to this campaign, you give permission to this business and to ASSETS to collect and use your name, email address, and mailing address. Your information will not be sold or shared with other organizations. You may opt out of electronic communications by selecting the unsubscribe link and following instructions on any emails that you receive.

story:
Summary

Wanderlust (www.wanderlustwv.com), meaning a strong desire to travel, is a coffeeshop, wine lounge, and retail bookshop concept that aims to become a community gathering space for locals and a destination spot for people who enjoy the good life throughout north-central West Virginia. Located on Main Street in Philippi, WV, the worldly concept will feature works from authors touching most countries, locally-inspired events, and top-notch coffee, teas, and wines. In short, we want to bring the world to our little corner of West by God Virginia in the form of an affordable luxury. Country Roads, baby! Woo!

My name is Adam Starks, and I'm the founder of Wanderlust. I've authored a peer-reviewed journal and more excitingly, an autobiography titled Broken Child Mended Man. I'm also an assistant professor at our local Alderson Broaddus University. Reading books from authors all over the world, writing a book of my own, and working on my first fiction has revealed new worlds. That's part of the magic I hope to bring to my area. Add my favorites, coffee and wine...now we have a party going! There's much more to my eclectic self, but let's talk Wanderlust! As the owner-operator, I have ten years of retail and restaurant experience. I envisioned this concept while traveling back and forth to Washington, D.C. (long story) and coming across a place called Busboys & Poets. The word "Wanderlust" came across my Word of the Day app and the idea just clicked. The rest is a story I hope you will consider being part of. I’m certainly glad Rachel is among the first, but I’ll just let her tell you how it all came about!

When Rachel came on board as Executive Manager, she felt she had found her dream job.  The culmination of her education and life experiences, from working for the English National Opera in London (2007) to being a teacher and librarian in Barbour county, Rachel is enthusiastic about connecting further with this county, it's artists, and tourists to make Wanderlust a place for all!

What We Need

Here's the breakdown:

We can't do this with you. The $10K we raise will eventually be used as working capital to order inventory, train/pay employees, etc. Initially, it will be used to secure a $40-50K loan, which will be critical to our operations. That $50K will cover furniture, fixtures, equipment (FFE), marketing, and inventory.

At first, we're only going to be able to afford opening between 4pm-12am (midnight). Labor doesn't come cheap, and it shouldn't. It's going to take quite a few savants (what we'll call our employees, a.k.a. experts) and talented managers to ensure this concept goes off without a hitch.

Ideally, we want to open as early as 6am. Any funds raise over the $10K mark will be used to expand hours to lunch, brunch (mimosas anyone?) and eventually breakfast.

Of course, there's the possibility that we won't reach our goal. Sad as it may be, we will scale back operations (decide between wine bar and barista/coffee bar...impossible, I know) and grow our concept as we can afford it. It's going to happen. The scale of our operations will depend on how much funding can be raised.

To ensure our success, as Owner-Operator, I will not collect a salary for at least the first 18 months of operations. Additionally, I've poured $2,500 into this effort to get to this point. I have experience with grand openings and turning around failing bakery-cafes by growing sales through hiring and motivating employees, exceeding customer's expectations, building sales, and controlling inventory. Numbers tell a story, and I only like happy endings. One day, Wanderlust is just going to be a way of life! Let's wander, shall we?

What You Get

As the old adage goes, no man is an island, so we want you involved in our whimsical process. Check out our perks and decide how much you'd like to contribute to our effort.

Whether it be a free latte, bookmark, VIP membership or being forever ensconced on one of our shelves or tables as a sponsor, we invite you to be part of seeing Wanderlust come to fruition.

Want to donate more than $1000! Go you! Let's talk about investor-partnership opportunities. If interested, please contact Adam Starks, Owner-Operator, at adamstarks.phd@gmail.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand money is hard to come by or you may not feel comfortable exchanging money online, but we hope you'll consider helping in other ways:

  • Share all over social media  (Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.). Please be sure to use indiegogo's share tools.
  • Donate Books (Book inventory will be our largest inventory expense by far, so any help will be considered.)
  • Donate used restaurant equipment (ahem, commercial espresso machine! A man can dream, can he not?)
  • Volunteer for stock day (retail, books, cafe, etc.)
  • Have experience as a sommelier, barista, or booksellers. Volunteer to train our savants!
  • Use Indiegogo's share tools, use the hashtag #wanderlustwv and tag us! We're on Facebook and in the process of setting up Twitter, Instagram, and Snapchat. Call up your friends and say "Let's Wander!" Tell them about the awesome perks they can receive for supporting literacy, coffee, wine, and just all-around good taste!
  • If you're interested in any of these alternatives or have other suggestions, e-mail us at info@wanderlustv.com

Thank you for believing in us! I can't wait to meet you over a good book, cup of joe, or glass of wine.

Cheers,

Adam Starks & Rachel Propst

story:
For the shopper

If you shop online this perk is for you! Receive reward points that may be converted to gift cards that can be redeemed when you make a purchase on LiveShopBuy scheduled to launch in December 2017. You will receive reward points (called BuyCoins) exceeding the amount you pledge. Please help us support your community. 

If you don't see a perk to your liking, however, you can donate whatever works for you by clicking "back it," and pledging any amount you choose. 

For the merchant

If you are a small business owner or professional service provider then the Merchant Perks are for you. Get deeply discounted deals on our membership plans when you prepay for a plan. Go to our Solutions page for more information about each plan. You do not have to own a business to purchase this perk. See our FAQs for more on this.

Make it a gift

You don't have to have your own business in order to purchase a membership plan perk! You can always buy and gift it to friends, whether they're newbies or old hats to their trade.

 

Play Now!

Attention all contributors! We encourage you to explore this site. We really worked hard on it. Find the word "serendipity" and send a screen shot of the word in the paragraph it appears in and win an additional 10,000 reward points credited to your account. Send the screen shot to serendipity@LiveShopBuy.com 

A few things you should know about us: We love local business. We love watching it thrive. But we also know how tough it is for small businesses to fairly compete against the big box stores and national chains dominating the market.

To combat this, we’ve created an online sales platform and marketplace exclusively designed for small businesses (i.e. professional service providers, local merchants, home grown enterprises) and their customers.

Why LiveShopBuy?

• You will never find a BIG BOX store on LiveShopBuy.

• Shoppers have the option to pick up orders in store from their local merchant.

• Shoppers are rewarded with loyalty points 

• LiveShopBuy helps local communities fund existing programs that assist the needy with shelter, food, and clothing.

• LiveShopBuy gives merchants and small businesses unrivaled local exposure but with a national reach.

 

 

 

Additionally, in providing services to local merchants and goods to local consumers, we hope to change the current, impersonal view of e-commerce. Bringing together local buyers and sellers will help boost the community economically and socially! 

This idea prompted another facet of our company, LiveShopCommunity. LiveShopCommunity will donate up to  5% of LiveShopBuy's merchant sales profits back to the community. This program will help provide essentials like food, clothing, shelter and healthcare to the less fortunate, while focusing on long-term solutions such as education, job training and employment, and help fund existing community charities. 

By buying through LiveShopBuy, merchants and consumers can be assured that their support, no matter how big or small, contributes to positive change in  their community. But to get off our feet, there are some funds to raise to complete our marketplace, and we can't do it without you! In exchange for financial gifts, we're offering a variety of perks. If you don't see a perk to your liking, however, you can donate whatever works for you by clicking "back it" and pledging any amount you choose. 

 

It is impossible to account for every problem that your business is going to face, but planning and implementing good practices is essential for success. If you're like us, you plan on being in business for a very long time, and it makes good business sense to get onto channels that'll help your business grow most efficiently.

Check out our Pro and Premium Membership programs--they're deals of a lifetime! As a merchant, you'll get all the options you'll ever need to market your business for the next ten years, and for only pennies a day. Pro = $0.23/day and Premier = $0.33/day

Our Perks Offer Amazing Savings

Marketing your business has never been so affordable, so don't be penny wise and dollar foolish! The discounts offered through this campaign are huge and something that should be seriously considered. 

 

Our founders realized that there were little to no affordable marketing programs for local merchants, let alone a marketplace that allows them to compete equally against the more seasoned, higher-rated and most reviewed merchants, so we sought out to create one. LiveShopBuy combines the best available advertising and marketing technologies in order to do just that. 

Our sales platform will equip small businesses with the digital tools essential for successful competition (including but not limited to a business website to sell their products and services, social media presence, and Geo-targeted advertising), while our marketplace will give customers access to the unique products and services advertised. 

 

Did You Know?

•   89.6% of US internet users (196.6 million) shop online— 92.3% expected by 2018.

•   65% of online shoppers are more comfortable purchasing from merchants they don’t know when using an online marketplace.

•   62% of consumers are more likely to shop on sites that have reward programs.

Online shopping is not going away anytime soon, but getting stronger year-after-year. Learn how the LiveShopBuy solutions will give you all the tools you need to compete online against the corporate giants of the world.

 

Did You Also Know?

•   50% of consumers doing a local search on their Smartphone follow up with a store visit within a day and 18% of those visits end up with a purchase

•   94% of Smartphone users look for local information on their device and 90% of them take action

Consumers spend more time now than ever on their Smartphones. Discover that by using the LiveShopBuy Location Based Marketplace you can boost your online and mobile presence to significantly increase your revenue

 

Some people start businesses to work for themselves, some to improve their quality of life, and some merely see an opportunity in the market that they can’t resist.  But for LiveShopBuy, it was different. 

Over the years, we grew tired of seeing so many of our favorite businesses suffering and going out of business.  Because of it, we wanted to come up with a way to help small local businesses compete and flourish.

This is when the idea of LiveShopBuy came to life!

We’re experienced, energetic and aiming to change the way consumers shop locally forever!

Follow us!

 

The Bell Labs Holmdel Complex in Holmdel Township, New Jersey is the headquarters for LiveShopBuy.  The facility functioned for forty-four years as a research and  development facility, initially for the Bell System.  This modernist building, dubbed "The Biggest Mirror Ever" by Architectural Forum, due to its mirror box exterior, was the site of at least one Nobel Prize discovery the laser cooling work of Steven Chu.

The building which offers 2,000,000 square feet has undergone renovations into a multi-purpose living and working space, dubbed Bell Works by its redevelopers, and as of 2016, the former Bell Labs complex has been experiencing a renaissance as a business incubator for high-tech startup companies which is one of the main reasons we choose it as our home. 

 

Through Your Generous Support

At its core, LiveShopBuy’s hosting infrastructure consists of multiple web application servers fed by an inline load balancer that can auto-detect performance problems and reallocate load accordingly over multiple servers. This cluster sits on an internal Gig-E network to provide instant updates to the entire cluster whenever a change is made. Within this model we also host our firewalling, content delivery network  and staging environments. This configuration also employs the latest Dell server hardware on both the front and back-end to deliver exceptional performance during the busiest of holiday seasons. 

 

Our Future Network

 

These local merchants are already on board and excited to see how their company, customers, and communities will benefit from LiveShopBuy. So why not support us, too? You have nothing to lose! Whether it's by telling your friends about us or giving us a financial gift, we truly appreciate your support!

 

If you don’t think LiveShopBuy can help you with your online digital presence read this article:

 

Do Local Merchants Stand a Chance In E-Commerce Wars With Amazon?

“If your company is looking for a growth strategy, it may just be in your best interest to put your products on a third part marketplace and capitalize from their services and traffic. Paying seller fees could be a very small price to pay for new customers learning about your business and an increase in sales.

Amazon, the Goliath of online shopping and the behemoth responsible for shuttering the doors of retail brick-and-mortar establishments, is now getting into the grocery game. In the same way bookstores and clothing outlets have been asking themselves how they’re going to survive.  And more importantly, how are all small local companies going to be able to compete with the marketing and distribution channels Amazon has in place?

It’s no secret that commerce is increasingly living in the digital domain, with rising shares of retail revenue taking place online over time. Businesses have had to fight tooth and nail to be competitive, stand above the crowd, and be successful. They need to have an online platform, social media visibility, e-commerce and multi-channel experiences in place in order to thrive in today's market.

More and more Smaller Retailers are looking to third-party solutions because building something in-house to compete with Amazon is a major stretch. Most retailers are experts within their niche – not so much the tech-mobile-on-demand-delivery business.

The truth is, this is really only the beginning of a massive shift—not just in how we purchase our food, books or clothes, but how people source just about everything that marketers can supply. Tech is the reason we don’t hail cabs off the side of the street anymore. Tech is the reason we download our books instead of perusing the aisles of a bookstore. And pretty soon, tech will be the reason we repeat-order our groceries through an app, rather than walking through the store with a rickety metal shopping cart.

What customers want is ease.

So how can local merchants and e-commerce businesses stay competitive in this Amazon-dominated market?

·         Offer Exclusives - "Exclusivity goes a long way. Offering certain items that are only sold on your company's website is a great way to drive traffic and gain loyal customers, even if you sell other products on Amazon.  These personal touches are the types of things consumers can't get when shopping on Amazon.

·         Branding Is Key - In the Amazon economy, the lowest priced product that meets basic needs is usually purchased.  So to compete, your company needs to be more than basic; it needs to be a brand. Brands are more than the products they sell.

·         Offline Experiences - Set your company apart by offering in-person services or events in your local market. There is no replacement for human connection and the more your company can build a loyal customer following through in-person events, the more likely customers are to remember you and revisit your website or attend future events.

·         If You Can't Beat Them, Join Them – If your company is looking for a growth strategy, it may just be in your best interest to put your products on a third part marketplace and capitalize from their services and traffic. Paying seller fees could be a very small price to pay for new customers learning about your business and an increase in sales.

While many people seem to believe that brick-and-mortar retail will soon be a thing of the past, tech giants like Amazon are proving that is far from true. Physical locations will still be part of the business landscape – they just might operate with different purposes.

Our lives are getting busier and busier, and people are becoming more than willing to give their business to companies that make their shopping experiences that much easier. Which means, if smaller chains are going to survive in the new world of consumerism, where tech is perfectly integrated into the brick-and-mortar businesses that line every street, they are going to have to operate with the same mentality that has driven Amazon to the position it’s in today.

The small retailers that continue to think they don’t need to start thinking more seriously about integrating digital channels? They’ll be the ones who end up starving."

 

Why Indiegogo?

Since LiveShopBuy began in 2015 the founders have been bootstrapping the project. In June 2017, a friends and family round was offered. To date we have raised $100,000.00. Indiegogo gives us the freedom to share our story supporting local merchants all across America and giving back to our communities. Through your support and referral, we can complete the development of our platform and start our marketing efforts.   

I am just starting my business and will not be open for another 6 months. Can I still purchase a Merchant Perk? 

Yes, you do not have to own a business to purchase a Merchant Perk. You may activate a Merchant perk 6 months from now when your business is ready to open. Your 10-year membership will start on that date. Thank you for your support. 

Can I really get a ten-year subscription to LiveShopBuy for the price of one year?

Yes, only through this Indiegogo campaign are we offering this once in a lifetime opportunity to purchase a 10-year membership to any of our merchant membership products. This allows businesses to sell their products and services without having to pay any monthly or annual fees for the next ten years.

It is impossible to account for every problem that your business is going to face, but planning and implementing good practices is essential for success. If you're like us, you plan on being in business for a very long time, and it makes good business sense to get onto channels that'll help your business grow most efficiently.

Check out our Pro and Premium Membership programs--they're deals of a lifetime! Through this Indiegogo campaign, you'll get all the options you'll ever need to market your business for the next ten years, and for only pennies a day. Pro = $0.23/day and Premier = $0.33/day

What are BuyCoins?

A “BuyCoin” is the name for the reward points in LiveShopBuy. BuyCoins are virtual currency that you earn when purchasing products and services on LiveShopBuy. BuyCoins may also be redeemed at checkout for products and services. They may also be gifted to other members or converted into LiveShopBuy Gift Cards.            

If I purchase a Shopper perk when can I use my BuyCoins?

BuyCoins may be redeemed at checkout for products and services. They may also be gifted to other members or converted into LiveShopBuy Gift Cards. You will receive an email notification with instructions on how to create an account in LiveShopBuy’s marketplace prior to the public launch scheduled in Q4 2017. Your BuyCoins will be credited to your account at that time.

How can I contact LiveShopBuy?

If you cannot find the answers to your questions in the FAQs or at LiveShopMerchant.com, you may contact us by email Contactus@LiveShopBuy.com or 732-334-1515 option 1

When will my Perks be delivered?

If you purchased a Shopper Perk you will be notified via email prior to our Public launch tentatively scheduled in December 2017. If you purchased a Merchant Perk you will be notified prior to the Beta Merchant Launch tentatively scheduled in October 2017. All physical items i.e. T-Shirts, Baseball Caps etc. will ship out in October. If you purchased the Entrepreneur Perk you will receive an email invitation to schedule your private tour of LiveShopBuy’s awesome corporate campus including lunch and conversations with the founders of LiveShopBuy.

Aren’t you all a bit crazy to build a "National Marketplace" to help all small local merchants compete against the large national retailers?

Call us crazy but soon small businesses will have nowhere to go aside from building their own web site and doing their own marketing. And the problem they will face is the extreme cost of marketing and maintenance. What about Amazon, eBay, Walmart and other marketplaces? Good question! As a merchant, you cannot get onto Walmart’s marketplace unless you meet their strict guidelines, are an established business with enormous sales and have a history of high ratings and reviews from other marketplaces. On Amazon and others, merchants with the highest ratings and reviews tend to come up first in search results. LiveShopBuy on the other hand is a Location-based marketplace so when a consumer shops, the merchants in that shopper’s hometown profile come up first in search results even if they shop from a location outside their hometown. Please view our video for information on our community give back program.

When will I be notified to set-up my business account?

You will receive updates through this Indiegogo campaign as well as an email notifying you prior to our Merchant Beta launch. We are on schedule to launch the Merchant beta site in October.

What is a gold membership?

When a consumer or merchant creates an account with LiveShopBuy they are registered into our Loyalty Rewards Program at the Gold Membership level and receives 1,000 reward points called BuyCoins. As the member accumulates more points they are upgraded to the next membership level with additional benefits. LiveShopBuy membership level information will be posted on the web site. You will be notified of all announcements in advance as a contributor of a LiveShopBuy Perk.

How can I contribute? What payment methods do you offer?

All payments are handled through Indiegogo’s payment processing. All credit cards are accepted

Other than contributing, how can I help you guys grow?

You can recommend our platform to your favorite local merchants and friends. Please send them to www.LiveShopMerchant.com for information on our company.
story_txt:
For the shopper If you shop online this perk is for you! Receive reward points that may be converted to gift cards that can be redeemed when you make a purchase on LiveShopBuy scheduled to launch in December 2017. You will receive reward points (called BuyCoins) exceeding the amount you pledge. Please help us support your community. If you don't see a perk to your liking, however, you can donate whatever works for you by clicking "back it," and pledging any amount you choose. For the merchant If you are a small business owner or professional service provider then the Merchant Perks are for you. Get deeply discounted deals on our membership plans when you prepay for a plan. Go to our Solutions page for more information about each plan. You do not have to own a business to purchase this perk. See our FAQs for more on this.Make it a giftYou don't have to have your own business in order to purchase a membership plan perk! You can always buy and gift it to friends, whether they're newbies or old hats to their trade. Play Now!Attention all contributors! We encourage you to explore this site. We really worked hard on it. Find the word "serendipity" and send a screen shot of the word in the paragraph it appears in and win an additional 10,000 reward points credited to your account. Send the screen shot to serendipity@LiveShopBuy.com A few things you should know about us: We love local business. We love watching it thrive. But we also know how tough it is for small businesses to fairly compete against the big box stores and national chains dominating the market.To combat this, we’ve created an online sales platform and marketplace exclusively designed for small businesses (i.e. professional service providers, local merchants, home grown enterprises) and their customers.Why LiveShopBuy?• You will never find a BIG BOX store on LiveShopBuy.• Shoppers have the option to pick up orders in store from their local merchant.• Shoppers are rewarded with loyalty points • LiveShopBuy helps local communities fund existing programs that assist the needy with shelter, food, and clothing.• LiveShopBuy gives merchants and small businesses unrivaled local exposure but with a national reach.   Additionally, in providing services to local merchants and goods to local consumers, we hope to change the current, impersonal view of e-commerce. Bringing together local buyers and sellers will help boost the community economically and socially! This idea prompted another facet of our company, LiveShopCommunity. LiveShopCommunity will donate up to  5% of LiveShopBuy's merchant sales profits back to the community. This program will help provide essentials like food, clothing, shelter and healthcare to the less fortunate, while focusing on long-term solutions such as education, job training and employment, and help fund existing community charities. By buying through LiveShopBuy, merchants and consumers can be assured that their support, no matter how big or small, contributes to positive change in  their community. But to get off our feet, there are some funds to raise to complete our marketplace, and we can't do it without you! In exchange for financial gifts, we're offering a variety of perks. If you don't see a perk to your liking, however, you can donate whatever works for you by clicking "back it" and pledging any amount you choose.  It is impossible to account for every problem that your business is going to face, but planning and implementing good practices is essential for success. If you're like us, you plan on being in business for a very long time, and it makes good business sense to get onto channels that'll help your business grow most efficiently.Check out our Pro and Premium Membership programs--they're deals of a lifetime! As a merchant, you'll get all the options you'll ever need to market your business for the next ten years, and for only pennies a day. Pro = $0.23/day and Premier = $0.33/dayOur Perks Offer Amazing SavingsMarketing your business has never been so affordable, so don't be penny wise and dollar foolish! The discounts offered through this campaign are huge and something that should be seriously considered.  Our founders realized that there were little to no affordable marketing programs for local merchants, let alone a marketplace that allows them to compete equally against the more seasoned, higher-rated and most reviewed merchants, so we sought out to create one. LiveShopBuy combines the best available advertising and marketing technologies in order to do just that. Our sales platform will equip small businesses with the digital tools essential for successful competition (including but not limited to a business website to sell their products and services, social media presence, and Geo-targeted advertising), while our marketplace will give customers access to the unique products and services advertised.  
Did You Know?
•   89.6% of US internet users (196.6 million) shop online— 92.3% expected by 2018.
•   65% of online shoppers are more comfortable purchasing from merchants they don’t know when using an online marketplace.
•   62% of consumers are more likely to shop on sites that have reward programs.
Online shopping is not going away anytime soon, but getting stronger year-after-year. Learn how the LiveShopBuy solutions will give you all the tools you need to compete online against the corporate giants of the world.

 


Did You Also Know?
•   50% of consumers doing a local search on their Smartphone follow up with a store visit within a day and 18% of those visits end up with a purchase
•   94% of Smartphone users look for local information on their device and 90% of them take action
Consumers spend more time now than ever on their Smartphones. Discover that by using the LiveShopBuy Location Based Marketplace you can boost your online and mobile presence to significantly increase your revenue

story:
The Nosh Pit Detroit

The Nosh Pit Detroit is a truck that is on a mission to change the world one delicious bite at a time. We compost, recycle and source local ingredients to offer a variety of vegan and vegetarian eats and sweets.  Our mission and motivation is to help people incorporate more vegetables into their diet without sacrificing any taste.

Our Story:
Karen, Stefan, and Eric met in a Detroit area cooking group. Stefan was leaving his job in the music industry and Karen was leaving hers in sustainability services. Eric is design and technology guru. They all got together and came up with a food truck concept that combined Stefan's creative cooking with clean healthy foods and Karen and Eric’s love of veganism and baked goods. 

Although we are just barely over one year old, we have won several local awards including: Best in Show for Arts, Beats & Eats 2017, 1st place for our hummus at the Shawarma Fest in Royal Oak, 2016, 2nd place for the best restaurant at the International Veg Fest in Novi, 2016 and 3rd place for the best pumpkin recipe (Pumpkin Soup) at Detroit Food Labs, 2016. We were nationally recognized in 2017 as one of the best vegan / vegetarian food trucks by Mobile Cuisine.

Having a brick and mortar location would allow us to not only provide mobile cuisine but have a location where we can increase our ability to cater and have a place that the Detroiters can count on, year round.  With your contributions, our vision is to not only to have a brick and mortar location for food service, but a location that is large enough to host regular food truck rallies, offer composting services and support our local community.”

We need you!

In order to continue at the fast-paced organic growth, we are looking to raise $50,000 to off-set the cost of purchasing equipment and renting property. We're offering some fun perks to include each of you into our story of success. With your support, we can continue to make vegan, vegetarian and gluten-free options accessible and affordable.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that's okay! Instead, help us make some noise by sharing this campaign.  When we have our facility, we can also use volunteer support for renovations and  supplies. Thank you for being a part of the Nosh Pit family!

story:
We started Pursuit OCR three years ago as a place for people who like to laugh while they sweat together and play. Like a lot of you, We were tired of gyms and feeling like exercise had to be soooo serious. So we took all the best parts of the playground and brought it indoors so you can run and climb and crawl all year round. We wanted to create a space that was inclusive and felt like you could really cheer on the people around you. Accessible year-round, rain or shine, Pursuit OCR became the place for people of all fitness levels - from the hardcore racer to the group of friends looking for a new way to work up a sweat before beer and wings.

Not only did we build a space to get fit, but we also created a unique hub for the community. Because of you we were able to provide free space for artists, film makers and musicians. Over the course of two and half years we were able to donate over $80,000 back to community charitable organizations and education efforts. That was all thanks to you and your visits!

Which brings us to our big move: tragically the building we called home was demolished to make way for condos and we were forced to close our doors in our old neighborhood. Not gonna lie, it was pretty rough news to get and a challenge as a small new business.
But at Pursuit we specialize in overcoming obstacles and thats what we're going to do.
The Good news?  We've got a new home and its even bigger and better than before! It's three times bigger and twice as high inside and that means so much more room for activities!

Pursuit is going all out this time: We've designed it to be more accessible to everyone. We're creating all new obstacles and challenges for more levels of fitness from beginner to elite. Our ballpit is over four times bigger! And we're adding all the things you've been asking for like salmon ladders and a higher three level warp wall. We'll still have our awesome Nerf Wars and our Lightsaber battles. We even have parking now! 

We're working hard to blow your minds on this one! 

Brand new to everywhere,  we've designed a totally amazing race track with pedal powered drift trikes! So you can jump on one of these trikes and race your friends around like real live Mario Kart that threads under and through our obstacle course. The best part is that it's totally accessible, so if you have a wheeled mobility device you can jump in on the race!

We need your help to fund the building of these new things and get open sooner so you can get playing faster! By reaching our goals we can make this place the kind of place that our childhood selves would lose their minds over. Every dollar we get is going right into construction and purchasing all the parts we need to get you to the starting line. We already have the space and the team. We've got designs in hand and we're ready to build. The better our campaign goes the faster we are able to get open and welcome you back in for your and your friends, your birthdays, team events and date nights. 
All we need you to do is to pick a perk and get your tickets for half price now. Every ticket gets you to our exclusive grand opening party and advance sneak peaks to what we're doing (including a super top secret project cause you know you love surprises). 

There are a lot gyms out there, but there isn't a of places like Pursuit OCR. It's not just for fitness enthusiasts looking for an alternative workout, it's also a place where you can really engage with people. We pride ourselves on being a non judgmental inclusive space and that's not just lip service. We want to show that you can build a space that is considerate of all identities and abilities  in the fitness community and one that gives back to those communities as well. 
So many of you have come through  and shared your life celebrations, first dates, birthdays and conquered things that you weren't even sure you could. We're proud to have watched you run up that warp wall while people cheered you on, We laughed with you as you splashed down in our ballpit and won our nerf wars.
Our first home was a great example of what can happen when great people join in on a great idea. We've loved being a home to all that and we're excited to continue on that path with you and provide you with the space to shine.

 

We'd also love if you can share this campaign with friends, co workers and family. Maybe you have that cousin that loves American Ninja Warrior and would love to see if they could compete? That hard to shop for friend that did the Tough Mudder last year and had a blast? This is perfect for them! The company outing that you're trying to plan and no one wants to do the same thing they did last year? This is going to make you look like a hero! 
Help us out and we'll be forever grateful and I'm sure the person you share it with will think you're just the best too.

*FOLLOW US ON INSTAGRAM @pursuitocr

story:
Eclectic Cafe

I am Melanie Robinson. I'm a Wife, a Mom, and a Chef. 

At 30 I choose to return to school in 2010 to pursue a love of cooking. I enrolled at Georgian College with the support of my husband, family and friends. When I stepped into school for the second time, it couldn't have felt more complete, this is what I was to do with my life. To show people love through food. 

During school, I took at every opportunity that I was presented with. Since I was returning to school for the second time around I had to push and challenge my self. I competed in several competitions, became the junior president of the Muskoka Chefs Association, won a stage to Kelowna BC with the Canadian Culinary Federation in 2012. Most recently competing on Chopped Canada in season 3 episode 9 and winning my episode against 3 other Chefs across Canada.

So then if I won Chopped Canada why am I doing a crowdfunding campaign you may ask?

Well there are two answers to that one!

To start, right after the show I realized I was 3 weeks pregnant.  When the show finally aired I was 8 1/2 months pregnant.  Going on maternity leave on a cook's salary is pretty thin so most of the money went to supporting our new and growing family of 4, Melanie, Mike, Madelyn and Myles.

And the second reason for needing a little help from my friends is, I am moving into to a new space in downtown Orillia. I am opening December 20, 2017 on a bare bone budget, utilizing most of my equipment from home, and with some incredible help I am able to open in a limited capacity.

I want to be the local cafe that is known for helping others, supporting my local community, local farmers, producers and artisans. I want to be able to say I am exclusively using local produce. Creating menus on a weekly basis with what is in season and available. I want to be the one in the community that is known for helping each other out, paying it forward and supporting one another. 

This campaign is important to me because it will not only help me grow, but also support the local culinary community as well.  I strive to engage the youth with an interest in culinary arts, paying it forward and being a supporter for the local farm fresh movement.

With the help and support of contributors I would be able to operate at a much higher level then I can at this time.

  • I could purchase commercial equipment that will allow me to create a larger quantity of goods, and a much more efficient kitchen.
  • Allow us to expand and participate at more local farmer’s markets in the area.
  • Training youth with an interest in culinary arts and offer employment in the area.
  • Create community events such as the "Common Ground" dinner series in the carousel commons alley way. This would be a celebration of local food around a communal table with like minded people and Chefs.
  • We would be able to reach a larger demographic in the Simcoe county area by expanding srvices.
  • Paying it forward, being a supporter for the local movement.

In closing, every dollar we raise through this campaign will directly result in keeping your hard earned money within our community. Allowing a working mom to fulfill her dreams of being able to show everyone how to love through food.  Inspire the younger generation to be supportive of each other and grow collaboratively.

"Making every meal memorable". Melanie Robinson

story:
The 1st Arcade Bar on the island!

An Arcade Bar is a bar with arcade machines, pinball tables and a retro-nostalgia sense in the air....

We are adding selected craft beer escorted by serious snacks, beer-pong, board and card games, surprise quiz and competitions with rewards, 80's and 90's candies, a fascinating retro gaming theme, the best music of the era and...VOILA - A Super Gaming Land right under our feet- a time travel to make us a few decades younger and 100% happier!

 

OK. What's in it for us?

This place is for all of us! So it shall be built by all of us...

We have already invested time (months) and money (tens of thousands), we did the construction work and we prepared the kitchen, so now it's time to get serious!

In order to finalize the project we need to collect at least 10000 USD more. This amount will be used for purchasing arcades and pinball tables, decorating our space and getting the first batch of food and booze in.

 

We know what fun looks like, so let's make it happen!

We are collaborating only with the best, so we are getting arcade machines with ALL the games from all the consoles of the 80's and the 90's (10000+ games to enjoy!!!), the best pinball tables (http://www.sternpinball.com/) and the best craft beer available!

Best things in life are free and we will give you as much as we can of them!

Lots of freebies await and most importantly if we manage to reach our target we will set all of our arcade machines on FREEPLAY!

And that's not all! We'll organize quiz competitions, beer-pong tournaments and more, with cool giveaways and rewards!

 

Let's see it growing up together!

Our place is small, but warm (and cool at the same time), cozy and it will certainly be fun!

We are prepared to soon face the need to move to a bigger space, in order to serve the best quality and organize the most interactive and fun experiences for all of our friends!

Your contribution in all levels will be invaluable in order to get the best conditions possible to feed our passion! We are prepared to do all the work!

We need more than money can buy. Your love!

After dedicating some of your hard earned cash to our common cause, it will be time to:

  • Help us with creative ideas on how to decorate our place
  • Recommend your favorite games and characters
  • Ask for your favorite beer or beer-cocktail or that dreamy beer snack that keeps you up at night 

and anything that you can come up with!

You don't have enough cash to contribute, but you love the cause and you want to help?

There is always something to do! Most importantly we have to spread the word and get people closer to our noble intentions.

Follow us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/spheresterion/) and share this campaign.

Let all your friends know about us, bring them in and ask them to bring their friends! The more the merrier! ;)

Help us press start! 1980-1990 thanks in advance!!! ;)

story:
1. Ibali Lethu : Our Story

Creating our own opportunities

We are Lewis Kalombo and Nelson Lotrin - two young entrepreneurs. Our journey with Ibali started almost a year ago. We both come from difficult backgrounds and through the Ibali coffee shop we hope to make a way for ourselves and achieve our dreams. By creating this opportunity for ourselves, we are taking the lead in our lives. Ibali has given us something to focus on and to be committed to. We want to use our skills and our passion for coffee and entrepreneurship to create a change in our lives.

“I know I need to do this. I have this goal I want to achieve. Every day I wake up with a sense of motivation. This is something I can put my heart into. Something I have created myself. I know I need to take it one step at a time. We are close now, we have put so much into it and we have overcome so much already. We just need you to join us for this last push.”  Lewis Kalombo, Co-founder, Ibali Coffee Shop

Creating opportunities for others

The coffee shop is not just for us - we want it to also have an impact on others. We want to show other young people that with hard work, a positive mindset and a strong network of support, you can succeed. We want to be a concrete example that no matter where we come from, we can overcome the obstacles that come in our way and be successful. Through Ibali we will have more possibilities to mentor other youth and help them practically to change their lives. For example, we would like to offer barista trainings for other young people.

“Yes it is about changing my life. But it is a bringing change for others. When I get that success, I can go back and help those people that are around me. I want to help to put them on the the same road that I have walked.” Nelson Lotrin, Co-founder, Ibali Coffee Shop

Ibali is more than just a coffee shop - it is a space for young people and other people that use the local area to come together, to break down the barriers between them and create a new story through their conversations with each other.

Where we come from, there aren’t enough supportive environments that encourage young people. Inspired by the experiences that Mamelani Projects offered us, we would like to create a space where we can bring people together and open the space for new stories to grow. Ibali is a way for us to give back. It is a way for us to create that kind of environment for other young people - a space that they can come to when they are looking for some encouragement, for someone to talk to, for someone to give them honest feedback so that they can keep going and not give up on their dreams.

2. What we need to make our dream work

In order to get Ibali up and running we need to raise R150,000 (10,800 US Dollars/9,300 Euros). This will enable us to practically setup the coffee shop and provide the necessary start-up capital.

We have already fundraised for R50,000 with the support of Mamelani Projects. 

This leaves us with a goal of R100,000 (7,200 US Dollars) for this Indiegogo campaign.

We would like to purchase a coffee machine, a grinder, a mobile wagon bar (see image in our profile) and all the other necessary equipment needed to get started. Our hope is that with this support we will be able to create a self-sustaining initiative that supplies high quality service and delicious coffee.

3. What we have already done

We have already done a market research study which showed us that this area of Observatory, Cape Town lacks a coffee shop with high quality coffee and great atmosphere.The people we spoke to were very excited about the prospect of Ibali coffee shop.

With Mamelani’s support, we have already raised R50,000 towards these costs. We have also secured a space that we will be using for the coffee shop. We have had tables and storage units donated - and we have partnered with Thingking (http://www.thingking.co.za/) to co-create and beautify the space. Our logo was specifically designed by a professional graphic designer and we are ready to make this coffee shop dream a reality. We have worked hard to put together a comprehensive business plan outlining all aspects of the business and  we have chosen Mischu (http://www.mischu.co.za/) as our coffee supplier. Mischu was voted as The Best Coffee in Cape Town in 2015 and 2016.

Aside from the practical side of the business, we have also acquired the skills that we need to make a success of Ibali. We have both been trained as baristas through GroundUp Academy and The Ciro Coffee Academy and have gained practical experience at Deluxe Coffee and Seattle Coffee Company. Lewis has also developed his entrepreneurial skills through courses at The Knowledge 2 Share Foundation (https://www.k2sfoundation.com/) and the Leadership Programme at Rlabs (https://rlabs.org/).

4. Other ways you could help

Help us spread the word! Please share this crowdfunding campaign and our Facebook Page https://www.facebook.com/Ibalicoffeeshop/ on all your social media profiles and encourage your friends and families to contribute! We need your support to get started!

5. Risks and challenges

The simple and bold step of starting a small social impact business becoming young entrepreneurs, we are already embracing risk! However, we are doing this in a safe and strategic way - ensuring that we minimise the risks through effective planning and working with others to assist us in creating a business plan. We would like to thank Mamelani Projects, a Cape Town-based NGO. Mamelani has played a significant role in our journey and is still walking alongside us in developing Ibali
