story:
I'm Karyn Sherwood. It's been a dream of mine to open a costume rental house since I started college as a costumer. Historical costuming was my first love. When I was 11, I got my friends to dress up like peasants and play in the woods behind our houses. It makes sense to start off with Renaissance costumes!

My first job ever was at the PA Renaissance Faire at 16.

It sparked my interest in professional costuming. Since then I've pursued the costuming profession with a passion, working for professional theatres, production houses, and cruise lines. 5 years ago I found myself back at the faire. It was my pleasure to dress people up at Lady Gwendolyn's and see the fun and joy it brought guests. Sadly, Gwen has closed her doors at the PA faire. (She's still has her full shop in Pitman, NJ and you can find her at the New Jersey Faire.) But for PA, that means there is nowhere to rent a costume on the grounds.

With everything Gwen taught me and my experience over the last decade as a costumer, I'm excited to open a new costume rental place on the faire grounds. The timing is perfect to buy a building and I need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need to raise $30,000 to get the building and $10,000 to pay fees and create stock for the store
  • You get to dress up and enjoy your time at the Faire. Some of the perks will be garb made to your size and color preferences and special discounts for multiple visits or for groups.

The Impact

  • To educate and entertain through historical costuming. Not only will I be renting unique garb, but there will also be an historical demonstration of what different classes wore during the renaissance.
  • I've made plenty of garb for the faire. It's safer to say that these items are clothing and not costumes. The pieces are well structured, durable, and most importantly, comfortable. Dressing up enhances your experience at the faire. You become a part of the shire and not just an observer.
  • Children can wear a costume without worry of growing out of it.
  • My current etsy shop is zero waste. All of my scrap fabric is used to make pet beds and toys that I donate to local pet rescues and shelters. I will continue this practice with the scraps from the rentals.

The Challenge

Time could run out on the building's availability. I want to move quickly to make sure I can accomplish everything before the opening of the faire season in August. By moving forward several months out, that gives me time to fully stock the rentals with brand new pieces, decorate the shop, find and create my team of dressers and stitchers, and get all the paperwork in place.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially there are other ways to help!

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE!!! spread the word! The more the merrier.
  • Volunteer. Time is so valuable and I never have enough of it. If you're interested in helping out message me and I'll be happy for your time. I'll need videos, pictures, stitchers, gardeners, reminders to take breaks and eat, etc.

I'm Karyn Sherwood. It's been a dream of mine to open a costume rental house since I started college as a costumer. Historical costuming was my first love. When I was 11, I got my friends to dress up like peasants and play in the woods behind our houses. It makes sense to start off with Renaissance costumes!
My first job ever was at the PA Renaissance Faire at 16.
It sparked my interest in professional costuming. Since then I've pursued the costuming profession with a passion, working for professional theatres, production houses, and cruise lines. 5 years ago I found myself back at the faire. It was my pleasure to dress people up at Lady Gwendolyn's and see the fun and joy it brought guests. Sadly, Gwen has closed her doors at the PA faire. (She's still has her full shop in Pitman, NJ and you can find her at the New Jersey Faire.) But for PA, that means there is nowhere to rent a costume on the grounds.

story:
Ranch's Story

Ranch Pizza got it's start as a pop-up pizza delivery shop, operating out of rented kitchen space, serving customers at nearby watering holes in SE Portland, OR. What began as an experimental side project between two guys who shared a love of pizza, quickly turned into a thriving business with a great product and a loyal following. Now, in a partnership with Title Bout Restaurant Group, we have signed a lease on a space in the fantastic Woodlawn neighborhood in NE Portland, and are planning for a grand opening in the Spring or early Summer of 2018!

We can't think of a more appropriate means of raising the additional funds we need than from the folks who helped us get here in the first place, and all we want is to bring our pizza to as many people as possible. 

Restaurants are expensive to build, license, and operate, which is why we're asking our dedicated fans for some help in the process in exchange for some great perks once we're open. With the money we raise, we'll be able to offer our pizza, salads and sides, along with a great selection of draft beer, wine, and specialty cocktails in a great new (and family friendly) setting, open 7 days-a-week for lunch and dinner.

So far we've raised enough money through loans, and with help from family, to get started on the design, licensing, and early construction phases of the project. The additional funds we raise through this campaign will help us complete construction, purchase a sign, pay for painting and artwork, buy all the equipment we need, purchase inventory and help pay our employees during the opening process. 

We really went HARD to make the perks of this campaign attractive to all you Ranch fans. And we really tried to stick to what everyone is in this for to begin with: THE PIZZA! You'll find some very straight forward offers of food and drink, some classic Ranch swag, and also some special discount perks that could really pay off in the end. We're here to show our appreciation, so most of the perks are a better deal than what you might get once we're open for regular business. 

We really appreciate you taking the time to check out our campaign, and we're really excited to make this restaurant happen. Check back for our video coming soon for some behind the scenes action. 

Also, in the mean time be sure to come by for a taste of our pizza inside the awesome bar, Poison's Rainbow (www.poisonsrainbow.com), designed and owned by Isaac Brock of Modest Mouse!

story:
​ESSEN. The Art of Eating Well.

Co-Founders; Patricia Bittner, and Lida Bilokur have teamed up with Food Scientist and Head Chef Lopez under the shared belief that delicious, healthy food should be affordable and accessible to everyone. We're ESSEN, and we're bringing plant-based fast food to Porkopolis, aka Cincinnati, Ohio. 

  • 100% Plant-Based Meals, Sustainable.

  • Delivery or Take-Out, Convenient.

  • Locally Sourced Fresh Ingredients, Healthy.

 

​ESSEN Team

Yasel Lopez - Head Chef and Food Scientist

"Every meal is a creative challenge, this is my approach with ESSEN." I started cooking alongside my grandmother at an early age. Growing up in Cuba, All of our ingredients came from our back yard or our neighbors’, and what we ate was always determined by what ingredients were readily available, fresh and in season. To be successful with limited ingredients you need to understand the chemistry of each component, which spices bring certain flavors out, etc. I joined ESSEN because I want to serve and feed my community by providing affordable, beautiful, flavorful food.
As Chef Massimo Bottura says, 'Beauty is not just for rich people.'"


Jerk Sandwich: Seared marinated tofu, with garlic aioli, tomato and spring greens

 

Patricia Bittner
Co-Founder, Architect LEED AP

"We have a moral obligation to give back to our community, and to contribute to an environmental solution and a health solution."

Patricia was born and raised in Cincinnati, Ohio where every meal included a large meat course and came with an obligatory glass of milk. After spending 35 years traveling and living in different cities and countries experiencing less meat-centric cuisines, Patricia moved back to her hometown because her father was diagnosed with Cancer. Patricia knew of the health benefits of plant-based eating but Cincinnati didn't have many convenient options. Patricia became an expert in the subject and is now a plant-based eater for environmental and health reasons.

 

Lida Bilokur
Co-Founder, Creative & Biz Dev

Lida is an advocate for healthy food access, an athlete, a foodie, and holds a business degree in Strategic Marketing. Born in LA and raised in Seattle, Lida grew up eating cuisines from many different cultures. She moved to Cincinnati after attending school in Ohio and noticed that the City's dining scene was packed with delicious meals: all meat, cheese, and bread centered. It lacked affordable healthy meal options. Either the price point was too high to feed the locals, or the quality of the healthy food was tasteless and unsatisfying.

 

ESSEN Brick & Mortar

Our modern kitchen is located on the corner of the busy 5-way intersection on Vine and Findlay; 1 Findaly Ave, Cincinnati OH 45202 and we are ready for the final stage.

 

Why OTR? Why Cincinnati?

Porkopolis: We love Cincinnati, our community, and there's a need.
According to The State of Obesity, Ohio has the 19th highest adult obesity rate in the nation and people of color are affected by diabetes and obesity 7.6% more than White and Latinos. OTR's neighborhood demographics show 47% of the neighborhood being African American and 41% being White Americans. 



 

 

We have collaborated with multiple community partners to spread awareness around issues surrounding our health and environmental issues, and call attention to the lack of easily accessible healthy food options. We plan to partner with schools, local businesses, youth sports teams, and community organizations to educate and empower.

 

Local Businesses: NOLI, oFF tHE vINE, Brezel, Peace Street Bakery, Queen City Infusions, Skeleton Roots, Laboite. 
*ESSEN partnered with seven local Cincinnati businesses to host a soft-launch event for ESSEN where guests learned about the ethos of ESSEN; sustainability, design, collaboration. The Art of Eating Well. 

 

ESSEN's Impact:

  • Easy Access to Healthy Affordable Food. OTR's (Over The Rhine neighborhood in Cincinnati) rich culture is rooted in its history as a port-of-entry for immigrants to Cincinnati. This beautifully diverse neighborhood is quickly gentrifying; becoming a hub for new businesses, restaurants, bars, and the demographic of OTR is changing with it.
    • OTR’s current restaurant spread includes a plethora of different delicious meal options but the majority of these options either; have a price point well-above what OTR residents can afford, are fried or processed and unhealthy, and are meat or dairy centered. If you find a healthy menu item it doesn't come with the flavorful or satisfying feeling you get with other dishes.
    • The low income residents of OTR are under-served; either you spend $7-$10 to eat unhealthy fast food or you spend $22+ to eat a satisfying healthy meal. ESSEN is working to close this gap by providing residents of OTR with flavorful quick lunches that are also affordable and healthy.
  • A Global Health Solution. People are suffering from diabetes, heart disease, and other obesity related illnesses. Countless studies have showed that plant-based eating reduces these health risks. "Kaiser Permanente, the largest healthcare organization in the U.S., and the American Institute for Cancer Research are now recommending a plant-centric diet to combat heart disease and other common killers.​" Learn More.
  • A Global Climate-Change Solution. Many meat and dairy processes are adversely affecting our environment and irresponsibly consuming resources. We want to support farmers who share our values, so all of our food is sustainably grown, fresh, and locally sourced. Learn More
  • Plant-based Diets have moved from Trend to Lifestyle. "The plant-based movement is bigger than any one generation. Everyone from celebrities to athletes to entire companies including Google and countries as big as China are supporting the movement to eat more plant-based foods."
    Learn More

 

Wherever you are, do you believe in our mission?

Here's how you can support us:

We're offering discounted meal packs, catered dinners, merchandise, local deals, goodwill gifts and more in exchange for your donation. 

Local Perks (L)

  • $10 Try an ESSEN Lunch (L)
  • $100 Ten-Pack of ESSEN Lunches (L)
  • $200 Market Lunch with Chef Lopez for Two (L)
  • $1000 Chef's Dinner with Wine for 6 (L)

Anywhere Perks:

  • $5 Plant a Tree
  • $30 ESSEN T-Shirt
  • $30 ESSEN Tote
  • $80 ESSEN Merch Combo
  • $2000 An ESSEN Dish in your name

 

Final Stages:

We need to raise $20,000 to fund the final stage of setting up our brick and mortar kitchen with equipment, software, and sustainable packaging. Here are our remaining costs:

  1. Refrigerators (used) $2,600
  2. Grease interceptor (required by city) $3,500
  3. Sinks and sanitizing system $1,500
  4. Cabinetry and counter tops $1,500
  5. Pot racks, stainless steel tables and shelving $1,200
  6. Convection oven and wall brackets $2,500
  7. Induction cooktop $1,000
  8. Kitchen, payroll and POS software and equipment $1,200
  9. Sustainable packaging bulk order $5,000

 

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

    • Our biggest challenge is changing the stigma that surrounds plant-based foods. Doing this is more than introducing a new product; it's scaling a sustainable mindset.
      • We plan on tackling this through soft awareness and educational marketing campaigns, and encouraging eaters to review Chef Lopez's delicious cooking on Yelp to build credibility and spread the word that plant-based eating can be delicious.
        Learn More

    "My goal with ESSEN is to create delicious food that everyone will enjoy. If you're ordering my sandwich instead of the cheeseburger down the street, I've succeeded.”

    -Chef Lopez

     

     

    Other Ways You Can Help: Awareness.

    We understand that some people are unable to financially contribute. Luckily, there are plenty of other ways you can support; Share our campaign using Indiegogo's Share Tools:

    • Share it on your Facebook page, and any groups you're in
    • Tweet about it
    • Post it on your Instagram
    • Email it to your co-workers and family members
    • Reach out to your local press

story:
Who is Hair Color Art??

Hello to everyone here reading this and considering contributing to the art side of my Hair Color Art project. 

My name is Kristin Dutcher and I have been a professional hairstylist for 18 years. I grew up in Binghamton, New York and this is where I went to beauty school and started my hairstylist journey! After finishing beauty school, I decided to fulfill my dream and move to The Big Apple!! I started working at Dramatics NYC, joined up with DisgraceLand Family Freakshow, and went to art school at FIT! NYC was a huge learning experience and I found out how important it is to surround yourself with people who are smarter than you, more talented than you and keep your mind open and available to new things!

I went from one monumental experiential salon to another at The Electric Chair in San Diego, Ca! While I was working at EC, I was introduced to A Reason To Survive (A.R.T.S.) Arts is a nonprofit art school for at risk youth. It is a place where kids 4-24 could come and escape their reality and dive into art. This place helped the troubled youth find friends, education, freedom and companionship!! 

Fast forward 5 years and here I am in Ithaca, New York, doing hair, loving life and ready to wrap it all together! All of these experiences in my life were life changing and I want to take pieces of them all and share them with the Ithaca community! 

Hair Color Art is more than a hair salon, it is a place for the community to gather and get their hands dirty! A salon is an environment for conversation, engagement and social interactions. I want to connect all the people of Ithaca to the artists of Ithaca! I want to start a Creative Zone, a space where we all come together and learn, see art, create art and look great doing it!! The most important part of this project is to have it be free! And the best part is You're all invited!! 

What I need and What you get!!

I am asking for $7,000 which will help get this project off the ground from day 1!!

  • The first $1,200 will end up going towards campaign fees, taxes and reward purchases.
  • $$$ will go towards filling the communal supply closet. These supplies include;
  1. Canvases, Drawing paper, Charcoal Paper, Sketchbooks, etc.
  2. Drawing pencils, charcoals, Oil pastels, acrylic, oil, watercolor paints..
  3. Paintbrushes, jars, towels..
  4. Drawing boards, Easels, chairs, Tables... Etc!!
  • $$ will go towards payment of life drawing models. 
  • $$ will go towards the paint and supplies needed to paint a mandala mural on the ceiling of Hair Color Art.
  • $$ will go towards miscellaneous supplies for gallery wall maintenance, ie, paint and Spackle, nails, etc.
  • $$ would be used for the purpose of bringing local made beverages and snack to salon and gallery patrons. 
  • Any leftover funds will enter a savings account to continue to maintain supplies and the experiential events!

The benefit to having the supply closet stocked and ready to go, will help create successful community art events starting on day 1. Some of these awesome events I have planned are..

  • Life Drawing session with introductory lesson from guest artist. Community will have the option to sign up and take the class and use the mediums provided at no extra cost!
  • Magazine and book collage party! With help from participating artist, community will have the ability to cut and paste magazine clippings to create a unique image or design. 
  • Illustration art session! This event will give the community an opportunity to work with local illustrative artists to bring a mini story to life!!

These are just a couple events planned for the opening year of HCA!! Each month will bring a new artist and each First Friday will bring a new event or party that all are welcome to attend! 

The Impact 

Art has been one constant in my life that has been my most valuable asset! Regardless of the outcome, the process of creating art is therapeutic and has gotten me through some rough times. I enjoy galleries and museums, they always inspire me to try something new.

I have taught in multiple art programs, Fall Creek Enrichment Program, Wine and Design in Ithaca, Uncorked Creations is Binghamton and ARTS in Sand Diego. I have attended F.I.T. in NYC for Fine Arts and Mesa College for Art Therapy even though I do not hold degrees in these fields. 

Through my time at ARTS, it helped me really connect the idea that art creates an environment where people find comfort and understanding in themselves. It helps children and adults find connections in each other. I worked with kids who were going through some very serious difficulties. Anywhere from family deaths to juvenile hall, but when they got to ARTS all that adult drama seemed to be left at the door. It took coaxing sometimes but after a few visits and dedicated mentors, they had a safe and fun place to unload, relax and create!

While teaching enrichment  at Fall Creek Elementary School, I taught all kinds of classes to kids pre-k through 5th. Some examples are collage, painting, paper mache, drawing, and sculpting. I also taught a themed Harry Potter class that encompassed a variety of mediums and projects. 

I recognize that this project is starting on a small scale and inside another business but with your donations, I will be able to provide the materials needed to create this space and allow people to partake at no fee!! While clients receive their hair services they can create art, while clients with small children get their hair done, their children can paint or draw.

I would love to bring creativity to the client and to offer more than just a salon experience. Hair is a way to express yourself creatively and it shouldn't just end there. Hair Color Art is a safe space to be yourself and be as colorful and open as one can be!

I went from one monumental experiential salon to another at The Electric Chair in San Diego, Ca! While I was working at EC, I was introduced to A Reason To Survive (A.R.T.S.) Arts is a nonprofit art school for at risk youth. It is a place where kids 4-24 could come and escape their reality and dive into art. This place helped the troubled youth find friends, education, freedom and companionship!! 
Fast forward 5 years and here I am in Ithaca, New York, doing hair, loving life and ready to wrap it all together! All of these experiences in my life were life changing and I want to take pieces of them all and share them with the Ithaca community! 
Hair Color Art is more than a hair salon, it is a place for the community to gather and get their hands dirty! A salon is an environment for conversation, engagement and social interactions. I want to connect all the people of Ithaca to the artists of Ithaca! I want to start a Creative Zone, a space where we all come together and learn, see art, create art and look great doing it!! The most important part of this project is to have it be free! And the best part is You're all invited!! 

What I need and What you get!!
I am asking for $7,000 which will help get this project off the ground from day 1!!

The first $1,200 will end up going towards campaign fees, taxes and reward purchases.
$$$ will go towards filling the communal supply closet. These supplies include;


Canvases, Drawing paper, Charcoal Paper, Sketchbooks, etc.
Drawing pencils, charcoals, Oil pastels, acrylic, oil, watercolor paints..
Paintbrushes, jars, towels..
Drawing boards, Easels, chairs, Tables... Etc!!


$$ will go towards payment of life drawing models. 
$$ will go towards the paint and supplies needed to paint a mandala mural on the ceiling of Hair Color Art.
$$ will go towards miscellaneous supplies for gallery wall maintenance, ie, paint and Spackle, nails, etc.
$$ would be used for the purpose of bringing local made beverages and snack to salon and gallery patrons. 
Any leftover funds will enter a savings account to continue to maintain supplies and the experiential events!

The benefit to having the supply closet stocked and ready to go, will help create successful community art events starting on day 1. Some of these awesome events I have planned are..


Life Drawing session with introductory lesson from guest artist. Community will have the option to sign up and take the class and use the mediums provided at no extra cost!

Magazine and book collage party! With help from participating artist, community will have the ability to cut and paste magazine clippings to create a unique image or design. 

Illustration art session! This event will give the community an opportunity to work with local illustrative artists to bring a mini story to life!!

These are just a couple events planned for the opening year of HCA!! Each month will bring a new artist and each First Friday will bring a new event or party that all are welcome to attend! 

The Impact 
Art has been one constant in my life that has been my most valuable asset! Regardless of the outcome, the process of creating art is therapeutic and has gotten me through some rough times. I enjoy galleries and museums, they always inspire me to try something new.
I have taught in multiple art programs, Fall Creek Enrichment Program, Wine and Design in Ithaca, Uncorked Creations is Binghamton and ARTS in Sand Diego. I have attended F.I.T. in NYC for Fine Arts and Mesa College for Art Therapy even though I do not hold degrees in these fields. 
Through my time at ARTS, it helped me really connect the idea that art creates an environment where people find comfort and understanding in themselves. It helps children and adults find connections in each other. I worked with kids who were going through some very serious difficulties. Anywhere from family deaths to juvenile hall, but when they got to ARTS all that adult drama seemed to be left at the door. It took coaxing sometimes but after a few visits and dedicated mentors, they had a safe and fun place to unload, relax and create!
While teaching enrichment  at Fall Creek Elementary School, I taught all kinds of classes to kids pre-k through 5th. Some examples are collage, painting, paper mache, drawing, and sculpting. I also taught a themed Harry Potter class that encompassed a variety of mediums and projects. 
I recognize that this project is starting on a small scale and inside another business but with your donations, I will be able to provide the materials needed to create this space and allow people to partake at no fee!! While clients receive their hair services they can create art, while clients with small children get their hair done, their children can paint or draw.
I would love to bring creativity to the client and to offer more than just a salon experience. Hair is a way to express yourself creatively and it shouldn't just end there. Hair Color Art is a safe space to be yourself and be as colorful and open as one can be!

story:
Three years ago I did a large business expansion and opened a wellness center and the economy has made it a bit challenging to find practitioners to rent treatment rooms. Many of the bills have gone unpaid and the store hasn't been properly restocked in a long time due as a result of lack of needed rental income. Funds from this campaign with restock our store (many of our suppliers require large minimum orders), pay back bills and debts, as well as launch a marketing campaign to fill the remaining three treatment rooms.

Each mystery box contains a variety of our most popular items and some new items. If you have a strong preference against a color/scent/flavor please let us know. Be sure to provide your mailing address so we can send your box, boxes may take up to 3-6 weeks to ship as we order new inventory. If you prefer to pick your box up in the store we can arrange for that too.

Thank you for your support!

story:
It's what's on the inside that counts and Lil's wants to show you why!!!

What the HECK is happening?

With some help from you we are hoping to open our doors and bring the magic of Lil's inside!  Once inside we will have an expanded deli, bar and of course places to hang with our favorite people.  No more rain, no more cold, no more bugs... unless you are into that kind of stuff of course.

Wait...how did Lil's get here anyway?

Since 2016, Lil's has been bringing delicious food and community togetherness to Covington, KY.  This journey all started when Julia moved to the Cov from NYC and found herself searching high and low for a GOOD bagel, and eventually began making them herself.  Soon she was selling the bagels at local coffee shops and farmers markets and eventually opened a walk-up Windough at 308 Greenup St.   Lil's is named after Julia's jewish grandmother, Lilian Kessler, whose best dishes were tuna salad and hot dogs, but who was one that taught Julia what a GOOD bagel was.

In the last year, Lil's has grown and transformed, and is no longer just a bagel shop.  During the day, Lil's is a deli where everything is fresh, local and unique, a community fundraiser space, and a meeting space.  In the evenings you can come to Lil's for everything from happy hours, movie nights, trivia and dance parties. With the dedication of our amazing customers, friends, neighbors and team, we believe Lil's has become a community landmark.  

So if Lil's has come this far, why do you need me?

We are a lil’ business. A lil business that has made it this far because of you.  We started in our kitchen, cut our teeth at the farmer’s market, and eventually opened the Windough.  Every step of the way we’ve been fueled by 100% pure Chutzpah and 0% investor dollars.  The next step is the biggest one yet, and with your help we can stay 100% independently owned and community focused.

The thing is, Lil's has become all of this as a simple walk-up Windough.  Now, with your help we are ready to open Lil's doors and bring the hawtness inside.  Through this expansion, Lil's will be able to fully realize it's mission to become a full deli, a diverse and inclusive space, and a community anchor.  We have only gotten this far because of all of you, and ask that you please help us take the next step by donating as little or as much as you can.

 

What We Need & What You Get

WHAT WE NEED:

Stuff to sit and eat on 

Chairs/Benches/Tables 

Things made of wood and such 

Counters

Shelving

Boxes to keep things cold and hot 

Deli Case

Fridges 

Commercial Toaster

That Décor Though 

Wallpaper

Mural

Neon

Signage

Disco ball of course

Lighting, Plumbing, and Technology Oh My!  

Lights 

Plumbing/Electric

TOTAL = Over $32,000

 

How YOU can help and how we will THANK YOU?

Give a little get a lot…

$1,000 = A sandwich every week for life AND a picture of your Bubbe on the wall

$500 = Boozy Bagel Making Class and Brunch for you and up to 10 friends

$100 = The Lil’s True FANatic Basket ( Lil’s Hat, Lil’s Shirt, Lil’s Everything Seasoning, Brunch Fixin’s for 10, 1 Free Hawt Coffee every week for a year & a Lil’s Exclusive Flamingo Sticker)

$50= $75 in bagels with schmear & a Lil’s Exclusive Flamingo Sticker

$20= Lil’s Tee Shirt or Hat & & a Lil’s Exclusive Flamingo Sticker

$10= Bagel & Schmear for you AND a friend & a Lil’s Exclusive Flamingo Sticker

You’ve made Lil’s bigger, badder and hawter than we ever imagined.  Thanks for getting us here…we hope you will help us open the door to our next adventure!

story:
Hey guys! Getting ready to release a new book in a couple of weeks and thought I would like to donante 15% to charity each time so I am launching this to do pre-orders.

Basically, you get the book for $20, and then 15% will be donanted to Crumbs & Whiskers, a cat cafe designed to rescuse and help kitties get adopted. 

Please donate today and help support my art and kitties. It's a win-win. If this works I will tie a charity to each new release. 

Please feel free to donate more. 15% of the full total will go to Crumbs and Whiskers.

story:
Our Yoga Community

In September 2019 Crystal Heart Yoga officially opened its doors in Corning, New York. We have been fortunate to watch our community grow together, the teaching staff expand, and our class offerings provide a much needed touchstone in many lives. 

Just 6 months after opening we must now temporarily shutter our beloved new studio in response to the global COVID-19 pandemic. We wish for us all to remain connected and remember what awaits us. To keep that dream a reality we have started this campaign, allowing you to back this small, local business--Support Crystal Heart Yoga in Style!  

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of the funds to keep our business running while we are unable to use the studio space. Classes must stop for now, but our financial obligations and basic expenses do not.  This is a challenge! I must still cover insurances, taxes on the lease, the lease itself, minimal utilities, and the like. 

If you decide to purchase something from the campaign you will support the studio financially right away. You also help to create awareness for the studio when you post pictures of your studio-branded threads and wear them out in the world when we resume our normal activities. Tag us on Instagram with @crystal.heart.yoga!

Other Ways You Can Help

Consider sharing this campaign with anyone who likes shirts, yoga, and/or small businesses! Please let others know that they can support the studio by posting on social media or sending them a link. We thank you!

Consider using some of the upcoming pay-what-you-can YouTube videos!

You can also find weekly Live streaming classes on the Crystal Heart Yoga Facebook page, co-hosted with the Southeast Steuben County Library. These will be archived for you to use at any time, (*note, the first class is available on the library's Facebook page) and air at 10a Fridays until the library reopens.  We are also creating a YouTube channel for yoga classes to use from home. 

I built this studio as a tribute to the practice of yoga and all its seekers.  This small business was built of heart, time, sweat, sacrifice, and love. I am now only one of many who view our studio as an anchor--as a sanctuary.  We will work to keep it. We need help to ensure it remains a valued resource in Corning.

story:
The founder of Western Alternative Energies is Dan Curfew. Dan has been working on this project for the last 7 years. Dan has a patent on this technology and it was proven by the Department of Energy at the Idaho National Labs. The scientists there could not disprove this technology. They stated that they had never seen anything like this before. Dan has several working prototypes of this product from very small units to what he has developed today. Western Alternative Energies has been invited to participate in the incubator program which is located in the University of Wyoming's building which has the Wyoming Technology Business Center of the Casper Area located inside. 

We have named this campaign and product called THE GRID. There is no other product like this anywhere. The standard size will produce a total of 3.5 Mega Watts of power. The unit has the ability to even power your home. Imagine Clean Power with no emission. Solar panels do produce emissions. THE GRID can now provide you with the power you need anywhere. This can also be used as a backup power source for your home when you lose power, or use it as your main power source and Never worry about power outages again.You can also take this camping, and use this in your camper or RV as it is silent, use it on a job site , power a school. The uses for this is endless. The funding raised here will move this product to the next phase, production. 

We will be able to bring power to any location in the world. This product is eco-friendly , non corrosive, non-explosive, and recyclable. The best part is there is nothing like this in the world, which means no competition. This product can last for months, or years, depending on the load configuration, producing power. If you run out of power, change the fuel card and your ready to go again.

The amount of funding we seeking is $225,000 

Some of this money $100,000 will be used to purchase a die made to manufacture the plastic molded injection tool,this container will hold THE GRID.  We will have an advertising and marketing campaign of which we are allocating $40,000 and being able to add 1 or 2 employees at a cost of $40,000. The attorneys fee of $20,000 for additional patents and contracts. Materials $20,000. If we raise more money then asked for we be able to purchase additional molds for the additional models that are being engineered at this time. 

The perks we will have are discounts ranging from 5-15% off your total purchase price. T-shirts, coffee mugs and a personalized thank you card for everyone. When we find a new building to move into, we will have a donation wall for all the people that help us make this happen. This product will also help many people. If the goal is not made, we will then evaluate how much is donated and continue on a much smaller scale. It will just take longer to get to people and places that can really use our help.

When THE GRID is introduced to the world, this will be a game changer as the different uses this will have. We can help third world countries to power the villages. People in remote areas will have power instead of relying on other sources, which can be affected by the weather. This product can withstand an Electro Magnetic Pulse.

The only hurdle we will face is not being able to fill the orders quick enough. To overcome this, we will be able to hire employees on a global scale.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Everyone get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Principals:

         


I am Carlos Vargas, a Mechanical Engineer and she is Karla Nieto, a Senior Electromedicine Student. We are are the principals of Varnieto Equipos Medicos. For several years we have been working as volunteers in Venezuela as well in other countries of South America on children health issues, literacy, poverty and other critical issues through various engagements.



We both from Universidad Nacional Experimental del Tachira and as a result of this, we are trying to give back to our community by exploring the endless possibilities of 3D Technology.

The Project

At this time, we want to make a positive impact by delivering 3D printed prosthetics hands for children amputees. based on e-NABLE project and other open source design hubs, we want to deliver 3D printed limbs for those in need of it in San Cristobal, Tachira and Venezuela.



In view of this, we are hoping to get we are hoping to raise funds to purchase the equipments, which would be used purposely for printing prosthetic limbs for amputees. This would make the project faster and more effective.

Peradventure we are not able to reach our goal of raising $2,500, we are going to keep raising funds till we do and we would keep the community of donors and well wishers in the loop about the whole process.

And because of your generous contributions, we would make sure to keep you all informed about our progress. we are not just looking for donors, we are looking for life partners who share in our philosophy that life is meant to be lived through sharing . . .

Our Contribution To Tachira and Venezuela. . .

We live in a city called San Cristóbal in Tachira and as we whole our lives and growing up to the city, our aim is to contribute to its growth by introducing a whole world of possibilities to the amputees.





We are hoping to give standard and quality lifestyle to these sets of people at a relatively low cost than the below average citizen of San Cristobal, Tachira can afford and this can be achievable according to our plans with the use of 3D printers. This project would be the first step of 3D revolution in San Cristobal, Tachira as we are aiming at 3D bio-printing of organs and sophisticated biological designs for borderline operations.

Help us to commence this small start-up venture and join us in the effort to take this endeavour to a point where it impacts lives beyond our widest imagination.

Challenges and Solutions

The main challenges for this project:

  • Operation and maintenance of 3D printers
  • Design of each prosthesis based on each clients condition i.e. custom fitted
  • Proper distribution of the printed prosthetic limbs
Counting on the technical expertise of the team members involved, we are confident to assure you of proffering necessary solutions to these obstacles.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    As we have pointed out earlier, we are looking for people that wants to do more than donate funds . . . anyone who wants to by sharing a design ; those who would love to share this information with others who would be interested; and those who want to be a part in ways that have not occurred to us yet. All help is needed so far it is towards achieving our goal of restoring proximity of the standard and quality of life to amputees in our community.

    Donate Funds | Contribute Designs | Share Ideas | Publicize Campaign
    • 'Like' our Page on Facebook at facebook.com/varnieto
    • Use hashtag #VarnietoTachira in your posts on social media, 
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • You can find us at:
    • https://www.facebook.com/Varnieto/
    • https://www.facebook.com/carlosvarg4s
    • https://www.facebook.com/karla.nieto.9

    Thank You so much :-)



    Versión en Español


    Los Directores:


     


    Yo soy Carlos Vargas, Ingeniero Mecánico y ella es Karla Nieto, estudiante de Electromedicina del último año. Somos los directores de Varnieto Equipos Médicos. Por años hemos estado trabajando como voluntarios en Venezuela como también en otras partes de Sur América en proyectos sociales sobre problemas educación, salud en niños y pobreza entre otros.



    Los dos somos de la Universidad Nacional Experimental del Táchira estamos tratando de dar algo a cambio a la comunidad a través del estudio de la tecnología de impresión 3D.

    El proyecto

    Esta vez queremos hacer un impacto positivo entregando manos prostéticas impresas en 3D a niños basado en el proyecto e-NABLE y otros proyectos de diseños abierto, queremos entregar estas manos a aquellos que los necesiten tanto en San Cristóbal como en el Táchira y Venezuela.  


    En vista de esto estamos esperando poder recaudar fondos los cuales serán usados para el propósito de imprimir las prótesis de manos.

    En dado caso que no seamos capaces de alcanzar nuestra meta de 2500$ pero que seamos capaces de recaudar suficientes fondos nuestra meta es seguir adelante y comenzar con el proyecto, además de seguir recaudando fondos con el fin de que esto sea algo duradero y que podamos mantener el proyecto en marcha, además de poder costear los costos del material para imprimir y los gastos de operación. Mantendremos al día las actualizaciones sobre cómo va el proyecto con el fin de mantener la comunidad de personas que nos apoyan.

    Nuestra contribución al Táchira y a Venezuela. . .

    Vivimos en una ciudad llamada San Cristóbal en el Estado Táchira, nacimos aquí y tenemos toda nuestra vida viviendo en la ciudad, nuestro objetivo es contribuir con la ciudad introduciendo un nuevo mundo de posibilidades para los discapacitados.



    Esperamos darle una mejor calidad de vida a estas personas de acuerdo a nuestros proyectos con el uso de impresión 3D. Este proyecto es el primero de este tipo en nuestra ciudad y en el país y estamos apuntando a continuar haciendo proyectos innovadores de este tipo.

    Ayúdennos a comenzar y únansenos a en el esfuerzo de hacer crecer esto e impactar vidas más allá de nuestras expectativas.

    Retos y Soluciones

    Los principales retos para este proyecto son:

    • Operación y mantenimiento de impresoras 3D.
    • Diseño de cada prótesis basado en las condiciones de cada cliente.
    • La distribución de las prótesis de manos impresas en 3D.

    Contando con la experiencia técnica de los miembros de nuestro equipo, estamos seguros de poder dar las soluciones necesarias a estos obstáculos. 

    PUEDES AYUDAR DE OTRAS FORMAS

    Como hemos señalado anteriormente, también estamos buscando personas que quieran hacer algo más que donar fondos. Cualquier persona que quiera compartirnos un diseño que pueda ser hecho con impresión 3D. También aquellas personas que quieran ser parte de nuestro equipo de trabajo. Toda ayuda es bien recibida para cumplir con nuestro objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de los discapacitados en nuestra comunidad.

    Donar fondos | Contribuir con Diseños | Compartir ideas | Dar a conocer la campaña

    • "Me gusta" nuestra página en Facebook en facebook.com/varnieto
    • Utilizar el hashtag #VarnietoTachira en sus mensajes en las redes sociales
    • Ayudanos a difundir nuestra campaña en Indiegogo!
    • Pueden encontrarnos a través de:
    • https://www.facebook.com/Varnieto/
    • https://www.facebook.com/carlosvarg4s 
    • https://www.facebook.com/karla.nieto.9

    ¡Muchas gracias!
story_txt:
The Principals:

          

I am Carlos Vargas, a Mechanical Engineer and she is Karla Nieto, a Senior Electromedicine Student. We are are the principals of Varnieto Equipos Medicos. For several years we have been
working as volunteers in Venezuela as well in other countries of South America
on children health issues, literacy, poverty and
other critical issues through various engagements.




We both from Universidad Nacional Experimental del Tachira and as a result of this, we are trying to give back to our community by exploring the endless possibilities of 3D Technology.
The Project
At this time, we want to make a positive impact by delivering 3D printed prosthetics hands for children amputees. based on e-NABLE project and other open source design hubs, we want to deliver 3D printed limbs for those in need of it in San Cristobal, Tachira and Venezuela.

 
In view of this, we are hoping to get we are hoping to raise funds to purchase the equipments, which would be used purposely for printing prosthetic limbs for amputees. This would make the project faster and more effective.
Peradventure we are not able to reach our goal of raising $2,500, we are going to keep raising funds till we do and we would keep the community of donors and well wishers in the loop about the whole process.
And because of your generous contributions, we would make sure to keep you all informed about our progress. we are not just looking for donors, we are looking for life partners who share in our philosophy that life is meant to be lived through sharing . . .


Our Contribution To Tachira and Venezuela. . .
We live in a city called San Cristóbal in Tachira and as we whole our lives and growing up to the city, our aim is to contribute to its growth by introducing a whole world of possibilities to the amputees.






We are hoping to give standard and quality lifestyle to these sets of people at a relatively low cost than the below average citizen of San Cristobal, Tachira can afford and this can be achievable according to our plans with the use of 3D printers. This project would be the first step of 3D revolution in San Cristobal, Tachira as we are aiming at 3D bio-printing of organs and sophisticated biological designs for borderline operations.
Help us to commence this small start-up venture and join us in the effort to take this endeavour to a point where it impacts lives beyond our widest imagination.
  Challenges and Solutions
The main challenges for this project:


Operation and maintenance of 3D printers
Design of each prosthesis based on each clients condition i.e. custom fitted

Proper distribution of the printed prosthetic limbs

Counting on the technical expertise of the team members involved, we are confident to assure you of proffering necessary solutions to these obstacles.     Other Ways You Can Help
As we have pointed out earlier, we are looking for people that wants to do more than donate funds . . . anyone who wants to by sharing a design ; those who would love to share this information with others who would be interested; and those who want to be a part in ways that have not occurred to us yet. All help is needed so far it is towards achieving our goal of restoring proximity of the standard and quality of life to amputees in our community.Donate Funds | Contribute Designs | Share Ideas | Publicize Campaign


'Like' our Page on Facebook at facebook.com/varnieto

Use hashtag #VarnietoTachira in your posts on social media, 
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
You can find us at: 
https://www.facebook.com/Varnieto/

https://www.facebook.com/carlosvarg4s

https://www.facebook.com/karla.nieto.9

Thank You so much :-)Versión en Español

story:
Unyq is designed as a safe communication platform that's free to use for anyone between the ages of 13 and 18, specifically for LGBTQIA+ young people and their friends and allies. It's been created to facilitate communication in a standard way, through modern protocols and being mobile-compatible and notification and message driven. It's simply what teenagers are used to in this day and age. It can be accessed at https://unyq.me/.

I'd like to introduce you to Mark (nb: name changed). Mark is a 14 year old bisexual teen, living in London. He struggles with depression over months and months due to having to pretend to be someone he isn't. He fights through every day's barrage of "that's so gay" and various other gratuitous insults, which don't exactly help his case. And then he finds Unyq.

Unyq connects Mark to a whole range of people like him around the globe. Mark doesn't feel alone anymore, he knows that he's got friends everywhere who can support him. On days he's feeling down, Mark reaches out to the Unyq community for support in his life. And, for once, Unyq is a space for Mark to be himself and not be afraid of what others might think.

We want your contributions to the Unyq campaign so that together we can help more people like Mark, all over the world.

At the moment, I'm paying out of my own pocket for Unyq to be run. Unyq has no advertising, and never will do. The money that I raise will go towards hosting Unyq, paying to keep it protected as a walled garden, and improving the site functionality. Any funds that can't be used by us for whatever reason will be donated to Stonewall (https://stonewall.org.uk/).

This means a lot to me because I know a lot of LGBT teenagers suffer because they don't feel comfortable coming out to their friends and family. Unyq means that, no matter what the distance, instant communication can be facilitated between groups of young, vulnerable people. It acts as a worldwide support group to help those people help each other, as well as a friendship network for people affected.


If you can't donate, please share the campaign on whatever networks you have. And if you're between 13 and 18 and you're LGBT+, feel free to sign up to the site.

story:
Stump City Brewing LLC

From the Ground UP!
Gloversville, NY

Short Summary

  • We are Stump City Brewery and we are looking forward to bringing great beer to Fulton County. Our brewers are Nicholas Sherman (Veteran), Matthew Sherman (School Counselor), Jerry Sherman (The Father and Elder) and Casey Oare (Firefighter). We have a passion for beer and local products which is why we are specifically becoming a Farm Brewery that requires us to use a certain amount of New York grain and hops.

  • Our name comes from the history of leather making in this area. Many trees were cut down before it was known as Gloversville, which led to it being known as Stump City. We also take pride in the leather making history of the area - where earlier in the 20th century 90% of the gloves sold in the U.S. came from Gloversville.

  • We are looking to raise this money because, as many of you know, in starting a small business we have a tight budget. We want to bring as many varieties of beer as we can to you and to do that we need  a little hard work and some more gear. New fermentors and other equipment will allow us to increase our capacity and to make specialty beers that take longer than typical beers to age.

  • We intend to succeed, but we want to flourish and upgrade to better serve you. This is where you come in. Small boosts in funding that increase our capacity or help make brewing more efficient are huge for us.

What We Need & What You Get


  • The funding that we are trying to raise is going directly to equipment that will increase our capacity (fermentors) and efficiency (bigger pumps, better burners). As you may already know, we are a small operation to start with, so every little bit counts.

  • Our swag (perks) will allow you to show off your local pride in us and in small businesses. We know this is important to both you and to us so we will be purchasing everything as local as possible.

  • If we don’t reach our goal we will still be putting the money towards as many improvements as the amount will allow us. It will not go to waste!

The Impact

  • We really want to boost the local economy and improve our community. Our philosophy is The Better the Community, the Better We All Are.

  • We truly want you to have pride in your local brewery and town so we will proudly display our heritage and hometown on our products.

Other Ways You Can Help


  • Any help we can get spreading the word about the brewery and this fundraising campaign would be hugely appreciated. Our primary outreach tools are Facebook and word of mouth, which makes you extremely important to our success.

Perks

Limited Edition Founders T-Shirt and Hoodie (This design is only available through this campaign)


Stump City Etched Bottle Openers 

Stump City Etched Pint Glasses


Other images of perks coming soon or by request.

Thank you for becoming part of our awesome adventure.

Matt, Nick, Casey, and Jerry 

Stump City Brewing

Gloversville, NY

story:
Update on July 29, 2016: Due to manufacturing and development processes, we are now anticipating a release in December, 2016. 


Short Summary

Consider for a moment what life would look like if each person you know understood who they are at the core and were able to clearly articulate their values. How might this understanding guide their decisions about how they use their time, talents and resources? What might change about how they relate to the people around them?

Like many tools, Experience Rivets™ was created to address a need. As an Attorney and the Founder and Creator of Rivets™, David York regularly engaged in dialogue about Core Values with clients to determine how they might plan their finances and their estate planning. Finding no compelling values tool on the market, David intuitively designed Rivets™. We completed a pre-launch of the first iteration of the tool in December 2015 before launching into the broader marketplace in late January 2016. We then released a deconstructed offering, utilizing our Rivets™ Core Values Cards, in March 2016.

Rivets™ has been warmly received in a variety of settings during this season and these interactions gave us greater insight into the strengths and growth opportunities for the tool. We found that people desired to engage even more deeply with those in their lives about their Core Values (which we think is terrific!). The nature of our campaign is to improve the tool to better platform interpersonal connection through the experience, test it within our target niches and produce Rivets™ 2.0. We're very excited about what is ahead and how the experience will shape the lives of families, friend groups, organizations and beyond!


What We Need & What You Get

WHAT WE NEED...

We are raising $20,000 to fund the development of Rivets™ 2.0 and launch by the end of the summer. This includes: 

  • Develop Rivets™ Plank Cards: Conversation starters to foster deeper connection
  • Curate Rivets™ Assessment Package, an accompaniment to 2.0 for a more in-depth experience
  • Update Product Packaging
  • Develop and Implement Marketing Strategy to launch 2.0 effectively into the market
  • Conduct Test Marketing with Target Groups to test 2.0 and the packaging options prior to final production and distribution process, allowing us to make adjustments as required
  • Produce and Distribute Rivets™ 2.0

WHAT YOU GET: PERKS! 

One of the joys of an Indiegogo Campaign is offering incentives for you to join us at a variety of financial levels. See our Perks breakdown for all of the details. 

WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH OUR ENTIRE GOAL?

While we hope to be fully funded at the end of this 60-day period, if we are not we will move ahead stage by stage beginning with the development of our Rivets™ Plank Cards. It is our intention to see this project through to completion. Full funding will enable us to speed the process so that people who are ready to know who they are at the core will have access to Rivets™ 2.0 by the end of the summer!


The Impact

As a company, we are motivated by a picture we see of a world filled with individuals who have identified and are living out their Core Values while championing others to do the same. Your investment ensures that you, and those you care about, will have engaging tools in a variety of settings like family, education, business, community and beyond that are created to help guide decisions about how to spend your time, talent and resources throughout your lifetime. When we consider this reality, we believe the ongoing impact of Rivets™ will be profound.

In the short six months since our initial launch, we've seen at least 1,500 people personally utilize and/or share our existing products. While it's a small beginning, the engagement and feedback we have received give us confidence that great things are coming. We are hopeful that the changes we're making will create space for more dialogue, interpersonal connection and purposeful living. With your help, we believe the number of people we engage through Experience Rivets™ can grow exponentially. 


Risks & Challenges

The main challenge we face is completing Rivets™ 2.0 to ensure we go to production by the end of the summer. Since we have cultivated relationships over the past several months and sold nearly 70% of our existing inventory, launching Rivets™ 2.0 into the market soon is key for us to maintain the momentum we've established and grow from there. This is a pivotal season for our company and we find this both thrilling and challenging.

We have already begun curating content for Rivets™ 2.0, gathering data on our target niches and are in the early strategic planning stages for our marketing endeavors in order to progress quickly as we acquire the funding required for each new step. Our campaign comes at a perfect time to address the opportunities and challenges we face. We cannot wait to move ahead and we invite your participation! 


Other Ways You Can Help

While we know that not everyone can contribute financially, there are other ways for you to help us:

  • We'd be honored if you'd share about Rivets™ and our campaign with the people you know. Indiegogo has share tools that make this easy! Please utilize them.
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram (and invite your friends to like and follow us, too!). We'd love to stay connected with you and have your support on our social platforms.
  • Sign up for our Rivets™ Newsletter! Our newsletter is designed to update you on the progress of our campaign for a season. Beyond that, we'll share exclusive promotions on existing and new products and recount stories about how people are connecting in meaningful ways and living purposeful lives through values. We can't wait to continue the dialogue!

story:
What is Toum?

"Toum" literally means garlic in Arabic. It is also referred to as a popular garlic condiment used in the Middle-East for delicious foods such a shish-kabobs and shawerma sandwiches. It is naturally vegan and gluten free.

Toum was introduced to me by my father, a Jordanian immigrant, who has perfected the challenging technique in making this.Through him I have gained much of my culinary passion and have decided to begin my food line "OneRootFoods" by using his recipe as my flagship product, to honor the father who has sacrificed so much to see me realize my dream.

OneRootFoods will eventually include various self-made and family recipes, and a portion of each future sale will go to food justice charities in the Pacific Northwest. 

Along with the original, I have also created 2 variations. For anyone who loves a little spice and heat, Toum+Harissa is a perfect blend of garlic and homemade Harissa (a North African chili paste). Or maybe something more refreshing, Toum+Herb is made with a refreshing blend of fresh basil, tarragon and mint.

As you might guess, starting a business is neither easy or cheap but your contribution will help cover the start-up costs, everything from license fees to production to shipping and gives an alternative to bank loans where the interest rates would become a debilitating obstacle.

OneRootFoods will introduce the amazing product Toum to various household kitchens in the Pacific NorthWest and beyond! People will discover the many delicious ways it can be applied to their favorite foods!

What is in Toum and what can it be used for?

  • The classic Toum only consists of 4 ingredients: fresh organic garlic, oil, lemon juice and salt
  • Toum is completely vegan, gluten free, all natural and free of major food allergens
  • Along with common Middle Eastern dishes, it's a great addition to sandwiches, burgers, dipping sauces, grilled fish, fried chicken, tacos, pasta, BBQ's....
  • Almost anything you are willing to try it with! Be deliciously creative!
  • Consider it a substitute or enhancer for mayo to start
  • Sample recipe: Soy Sauce and Chili Marinated Tofu Tacos; cabbage, lettuce, mint leaves and of course Toum!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here is where you contribution goes:

  • $15,000 is a modest cost to starting a local business. In the budget I have included as many imminent costs as I  could I think of, the last thing I want is to underestimate the feat of this dream and give up half way through due to lack of funding.
  • Shipping, cost of damaged/lost items, ingredients, packaging, kitchen rental, license fees, certification fees, insurance, market introduction, equipment, office supplies and donations are included.
  • For certain contributions, awesome perks will be given! For example:
    • "It's got your name on it, literally!" A lucky few will have their very own jars of Toum with their name front and center along with a thank you on the label.
    • "Trip to Portland!" One contributor plus a friend will get a trip to my hometown, with me as their guide!
  • The jars will be glass, carefully wash it out and you have a personalized and reusable souvenir!

The Impact

Here is what your contribution means:

  • I have been fortunate in life to realize many of my dreams, one of them being able to go to a top culinary school and get myself on the path of one day owning my own business.
  • Now is my time, and you are the wonderful people that can help me get there.
  • This is not just a project for me, this is my life, my dream, what I have been training many years to do: make delicious food and getting people connected.
  • Growing up in Portland, I have seen many unfortunate and hungry people on the streets and I have been a lifelong volunteer. 
  • That is why I am committed to help by donating a portion of future sales to alleviate that hunger and build a sustainable food system in our communities.

Risk Takers

  • I do not give up. There very well may be unforeseen challenges ahead but I am blessed with an amazing supportive family who will constantly and happily berate me to find my way if I am to hit a roadblock.
  • I come from a family of self made, successful business people and entrepreneurs who hold a wealth of experience and advice and is where I develop much of my business knowledge and drive.
  • In a business that is still dominated by men and non-minorities, their are innate challenges for a female-minority businesswoman. However I have found plenty of small business resources that are available to such individuals and I intend to use them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are able to donate $$$ or not even $1:

  • Please pass my campaign around! If this is something you want to see happen.
  • There are easy ways to share through Indiegogo.
  • Look into food justice projects in your community, see how it impacts it and see what you can do to help!
story_txt:
What is Toum?
"Toum" literally means garlic in Arabic. It is also referred to as a popular garlic condiment used in the Middle-East for delicious foods such a shish-kabobs and shawerma sandwiches. It is naturally vegan and gluten free.
Toum was introduced to me by my father, a Jordanian immigrant, who has perfected the challenging technique in making this.Through him I have gained much of my culinary passion and have decided to begin my food line "OneRootFoods" by using his recipe as my flagship product, to honor the father who has sacrificed so much to see me realize my dream.
OneRootFoods will eventually include various self-made and family recipes, and a portion of each future sale will go to food justice charities in the Pacific Northwest. 
Along with the original, I have also created 2 variations. For anyone who loves a little spice and heat, Toum+Harissa is a perfect blend of garlic and homemade Harissa (a North African chili paste). Or maybe something more refreshing, Toum+Herb is made with a refreshing blend of fresh basil, tarragon and mint.
As you might guess, starting a business is neither easy or cheap but your contribution will help cover the start-up costs, everything from license fees to production to shipping and gives an alternative to bank loans where the interest rates would become a debilitating obstacle.
OneRootFoods will introduce the amazing product Toum to various household kitchens in the Pacific NorthWest and beyond! People will discover the many delicious ways it can be applied to their favorite foods!
What is in Toum and what can it be used for?

The classic Toum only consists of 4 ingredients: fresh organic garlic, oil, lemon juice and salt

Toum is completely vegan, gluten free, all natural and free of major food allergens
Along with common Middle Eastern dishes, it's a great addition to sandwiches, burgers, dipping sauces, grilled fish, fried chicken, tacos, pasta, BBQ's....
Almost anything you are willing to try it with! Be deliciously creative!
Consider it a substitute or enhancer for mayo to start
Sample recipe: Soy Sauce and Chili Marinated Tofu Tacos; cabbage, lettuce, mint leaves and of course Toum!


 

What We Need & What You Get
Here is where you contribution goes:

$15,000 is a modest cost to starting a local business. In the budget I have included as many imminent costs as I  could I think of, the last thing I want is to underestimate the feat of this dream and give up half way through due to lack of funding.
Shipping, cost of damaged/lost items, ingredients, packaging, kitchen rental, license fees, certification fees, insurance, market introduction, equipment, office supplies and donations are included.
For certain contributions, awesome perks will be given! For example:
"It's got your name on it, literally!" A lucky few will have their very own jars of Toum with their name front and center along with a thank you on the label.
"Trip to Portland!" One contributor plus a friend will get a trip to my hometown, with me as their guide!


The jars will be glass, carefully wash it out and you have a personalized and reusable souvenir!

The Impact

Here is what your contribution means:

I have been fortunate in life to realize many of my dreams, one of them being able to go to a top culinary school and get myself on the path of one day owning my own business.
Now is my time, and you are the wonderful people that can help me get there.
This is not just a project for me, this is my life, my dream, what I have been training many years to do: make delicious food and getting people connected.
Growing up in Portland, I have seen many unfortunate and hungry people on the streets and I have been a lifelong volunteer. 
That is why I am committed to help by donating a portion of future sales to alleviate that hunger and build a sustainable food system in our communities.


Risk Takers

I do not give up. There very well may be unforeseen challenges ahead but I am blessed with an amazing supportive family who will constantly and happily berate me to find my way if I am to hit a roadblock.
I come from a family of self made, successful business people and entrepreneurs who hold a wealth of experience and advice and is where I develop much of my business knowledge and drive.
In a business that is still dominated by men and non-minorities, their are innate challenges for a female-minority businesswoman. However I have found plenty of small business resources that are available to such individuals and I intend to use them. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you are able to donate $$$ or not even $1:

Please pass my campaign around! If this is something you want to see happen.
There are easy ways to share through Indiegogo.
Look into food justice projects in your community, see how it impacts it and see what you can do to help!

story:
Help and Organic Coffee farm to be Sustainable, so we can educate more with Human Farm project.

We are Albir Family and we own a small Coffee farm called LAS MANOS in a beautiful area in Honduras frontier with Nicaragua. We have the farm since 1940 with the loving care of Pacheco family.

Our coffee used to be a lovely farm with quality coffee in which you could enjoy every morning freshly grounded cup of coffee from Julias kitchen.
But sadly the Market price, Roya and leaf rust made us sell the coffee even to a lower price from the market so we could pay high debts.

2015: Albir sisters decided to recover the farm and get the title of specialty coffee once again like the old times, and with all the odds we score 79% and to be Specialty Coffee we need 80%. but regardless of been small we also define our CSR which is the "Human Farm" this involves to invite the whole community to participate in organic agriculture and finally decrease femicides or lack of food in the village.

Another farmer has help us to dry our coffee, but we need to improve ours farm water system and solar tables so far we are organic and we have got a water source from the mountain which all of this is used for Human farm education.

With your help, we can achieve the water system, the machine, fix the water tank and more than $3 per day wage for Oscar Pacheco.

Our quality in our coffee is almost there please help us to reach our goal, we will keep you updated.

For more information, you can go to Facebook: Aldea Las Manos/ Las Manos Cafe and Human Farm

story:
Hi Friends, Tiki Folks and even some Random Strangers!

For those who don't know me: My name is Lukas "luci" Masek aka luciash d' being and I live in a little village near beautiful walled town Policka, in Czech Republic.
In 14 days (since launching this campaign) I am going to attend the TikiFest HU 2016 in Budapest, Hungary to do some code sprints, bugfixing, brainstorm ideas, marketing, translations and discuss further development of the Tiki CMS with some of the fellow Tiki developers there. However as I got short on funds in last two months (what a surprise!) I would like to kindly ask you for your support to help me cover the costs and expenses so I can "operate" normally there and afterwards. Here are some important points about me and why it would be nice to help me fund my campaign:

  • I am voluntarily contributing to the development of the Tiki CMS (Tiki Wiki CMS Groupware) project (and helping visitors on our #tikiwiki IRC channel) for free for many years since 2003 as I found the software very useful, powerful and versatile and the community around it very open and friendly.

    During the years I've become one of the admins of the project and one of the most active developers (though there are others, better, skilled and more active ones in the recent years) of this Open Source software. For living I do web design, sometimes even some graphics stuff, web development and Tiki integrations for clients from various parts of The World.
  • What is a TikiFest? A TikiFest is a traditional event in the Tiki Community of users and developers when usually more than 2 people meet in real life and work together on some Tiki enhancements and related stuff, brainstorm and socialize (food and beer, yay!). Last summer I even organized a succesful TikiFest at my place in Czech Republic and I promised to Gezza, the organizer of the current TikiFest in Hungary, that I will attend his TikiFest in return ;) Check out the gallery here to get some idea what a typical TikiFest is mostly about!
  • The campaign is a good opportunity to show some appreciation for my free work on Tiki (which in turn allows other people to download and use it for free) but mainly it will really help me with funding my expenses for this TikiFest. The type of the campaign is flexible, so even if we do not meet the goal I can go anyway and still use the money to cover some of the costs at least partly.
  • Your contribution of any kind will allow me to attend the TikiFest in Budapest, meet the other developers and focus on the work we are going to do there without stressing about the money. In return I offer some (hopefully) nice perks (rewards) when you contribute $25 and more as a Big Thank You.

Risks & Challenges

There is only a risk of something really bad happening to me physically or mentally that I would be physically or mentally unable to fullfill the promised perks. In that case a full refund of your contribution should come back to you asap.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. Lets see if that works!

story:
Do you have ANY idea how much food is wasted by spoilage annually?

The numbers are truly staggering.

Help stop this food abuse in your own home by getting your Leftover Lenny here on INDIGOGO.

Lenny's memory will record up to 20 seconds, so plenty of space to remind you of one, or multiple items.

FACT: Since i have been using my own Lenny, i have not thrown away ANY of my leftovers.

oops, i know the video says "Lennys will be here before this campaign ends".   I made the video a few weeks ago, the Lennys are HERE NOW.

Christmas is coming soon.   I have PLENTY of Lennys  to send, so contribute enough for yourself, and for Christmas gifts for others.    Lenny makes a GREAT gift for ANYONE who eats, and has a refrigerator (i think that covers just about everyone).

PLEASE READ THIS. While i am having fun with my Leftover Lenny, and creating this campaign, I'd like to get serious for a moment.        

Thanksgiving is coming up soon, and while most of us will be dealing with plenty of leftovers from our feast, there are those who will not have a feast at all for this day.  Because of this, I am donating 10% of ALL funding received to provide a basic Thanksgiving meal to as many needy families as possible.   If my goal of just $2000 is reached (or surpassed), i will up that donation to 20% of ALL funds collected directly to this cause.

If the recipients don't mind being photographed, i will post photos in an update. Otherwise, i will ask them to post an anonymous comment on my campaign page for you to see the good you helped make happen. 

Thank you for your support!

story:
Master Plan 

We want this place to be rejuvenated small farm with accommodation for people to come and enjoy, we will also be giving employment to the local area during construction,farming and tourist roles as we progress...things  we need to happen

•    Clean and rejuvenate the jungle areas which have been cleared
•    Clean up beach dumping,restore and support cliff and mangrove beach line
•    Establish Coconut/cocoa/Pili/coffee/Mahogany planting management plan including seedling distribution
•    Establishment of vegetable garden to provide for accommodation and locals for
•    Construct temporary dwelling as base of operation
•    Construct temporary access road into site
•    Construct Aerobic waste water system and filtration
•    Construct renewable energy station for power
•    Construct permanent fence
•    Construct holiday accommodation for travelers to the area
 

Current Status


August:

Construction of temp road has been completed! Comprising of a construction crew of 10 local men to hand cut the temporary road in by hand due the the initial steep entrance,taking under to weeks to construct the team enjoyed a BBQ to celebrate the completion of that phase.

before:

After:
September: 
•    Temporary building constructed ..hooray... made completely from local materials  (well except the cement - that came from the Mayon) this type of hut is commonly referred as a Nipa style hut
•    Measuring 6 mtrs x 6 mtrs will be comfortable for the meantime during further construct out house and shower are a separate structure utilizing rain water for showering and advanced composing for solid waste.

Hut construction:
Accommodation:
•    planned designed are being drawn up as we speak for sign off by the municipal government....awaiting that permit....sneak peak of design and possibilities?


Planting:
•    Arriving this month has been 150 coconut seedling standing on average 3 feet these will be used to back plant where all of the coconut was logged as well as future planting across the top of the land.The coconut will allow the future inter-planting of the cocoa


•    Also this month 30 of the new sprouted mahogany seedling will be planted with another 100+ due to sprout soon.
•    the seedling bank will grow into further natives species as we develop.We have also had other seedlings such as pomello and avocado sprout

November and December:
•    More and more planting
•    Coffee seedlings will go in soon
•    vegetable garden will be cleaned and readied for planting
•    natural water to the site will be restored to the site
•    Location of the large scale waste treatment will be finalized(our philosophy is: the only thing that leave the site is food)
•    The funds will be used to allow construction of 2 accommodation villas.The accommodation villas in the future will help provide income to the land and will help support local employment and training.
•    The current plan is to construct 6 villas in total 2 per year with the first being available from june/july 2017.


•    This accommodation will be unique in design complete solar and waste water recovery to be used on farm irrigation but allows for all modern comforts and will sleep upto 4 people.

 

Some of our challenges 

Skilled labour - we want local input in construction beyond just labourers, our design allows for welding(a lot of welding and we would like as a part of our process to afford to send at least one local person to complete his welding craft certification under the eye of our head contractor(that will be will be a requirement of the construction contract.this could lead to at least some qualified trade welders.

Material - Being at the southern end of Luzon material for construction does come at a premium some of the design can be pre-fabricated closer to manila and shipped to us,risks could include if design is'nt adheared too - signed of design will be the key and cost of construction should reduce with this method.

Time - Everything takes time in the phillipines and sometime in triple copy,We really need support in our venture and we believe we have a realistic time frame based on the pre work and design already completed. But everyone watching our project will see our passion in providing not just accomodation but rehabilition and safe farming practises, to give everyone that visits an opportunity to learn or participate.

One - Money, it helps in so many ways, we want people to enjoy donating as much as what we can offer...its a bueatiful place that should be shared but in a responsible way that our aim...every dollar is tracked and reported every piece of help and support is appriecated.
