nowadays. 
* Exchange rate: 1 Euro= 3600 UGX, 1 USD= 3300 UGX,
calculated throughout the different project phases HIA
team is ready to perform the best possible services if given the chance. To
make this proposal reality there is a need for financial help of various partners. Therefore we humbly request
you to join our common effort to “raise hope again”.

story:
Our Purpose

Roots Up is a hyperlocal food system solution. We believe there are better ways to grow, harvest, and deliver food. And we believe everyone deserves fresh, healthy food.

Food brings people together; it’s a powerful common denominator across cultures, ages, and places. We find it ironic, then, that while food connects all of us, we are disconnected from our food. By the time most produce reaches our plates, it’s traveled hundreds of miles, lost half its nutritional value, and wasted valuable natural resources. While we import billions of dollars of produce each year, vacant land and buildings across our cities lay fallow. Roots Up sees these spaces as opportunities for growth - food growth, economic growth, and community growth. We envision a network of hyperlocal food systems that bring us all closer to our food and each other; food systems that use less, produce more, and create community. YOU can help us make that happen.


Our System

We use engineering and technology to responsibly grow high yield pesticide-free produce in any space.

Our patented TrueVertical system consistently grows leafy greens and herbs year-round. We use heirloom seeds and sustainable practices to grow produce that is delivered within hours of harvest with maximum nutritional value.

The Roots Up System consists of compact, moveable vertical shelves with integrated lights, water, and nutrients. Perfect growing conditions are maintained by proprietary software and a mobile app that allows for remote monitoring and management.


We are working with Philips Horticulture LED Solutions to create the best growing conditions for our produce. Integrating this technology into our system will help us grow, sell, and donate the freshest, healthiest produce possible.


Our Impact

Roots Up is a social enterprise founded on a triple bottom line: people, planet, and product. We are committed to creating sustainable food systems that grow more than just food.

PEOPLE

Roots Up Systems will be installed in low-income urban communities, creating new jobs and economic growth. Our employees, local residents, will be paid a living wage. In partnership with local agencies and nonprofits, we will create a workforce development program to provide employees with resources and training to support their personal and professional growth.

To become a truly integrated part of our communities, Roots Up will meet regularly with local neighborhood associations. We will be a helpful partner in addressing local food needs - donating food and creating educational programming and community-building opportunities where they’re wanted.

PLANET

Compared to traditional farming and watering methods, our compact hydroponic system saves precious water, eliminates erratic weather impacts, and protects against pests, weeds, and disease.

Phase 2 of our system will incorporate solar panels and rain collection systems to continue our aspirations of fully-enclosed, self-sufficient systems. Our team of engineers and experts will continuously improve our systems and create solutions for better food systems. Most importantly, we will always strive to be a successful social enterprise that reinvests our profits to positively impact the wellbeing of our communities and the global food system.

PRODUCT

Roots Up produce will be grown without pesticides and delivered the day it's harvested, ensuring maximum nutritional value and taste. Our system will grow year-round, which means we can sell consistent yields at fixed prices.


Our Goals

Our campaign has three fundraising goals, each of which will help us build and test our first complete system AND provide food to hungry families. The more money we raise, the more food we can grow and donate!


GOAL 1: ROOTS UP PILOT ($20,000)

We need $20,000 to bring a full pilot to life. The pilot, located in Franklinton, will prove our methods by creating a test site for new ideas and supply fresh produce to local families. 100% of all produce will be donated to community members.

$20,000 will fund the following:

  • Four 8' x 8' growing walls, complete with moveable shelves, growing pods, and seeds.

  • Lights + water + nutrients and the systems to distribute them

  • Control hardware and software integration with the mobile app

  • System testing, data collection, and improvements

  • Over one-half ton of fresh, healthy food for local families (20 pounds of spinach and lettuce each week for a year)


GOAL 2: ROOTS UP POD ($50,000)

If we reach our second goal, we will build out a 40-foot shipping container to show how our system maximizes growth in any space.  In a Roots Up Pod (8’ x 40’), we can grow 1/2 to 1 acre of greens, depending on the crop. With all produce grown and shared locally, we can feed 4 times more families than the pilot.


GOAL 3: ROOTS UP MICROFARM ($250,000)

For the greatest impact on our local food system and community, we would use $250,000 to create a MicroFarm of shipping containers on a vacant city lot. This construction would decrease total operation costs and increase production: six 40-foot Pods on a MicroFarm will produce over 100,000 pounds of food and create two full-time, living wage jobs.


Our Team

Roots Up is a team effort. We have experience and skills from a wide range of backgrounds: startup business, sales & marketing, nonprofit, civil & industrial engineering, software development, and the agriculture and food industries. We come with different perspectives, but the same values:

  • Put people first.

  • Do more than expected.

  • Collaborate.

  • Pursue growth.

  • Consider the impact.
Together, we're committed to creating solutions for food systems that are better for our health, our communities, and our world.

A huge thank you to everyone who has supported, advised, partnered with, and inspired us on this journey. We are confident that our design, creative use of technology, and local partnerships will add to a more sustainable future for communities across the country and around the world.  We have a lot of work ahead of us, but we are already doing good and are excited for what’s to come!


Our Partners

Special thanks to the individuals and companies already supporting Roots Up:

story:
We are raising funds to begin several pilot projects in southern Africa with local partners. Our idea is to link agricultural input companies, financial service providers and our own business planning tool to small scale farmers using their simple mobile phones.  We aim to help farmers transition from subsistence to profitable farmers and eventually entrepreneurs with vision to grown into their own agribusiness managers.

 

More at www.mksns.com

story:
Our Project

Beginning in April 2016, we are building an innovative community building that promotes the development of human capital through arts and architecture. The community building will become a vital addition to the recently established Kasirwa arts village on the Eastern slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro.

Contact us: ShiftDesign.Tanzania@gmail.com

Exterior Render of our Initial Competition Entry

For the price of a cup of coffee, you can help to improve the livelihoods of the people in Kasirwa by contributing to our campaign. Your donation will increase the quality of life to the local people and to those who build with earth all around the world!

Interior perspective of our initial competition entry


The building aims to serve the local community by becoming a repository of international arts and crafts for locals and visitors to learn, work, live and create. 

Through a workshop format that facilitates collaboration and exchange of knowledge between ourselves, local artisans, craftspeople and international volunteers, everyone involved will be an integral part of the design from start to finish.

All of the funds raised by this campaign will go directly towards the completion of our design and to the continued development of the Kasirwa Arts Village. We need people like you to give as little or as much as you feel comfortable, to ensure the success of our project!

Meet the Team

We are Shift Design, a small collective of architectural graduates from Wellington, New Zealand, who are committed to developing human capital through arts and architecture. We truly believe in the potential of architecture to provide equitable, happier, healthier and more sustainable livelihoods. 

From top left clockwise: Lydia Hamer, Stephen Yiavasis, Sebastian Maher and Tyler Harlen

In 2014, we teamed up with African non-profit organisation, Nka Foundation to design and build a sustainable earth house that addresses the current and growing needs of African nations. Nka Foundation has already overseen multiple successful projects like ours in both Ghana and Tanzania. 

We are now a year and a half into the project and are now ready to implement our research and build our design - but we need your help to do it! 


The Challenge

Tanzania, like other East African nations, is facing a steady increase of imported and highly processed building materials which are costly, ecologically harmful and unsuited to Tanzania’s climate. Unfortunately these materials are quickly replacing traditional, earth-based construction methods. This puts pressure on the local culture and threatens to erase the established vernacular. 

This is why we are focusing our efforts to reinstate earth architecture and to shift the perception back to earth as a reliable, sustainable and attractive building material. 



Infographic showing the importation paths of cement to Africa

Earth construction has a role to play in leading wider, international advancement - especially in seismically active areas. In populated earthquake prone regions such as the Middle East and parts of South America, vast portions of the population live in low-cost earth housing. For these people, stronger, smarter and safer earth construction techniques are of vital importance. We are compelled to spread the knowledge of seismically safe design as we too come from one of the most earthquake prone countries in the world.



Infographic comparing regions with earth buildings and sesimic zones


Our Solution

Our solution involves the production of a building that is a well-functioning community building for the people of Kasirwa. It will act as a prototype which combines traditional materials and techniques with modern aesthetics and technologies. 

We will be architecturally reinvigorating earth construction and contributing to the body of knowledge surrounding intelligent construction - through the earth building workshop. 

The knowledge and wisdom that is shared between ourselves, local craftspeople and international volunteers will contribute to the advancement of the village long after the project is completed. 


How Will It Happen?

The construction of the community building in Kasirwa arts village will take place within the format of a 12-16 week workshop. The workshop will include local community members, students and practitioners from the region, and international volunteers. 

The first weeks on site will entail careful research of local building methods and consultation with the community. 

The construction that takes place in the remaining weeks will prioritise the use of cheap and local materials - chiefly earth.

Local and international involvement will ensure that the knowledge developed remains in Kasirwa village as well as spreading globally. 

Local Crafspeople and International Volunteers will be an integral part of the design from start to finish - photo M.A.M.O.T.H

Use of local materials will guarantee that the local community maintains access to building materials, and also betters international participants' understanding of intelligent and sustainable use of resources. 

The project will culminate in a modest but exemplary building for the people of Kasirwa as well as a rich source of open-source data and research on accessible and sustainable housing to be shared internationally.


We Have Been Featured In


   


What We Need to Complete Our Project

Shift Design is made up of students and practicing professionals that believe in sustainable development. We are at the start of our professional careers, equipped with high-quality education and experience BUT we need to appeal for financial assistance from YOU. 

The funds raised by this campaign will go directly towards the completion of the non-profit Kasirwa arts village community building. 

General Costs

The brief, set by Nka Foundation, was for an affordable, sustainable earth building. Because this involves the extraction of local materials at little or no cost we are able to produce a building that can be produced for roughly $6000 USD. This means that communities using our techniques and design will be able to achieve similar practical and beautiful results.

Payment of local craftspeople will offer employment in an environment that encourages the development of creative construction techniques and leadership skills. 

To improve earth's reputation as a modern building material, contemporary water and electrical systems are a necessary feature of the design. 

As a research project, the workshop will require adequate equipment, tools and supplies for the testing, recording and analysing of construction materials and technology. This comes under the category "Documentation". 

Shift Design Team Costs 

It is integral to the project that we physically participate and take part in the workshop. However, as students, our financial circumstances mean that we require your assistance in achieving this.

Extra funds will go towards project participation costs, which is why we have aimed so high - to help everyone get involved, particularly people from around the African continent. 


Simplified Budget:

General Costs

  • Construction                            $6000 USD
  • Labour                                        $4000 USD
  • Contemporary Systems        $2000 USD
  • Documentation                        $3000 USD

 Shift Design Team Costs (4 People) 

  • Flights and Travel Related Costs        $3000 USD  (per person) 
  • Food, Accommodation, Expenses        $2000 USD (per person) 

Our Unique Perks

$1000 USD : "Part of the Team"

Receive one of the team's personal travel journals which will be used to record and document their accounts for the duration of the build. 

$6000 USD : "Guest of Honour" A personal invitation to see its completion

This is a chance to see the difference you have made in the village. This includes: Free Unison Safari Guided trip of the region Your name will be inscribed in a plaque to be placed on the building Accommodation for the duration of your stay in the village

The Impact

Long after we have left Tanzania, we want Kasirwa to thrive as a centre for the development of human capital through arts and architecture. We want to ensure that whatever is built is respectful and is actually desired from the local residents. 

Expert contribution to the workshop from industry professionals and academics will help to ensure that the final design is seismically secure and safe. Local collaboration will confirm that the design is suited to local needs, that community members feel they have a stake in the success of the project, and that knowledge of construction techniques remains in the community once the project is complete.

Continual research and documentation throughout the workshop is essential so that our work can reach out and contribute to international concerns with sustainable urbanism, intelligent use of resources, and safe and sophisticated earthquake design. In achieving these aims, our workshop formatted project will address the problems and solutions essential to our aims. Namely, the advancement of  equitable, happier, healthier and more sustainable livelihoods through local design with broader outreach.

Risks & Challenges

We have been working tirelessly over the past year and a half whilst earning our degrees to get to where we are today. Some challenging but manageable factors naturally will arise in the process of carrying out this non-profit project.

As students, we lack the finances to support ourselves completely during this project. However, our personal involvement in this project is essential to its success. We have therefore factored costs of volunteering ourselves in the project to our fundraising campaign.

Where our experience as students may not be as complete as that of practitioners, we have a vibrant, international and dedicated network of academic, commercial and governmental experts assisting us with a wide and choice variety of knowledge.

Unforeseen events and challenges are characteristic of construction projects. For this reason, our fundraising budget accounts for the contingencies which will most likely occur over the course of our project. 

Spreading the knowledge gained from our experiences is a major aim of ours. But sometimes administrative costs such as printing and distribution can stand in the way. For these reasons, we intend to develop a virtual and open-source collection of data and research that is cheap to produce and accessible to all.

Sponsored By


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please like and follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter!
  • If you want to volunteer with us, contact us at shiftdesign.tanzania@gmail.com
  • Please share our campaign to your friends and family
  • Or, volunteer!

Thank you, 

The Shift Design Team

Sebastian Maher, Stephen Yiavasis, Lydia Hamer & Tyler Harlen

story:
You did not go to bed until 2:00 am because you were up grading your papers. You wake up at 5:00 am to help your 8 year old get ready for the bus. At the same time you are wondering how you can even make the drive in because you are meeting with a parent that is upset. Their child did not get an A on paper that only deserved a C at best. You do this as a calling, you do this out of love and to add to it your spouse has just taken a new job and you are going to be moving from Washington to Texas. What do you do?

TENhomes.net is the first concierge relocation service for anyone in the education field and was created for educators, by educators.  Public and private teachers, staff and faculty, school board members and/or college professors.  Our goal is to give the best benefits to everyone, even if you’re not ready to buy or sell.  Our partners are eager to give and Teacher Educator Network is there to help.  From free home listing warranties to $300.00 off of your home inspection and home mortgages at "par rates" are just the beginning. 

We are busy partnering with vetted local, state and national companies and Realtors to bring you the very best service at the very price. 

Coming this January you be able to login to your very portal site or pick up the phone and visit with a live service agent to help you with items such as…

Selling your home

  • Agents that are at the very best in helping you move your home quickly.
  • Residential services such as, plumbing, electrical, handyman repair, just to name a few
  • Packing/ Movers
  • Listing Warranties, for peace of mind while you settling into your new location
  • Make ready clean ups
  • Private login containing all your pertinent information and dates
Home rentals
  • You know where you are going but not sure you are ready to buy?
  • We can help you find that temporary place to call home while you are transitioning through your first full year.
Buying a home
  • Moving into the new district and already ready to make that purchase?  We can help
  • Find the agent, again through our vetting process
  • Help you understand what is going on in the housing market as well
  • Qualification and at "par rates"
  • $300.00 off that, all to critical, home inspection
  • Private login containing all your pertinent information and dates

Why does TENhomes.net and our partners do this? Because we share a common belief…  “Our future, regardless of who you are or where you are from is in the hands of Elementary school teachers, Jr High Principals or high school coaches on a daily basis.  They are over worked, underpaid and do this as a calling that they love.”

What We Need & What You Get

This funding will allow us: 

  • To do a full marketing launch, recruit the top talent in today’s market place and allow us to continue focusing on bringing in discounts from top consumer service base companies.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is able to contribute financially, but even a dollar can make a difference and that is OK.  Anything helps!  But please share these links with friends and family.  Every life is touched by Educator and they are worth it!

story:
The Basics and Who We Are

Katrina Ceguera and Keely Gerhold are the Co-Founders and Farmers of Tinyfield Roofhop Farm located in Brooklyn, NY. With agriculture in our roots, our women-run business began in the fall of 2014 with an idea to grow local and organic hops for the craft beer community in New York City. Tinyfield Farm has built a 500 square foot greenhouse this year, anchored in a concrete footer and constructed with the help and support of amazing friends. The greenhouse is home to salad greens and micro greens that we grow for local restaurants and consumers grown in an organic soil mix.

Tinyfield currently grows 60 cascade hop plants (a perennial plant that produces more flowers each season and integral to great beer!) trellised along the rooftop of the old pharmaceutical factory that is the farm's home, using the existing infrastructure to attach green to grey space. The farmers of Tinyfield are asking for your help to expand our operation and grow in a substantial way to continue bringing local, healthy food and drink to our community!


What We Need & What You Get

Currently our space consists of our greenhouse and our hops. We are seeking the funds to do some upgrades on the space, including adding more hops to be able to source to more local breweries, integrating more infrastructure in the greenhouse, and designing a gathering space to host you at the farm, situated under the beautiful hop bines.


$ 8,000

Infrastructure Upgrade:

  • Automated overhead irrigation

  • Temperature control and monitoring

  • Energy-efficient grow lights

  • Two tier growing system in greenhouse


$ 12,000

Farm Growth & Implementation:

  • Hop expansion

    • Soil, plant containers, trellis rope etc. for more hop plants

  • Supplies & materials to build raised beds

    • Flowers & herbs in outdoor growing space

  • Compost system

  • Apiary (bees) to expand rooftop ecosystem

  • Event space formation & upgrade: i.e. Picnic tables & lighting

We've got amazing perks for you, including this beautiful tote bag with our logo. There are many mix and match options to choose from--go get em! We're excited to share these goodies with you.


The Impact
The ladies of Tinyfield would be nowhere close to this dream without the love and support we’ve received already throughout this project, and with your help we can make the farm even more amazing! Thank you for believing in us and supporting young farmers and local agriculture in New York City.

Your contribution will allow us to further realize our dream that we have for Tinyfield. We really want to create a space where people can gather to celebrate local agriculture and local craft goods in New York City. We believe this project is valuable to the local community as we are growing quality, local organic products in an underutilized urban space and creating an ecosystem. Your contribution will help to bring those things to reality, and we will continue to work hard to allow this ecosystem to thrive and for you to share its successes.

We have shown a determined drive and passion for this project since its beginnings, and have done so creatively and with heart. Contributing to our project will get us over the ultimate hurdle: funding to expand our operation to help it realize its full potential. Only you can help us to do that! 



Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute, we totally understand. Another way you could help is to get the word out for us! Share with your networks what we've got going on to see if they can help a couple of hard working gals achieve their dreams. Thank you and cheers!

www.tinyfield.farm
@tinyfieldfarm

story:
Tiffanie's Community Coffee Corner

It's time to help local legend Tiffanie Boldizsar spread her wings, and start her own business!
Years ago, Tiffanie moved here from the East Coast. Since then she has established herself as a cornerstone of the local community. She is a published chef, and a whiz in the kitchen, with years of management experience in food service. Recently, her back has become a serious health concern for her, and she needs a way to provide for her family that doesn't hurt her.  


The Plan

Transform an old truck into a community focused organic coffee truck, and help a single mother start her own business.
She has given us so much love, companionship, and delicious food over the years, please help us give some back to Tiffanie!


What We Need

Tiffanie has already acquired the management experience, the culinary virtuosity, a van, and a couple of second hand espresso machines. She has also paired with local roasters: Rad Roasting Company. The truck will be parked at Keep It Simple Farm in Redmond, Washington, so patrons will be able to sip a delicious latte while they walk the nature trail, and visit the farm animals. From start to finish, this project is all about community!
All the big pieces are already in place! All she needs is startup capital for:
  • Paint
  • Furnishings
  • Payroll
  • Basic retail equipment set up
  • Other Espresso Equipment
  • Cups, utensils, etc.
  • Cleaning Supplies
  • Coffee
  • Food


Overview of Perks

The estimated minimum funds needed for this project is: $15,000. This money will go first and foremost to the renovation of the cart, purchasing/renovation of furnishings and hardware.  Anything leftover will go back to the community.

Anyone who donates to this cause will have access to a fun selection of perks, depending on how much you donate:

  • A free cup of coffee, prepared just the way you like it!
  • Free coffee beans from Rad Roasting Co.
  • A KIS Farm T-Shirt.
  • A drink named after you.
  • Free coffee for the life of the business.

Community Benefits

The coffee truck will be parked at KIS Farm, a community-focused educational urban farm.  It is a common gathering place for scout troops, garden clubs, and nature enthusiasts, and the addition of Tiffanie's shop will both enhance this existing community space, as well as draw new people into this community.

After the bottom line needs of this project are met, 5% of the proceeds will go to support local music, specifically cellist and singer Rapunzel the Duck Trainer (known for her work in Seattle bands: DvOd, Nice Garcons, The Weird Old Tricks and Safeword Sasquatch).  Tiffanie has long been involved with local independent music, both as an artist and a promoter, and is eager to give back.

Tiffanie has other community projects up her sleeve too.  So, if we can help her exceed her goal, we'll announce additional community bonuses.  The more we work together, the more we'll all get from this project!


Risks & Challenges

This endeavor will take a lot of work, and a lot of money.  The stakes are high: if Tiffanie cannot find a way to provide for her family, and take care her health, she may have to return to the East Coast, and we will all feel the loss of such a valuable member of our community.
The amount we are asking for is steep, but is the minimum Tiffanie needs.  Not being able to get adequate funding is a serious concern.  To mitigate this, Tiffanie will be relying on thrift stores, repurposing and craigslist, and will only be buying something new if it is absolutely essential.  The truck itself is a repurposed police van for prisoner transport--help us turn this sow's ear into a silk purse!

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is not about money, it is about community.  We are hoping for you to be part of that community, even if you can't afford a monetary contribution. here are some other way you can help Tiffanie:

  • Spread the word: share this campaign on all your favorite social media, and let your friends and family know. This organic coffee truck will be a community resource we can all enjoy, even if you've never met Tiffanie.
  • Donate equipment & supplies: we will need automotive paint, additional espresso equipment, furnishings & decor.  If you have something you think would help, please let us know!
  • Share your time: If you have a skill that you think might help Tiffanie with this project, don't hesitate to let us know.

story:
Who we are?

To be or not to be?...

How right was Shakespeare, how we all are Amleto!

Even the 3 of us a small italian family and small artist family, found ourselves many times wondering "to be or not to be?".


What we wanted, want and would like to be, maybe we will ask to ourselves forever; but what we didn't want, don't want and would not to be, we have it clear in mind.

Three years ago we said each other that we didn't want anymore to live in a land where it wouldn't be/wasn't longer possible to find: beauty and love for beauty, elegance/gracefulness, humanity and respect for humanity. Therefore we decided "to be".

And so here we are in Denmark with a new idea of life, in a country in which is possible to walk on the road to beauty, gracefulness, humanity, magnificence with a lot of will to find them and share them with you!

That's why the café/garrison of the italian (and not only italian) culture; the ideal place to meet together and "taste" the pleasure of the body, the mind and the soul.

We choosed "to be"... Will you be?



“CAPPUCCIO”….. the philosophy

“Cappuccio” is a life plan, a working and cultural ideal.
The aim of our project is to create a task that allows people living well: “work to live”, and not “live for working”.

The task is very difficult to achieve, especially if you are more than 50 years old and you live in Italy, but the expectation is to reach our dream in Denmark.

“Cappuccio” is a cultural plan especially for people who like eating good food and drinking coffee and cappuccino: for them, that represents special moments of the day.
It represents culture, flair, art, pleasure, love and history. It is a big and an important treasure that people are loosing and that we want to save. Maybe we can do this bringing and introducing our “eat and drink” culture out of Italy.

The plan represents culture because we would like to let our clients testing the flavour of good food, offering them music, art and literature, all related to the rites of good food.

“Cappuccio” is also a life plan, cause we believe that our clients are special and we love the fact that they will have the chance to taste and smell “the pleasure of life”.


“CAPPUCCIO”…. the menu

Our menu is written in your mind and in your body, and we want to learn reading and listening to it.
The main ingredient will be the “Time”, that slowly accompain you in your future choices, through different types of coffee, milk, cappuccino, milk with coffee, tea and herbal teas, that can be tasted alone or with desserts coming from the Italian tradition. We won’t offer full meals, but moments of meditation in order to achieve a good start of the day.
Breakfast time, but also eating snacks before dinner, together with a quiet and relaxing atmosphere will be the main subjects of the day, even because they represent the most important moments to nourish the soul.
Most of the ingredients are organic and purchased in the fair-trade.


Why do we need your help?

We are dealing with the most difficult challenge of achieving our life project, with our own strength, resources and with the people that want to believe in us.

As the soul of this idea is to create tastes, feelings and experiences for our guests, so we would like to build this idea with them and catch their thoughts and meld them with ours.

We need your help to realise our project in the best way we can, using the best products from Italy and Denmark and furnishing Cafè Cappuccio so that everyone that will step inside, will feel at home.. This task is in the hands of three young italian professionial architects, designers and (as you can see in the video above) videomakers, whom are working putting their hearts to this project.

If you want to "be" part of this dream and have your special place in Silkeborg, so help us spreading this campaign, talk about it with your family and friends, share it on Social networks so that the final Goal can be reached!


A little bit about us

ALESSANDRO:

I am an italian of the 60's and of those years I steal wear the optimism, the will to start again, the freedom, the games over the street, the few but essential and unforgettable. I've been of the 70's and of those I steel wear the adrenaline of politycal struggles, the rejection of politics, the discovery of anarchy and the dream about a world made by peace and love, the aroma of my first two loves: my first girlfriend and the theatre; and the mark of a grief that has no end.

I've been of 7he 80's, that luckily I lived upon the stage, real fiction, far away froma a false fiction of a TV and hedonistic life. At the end of those years I created with my life partner, my masterpiece: my son.

I've been of the 90's and 2000's, when I tried to work for live and not to live for work, both as enterpreneur and worker, though worthlessly because the hard work of a man, had no longer merit for my country.

I'm a man of today and tomorrow, danish, through my fifth life change, with a long future behind and a long past in front of me.


ANDREA:

With my 26 years, I'm the youngest column of this life project.

Since I moved away from home when I was 19, I learned some of the most important things in my life. I discovered the meaning of sacrifice, that before than mine was that of my parents, the importance of being diligent in everything has to be done, but also the great importance of take a break just to be with your friends, laugh, talk and act like a dumbass with them.

So, I can say that when I was 19 I started my Academic career, but also a bigger noninstitutional school about on how to create and manage your life now and in the future. Teachers have been my parents, myself and my friend of course.

Now this school is still going on, even harder than before but full of incitements, full of new people, and full of art, culture that for me are the same as chlorophyll is for plants.


FULVIA:

My name is Fulvia, I'm a person of few words, I love concreteness, what I see, what I touch and what I love; who really I am I'll show better with facts, with my hands' work. I'm a life worker, helpful and loyal with my tasks, tireless, able and open, always in love with life and its simplicity.

And since I'm of few words, I stop here. But wait, and you will see of what I'm capable.



Work in progress..




Vi vil skabe en super godt o varme Kafé med!

Creeremo un Caffè bello e dall'ambiente tiepido e familiare!

We'll create a god and warm Café!

been of 7he 80's, that luckily I lived upon the stage, real fiction,
far away froma a false fiction of a TV and hedonistic life. At the
end of those years I created with my life partner,  my masterpiece:
my son.
I've
been of the 90's and 2000's, when I tried to work for live and not to
live for work, both as enterpreneur and worker, though worthlessly
because the hard work of a man, had no longer merit for my country.
I'm
a man of today and tomorrow, danish, through my fifth life change,
with a long future behind and a long past in front of me.
ANDREA:
With my 26 years, I'm the youngest
column of this life project. 

Since I moved away from home when I was
19, I learned some of the most important things in my life. I
discovered the meaning of sacrifice, that before than mine was that
of my parents, the importance of being diligent in everything has to
be done, but also the great importance of take a break just to be
with your friends, laugh, talk and act like a dumbass with them.
So, I can say that when I was 19 I
started my Academic career, but also a bigger noninstitutional school
about on how to create and manage your life now and in the future.
Teachers have been my parents, myself and my friend of course. 

Now this school is still going on, even
harder than before but full of incitements, full of new people, and
full of art, culture that for me are the same as chlorophyll is for
plants.
FULVIA: 
My
name is Fulvia, I'm a person of few words, I love concreteness, what
I see, what I touch and what I love; who really I am I'll show better
with facts, with my hands' work. I'm a life worker, helpful and loyal
with my tasks, tireless, able and open, always in love with life and
its simplicity.
And
since I'm of few words, I stop here. But wait, and you will see of
what I'm capable.
Work in progress..  Vi vil skabe en super godt o varme Kafé med!  Creeremo un Caffè bello e dall'ambiente tiepido e familiare! We'll create a god and warm Café!

story:
This lovely house is the family heritage of Damien. His grandfather bought it in 1962 in a desastrous state and renovated it entirely. After that, it had been used as a family home for him and family and friends. As Damien's family lived in Germany and came over just for their holidays, it was getting more and more difficult to maintain the house, so the idea was to sell it. For years, nothing really happened, but the sudden death of Damien's mother in 2016 made a quick decision inevitable. Within one week we decided to take over the house and use it as a location for bed & breakfast, yoga seminaries and people who want to spend a quiet time, close to the Atlantic Ocean.

But of course we do not just have a great house. We also have ideas, visions, dreams - and construction sites. 

Unfortunately there are such not really funny things in the fulfillment of our dream as buying inheritance shares, securing start-up capital, surviving the first months, the first, second year, positioning ourselves, make ourselves to be heard.... everything is not so easy - especially when you are is new to the market and compete against many other giants, who simply drop by the bank and easily get a credit to build a pool area inside their retreat center gardens.

We are new and we are self-reliant and emigrated not so long ago - and therefore no bank claps happily in the hands when you speak up and want to borrow a pretty penny.

You wonder what exactly we are going to do and what you would support with your money?

1. We would like to make our terrace newer, even nicer, better, possibly replace some of the old tiles and build shade-giving pergolas.

2. In the back of the garden is an old, beautiful pond, which was filled in and should be reactivated. Around the pond we want to create a nice opportunity to sit down and rest.

3. Since we live in a sunny part of Europe, we would like to switch partly to solar energy. 

4. We would like to exchange all 25 currently single-glazed windows, as they are quite a disaster in terms of energy.

5. In three rooms and in one section of the corridor, there are still old pieces of jewelery under a drapery - namely the old wooden floorboards that we would like to sand down.

6. Our heating! We heat with oil, which means we have two huge oil tanks in the garage, which every year need to be filled up for a decent amount of money. We would also like to change from heating with oil to woodchips, also for ecological reasons.

7. At the moment, we are sleeping in our camping car next to the house during a full occupancy of the house, which in the long run is no real solution. Directly adjacent to the house is currently a 70sqm large, still fallow barn, which we would like to rebuild as an additional apartment.

8. We want to fundamentally and newly isolate our roof.

In addition, of course, there are redecorations, swipes, swapping things that break and this and that. And most importantly: we have to survive! :-).

story:
MAXALIZER, a one-of-a-kind all natural fertilizer that can revolutionize the cannabis industry, not to mention gardening and farming by replacing poisons and toxic chemicals used as fertilizers now, with a series of products that are Earth Friendly and made by recycling plant nutrients using a process we invented.  

But we know, in the fertilizer business, it's nice to be organic, Earth Friendly, and synthetic chemical free, but the most important detail is results and MAXALIZER is proven to beat synthetic chemicals in every test!  

Better Germination, better rooting, stronger plants, more flowers, better fruit... the list goes on. We want you to like us because we are Environmentally Friendly but we know you'll love MAXALIZER because it works better than ANY FERTILIZER on the market!

My name is Chad Currin and I have been a worm farmer for over a decade.  I started BioSoil Farm as a worm farm using custom bred night crawlers with diverse microbes in their gut to eat a special vegan diet in a specially created batch system to produce the best worm castings available on the market.

Many people know that worm castings by themselves make an amazing fertilizer, but they actually contain virtually no plant nutrients.  What worm castings do is breakdown the nutrients in the soil and "fix" them or make them available to the plants.  While many of my clients LOVED worm castings, I saw a need for a fertilizer that would work harmoniously with worm castings to provide the ULTIMATE PLANT DIET!  And the idea of MAXALIZER was born.

NUTRACYCLING is the process of recycling organic plant material and extracting the plant nutrients and "using them again" to feed a new generation of plants.  So we went about inventing a process to extract plant nutrients from things like banana peels, coffee grounds, egg shells, cauliflower and lettuces.  

Once we mastered the process of extracting the plant nutrients and suspending them in water, we set about testing over 100 different kinds of plants and foods to see what we could extract.  

Once we found what we could extract we made over 20 different formulas and tested them.  We measured their relative N-P-K and pH. 

Then we tested our formulas to see which ones worked best.

 

Then we tweaked and tested again. (and then again, and again and again)

Finally we got the formulation that worked best and we started testing it on everything!  And as controls,  we tested our MAXALIZER against Water only, Jack's 20-20-20, and of course, Miracle Gro.  MAXALIZER won EVERY SINGLE TEST!!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Now we are manufacturing MAXALIZER in small batches and producing about 1 TON of Worm Castings every week.

We have just moved into a brand new 12,000 square foot facility and we need to ramp up production so we can produce 10 tons of worm castings a week and 500-1000 gallons of MAXALIZER at a time.

We have partnerships with farms, clients, and distributors lined up and they want MAXALIZER for their greenhouses, their gardens, their farms and their turf grass, but we need to be able to produce it in large quantities.

 
 

The Impact

Synthetic Fertilizers destroy our soil and our water.  Synthetic Fertilizers destroy the ecosystem of the soil creating a need for pesticides, fungicides and herbicides that are only needed because the synthetic fertilizers have destroyed the balance of microbes and life in the soil.  Synthetic Fertilizer is not "plant ready" and most of it runs off into streams, ponds and lakes where it causes massive algae blooms, depleting all the oxygen in the water and killing fish and the animals that depend on them.

Because the plant nutrients Nitrogen (N), Phosphorous(P), and Potassium (K) and micronutrients in MAXALIZER are derived from plants it does not cause the same side effects.

Phosphorous and Potassium in most synthetic fertilizers are mined ripping open giant holes in the Earth to extract tons and tons of material that then needs to be heavily refined.

Synthetic Fertilizer is bad.  It had it's place but now we realize how dangerous it is and how bad it is for the planet and the time has come to rethink fertilizer.  MAXALIZER is the solution.

 

Risks & Challenges

1. Farmers, commercial greenhouses and others are used to synthetic fertilizers and while they know they are dangerous and toxic the results are proven and they don't want to lose their livelihood.  It may take some time for them to see there is a new way of doing things that provides better results without the dangerous side effects.

2. MAXALIZER is two products used together.  Worm Castings provide the essential microbes to break down the nutrients in MAXALIZER and make them available to the plants.  MAXALIZER is a liquid fertilizer that get's mixed 1/2 cup-1 cup per gallon of water.  People like "easy".  It may be a challenge to get people to use a two step program.  

3. MAXALIZER contains very low nutrient levels of NPK.  Some people are used to the propaganda that they need 20-20-20 formula or a 7-7-7 all purpose fertilizer.  Those numbers -the N-P-K nutrient percentages - are really only used for synthetics.  It's like thinking that if one multivitamin is good for people then a whole bottle would be better.  We all know what happens when we take tons of vitamins.  The body can't absorb them and they end up wasted.  Most synthetic nutrients end up wasted.  MAXALIZER's nutrients are time-released, don't "run off into the water table" and work with the Earth not against it, but it may be our biggest challenge to get people to use a better product but one that doesn't have the giant NPK numbers some are used to or think are important.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need to raise $150,000 to finish the build out of our facility, the production line for MAXALIZER and the automated system for harvesting 10x the worm castings we currently harvest.  But we know not everyone can make a donation or people wonder what they can do besides making a cash donation.  LOTS ACTUALLY!!!

If what we are doing is important to you, here are some ways you can help.

  • Share our campaign on facebook, twitter, or any social media
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Reach out to influencers you know; TV reporters, journalists, bloggers, etc.
  • Reach out to farmers, greenhouses, and gardeners and ask them if they would try MAXALIZER
  • Reach out to garden centers who may be interested in selling MAXALIZER gift packs in their stores.
  • ANy other ideas??  We would love your help.

Reach out to garden centers who may be interested in selling MAXALIZER gift packs in their stores.
ANy other ideas??  We would love your help.

story:
What is the Innovative Spirit Challenge?

Rwanda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Uganda abound with aspiring entrepreneurs; people with remarkable ideas that can provide solutions to the different problems of this region. Unfortunately, there are still barriers to accessing capital for the start-up phase. Rwanda has facilitated legislation on business creation, but leveraging investment and support for young entrepreneurs is still lacking. The Innovative Spirit Challenge is offering to lend a helping hand to these creators.

The Innovative Spirit Challenge is a business start up competition. Its vision is to encourage the creation of business by providing the best young companies with the financial support and linking them into a network of local entrepreneurs for mentorship. The competition helps candidates formulate their business strategies in such a way as to get the recognition and networks necessary to succeed. In addition to winning prizes and connecting with mentors, participating in this competition is a great opportunity to meet other entrepreneurs and professionals; to create and strengthen networks. This is a unique space for business start-ups. 

Investment in innovation in Africa focuses on the urban centres of Nairobi, Lagos and Johannesburg. But there is huge potential outside of these hubs in the rural regions. Therefore this competition is focused on showcasing innovative new ideas from the shores of Lake Kivu where exciting new investment opportunities are developing from across the region.

Competition Categories

The proposed businesses must address a problem in the following market sectors; agriculture, tourism, issues around energy and the environment, education and women empowerment. 

Prizes

The top two finalists from the five categories will be invited to participate in a grande finale, where they will pitch their ideas in front of a panel of judges. The first prize for each category will be US$1,000 with the runner up receiving US$250. Other prizes will also be available depending on sponsorship. 

The Organisers

Nathanael is an entrepreneur and Managing Director of Calafia Cafe, based in Gisenyi Rwanda. A self starter with microfinance experience in Haiti and Colombia, he is passionate about new technologies, renewable energy and good coffee.

Helen is Director of an international development organisation in Eastern Congo. A passionate advocate for social justice and women’s empowerment, Helen grew up in Tanzania and has dedicated her life to humanitarian initiatives in developing countries.

Cliff MUGISHA is the Western Rwanda Territory Account Manager for Korea Telecom Rwanda Networks company. One of the best selling sales agent (if not the best ) in Rwanda, Cliff is also the co-founder of Walk to remember and an active member of “Volunteer Uganda” and contributor to the online magazine “Workzine”.

Hebdavi is a contract coordinator for an INGO in Eastern Congo. He is board member of Congo Tree, a Goma based organisation that trains youth in leadership and transferable skills. He has a background in microfinance in DRCongo and a commitment to empowering the youth for a brighter Africa.

Manon est franco-belge, elle a déjà créé deux entreprises en France, été impliqué dans plusieurs club d’entreprise et elle coordonne maintenant un consortium d’ONG en RDC tout en vivant a Gisenyi.

Baptiste est français. Ingénieur de formation, il est spécialisé dans le développement de nouveaux produits et dans les stratégies de management. Il a travaillé avec les précurseurs français de l’intelligence économique et avec un organisme rattaché au ministère de la santé et du travail français.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

And now, in french ...

Le Rwanda, la République Démocratique du Congo et l’Ouganda fourmillent d’entrepreneurs en herbe, de personnes ayant des idées remarquables pouvant apporter des solutions aux différentes problématiques de cette région. Malheureusement, il est encore difficile de sauter le pas de la création. Le Rwanda a facilité la législation relative à la création d’entreprise cependant l’accès au financement et à l’accompagnement font encore défaut. L'Innovative Spirit Challenge propose justement de donner un coup de main à ces créateurs. 

Qu'est-ce que l'Innovative Spirit Challenge ?

L'Innovative Spirit Challenge est un concours de création d’entreprise. Il a pour vocation d’encourager la création d’entreprise en donnant ce petit coup de pouce qui peut faire basculer un destin. Il permet également aux candidats de mieux définir leur projet et éventuellement de se faire repérer. Au delà de la dotation officielle (financière, prestations de service, accompagnement), participer à ce concours est une belle occasion de rencontrer des entrepreneurs et des professionnels et ainsi de créer ou d'étendre son réseau. C'est un avantage précieux lorsque l'on démarre une nouvelle activité ! 

Critères d'éligibilité

Afin d’être éligible au concours et ainsi de recevoir un dossier de candidature, les participants doivent respecter les critères suivants :

  • Vivre ou être résident rwandais, ougandais ou congolais (RDC).
  • Avoir 18 ans au 25 novembre 2017.
  • Être porteur de projet ou jeune créateur d’entreprise (entreprise de moins d’un an).
  • Le projet doit être réalisable au Rwanda, Congo ou Ouganda.
  • Le projet doit être innovant.
  • Le projet doit avoir un but lucratif.
  • Le projet doit appartenir à l’une des catégories suivantes : Tourisme, Agriculture, Environnement & Energies vertes, Education, Emancipation des femmes.

Catégories du concours

Les participants doivent sélectionner la catégorie dans laquelle ils souhaitent concourir. Les projets d’entreprise doivent soit répondre à une problématique liée au secteur agricole, à l’environnement ou à l'éducation, soit promouvoir le tourisme ou la place des femmes dans la société.

Critères de notation

  • Originalité ;
  • Impact social ;
  • Qualité du dossier ;
  • Cohérence des chiffres ;
  • Potentiel de développement ;
  • Retombées en matière de création de valeur d’activité et d’emploi ;
  • Capacités entrepreneuriales des porteurs de projet.

Prix

La finale désignera le premier et le deuxième prix de chaque catégorie. Le gagnant de chaque catégorie recevra une dotation financière de 1,000 USD et le second une dotation de 250 USD, des dons matériels et de prestation de service ou d’accompagnement pourront également être remis en fonction des sponsors de l’événement. 

Budget

Le jury

Un jury de professionnels notera les dossiers de manière indépendante, confidentielle et sécurisée. Les finalistes seront invités à défendre leur projet d’entreprise  devant un panel d'entrepreneurs locaux.

Les organisateurs

Passionnés d’entreprenariat, nous sommes un groupe d’amis vivant à Gisenyi et Goma. Nous avons tous des profils différents mais cette envie de créer et d’encourager les gens à suivre leurs idées nous réunit, raison pour laquelle nous avons voulu créer le concours. Nous travaillons tous sur cet événement de façon bénévole.

Help and Hope-Be An Everyday Hero

The Jersey Shore was devastated by Superstorm Sandy. We, along with so many others, had to begin again from the ground up. We had to heal and rebuild. We chose to rebuild our lives and our business right here at the Shore, and we could never have done it without the help of community.

After Sandy, wonderful people from all over came to our small beach town, everyday heroes who came offering help and hope. From the Red Cross to the military to just regular folks from neighboring cities and states who were there offering blankets, warm coats, hot meals, and unconditional friendship--they were people who wanted to make a difference. We will never forget these wonderful people who were there during our darkest hours, and the impact that these loving strangers made is far-reaching and unforgettable.


And now it's our turn. We want to give back, to make a difference, to help rebuild and revitalize the Shore. It's about community and caring.

You can be a part of that. Believe us when we say--every dollar that goes to help small businesses flourish makes a huge difference. So many businesses were lost during Sandy, and some were unable to rebuild. Every business rebuilt means hope, revitalization, a strengthened economy, and a stronger community. By helping us rebuild, you will be making an indelible impact on the individuals and communities along the Shore. Your help and support will insure a long lasting impact on both individual lives and larger communities. Your support will not just be helping a small business grow. Your support will be making a real and lasting difference. 

Who We Are

Kathryn Elizabeth

My grandparents emigrated from Italy in 1925 seeking the American dream and wanting to bring their food business to America. Back in Naples, my grandfather Joseph  grew olives and pressed his own olive oil, grew grapes and made his own wine, and was an artisanal cheese maker. He ran a small grosseria in Naples, and when he came to America, his dream was to recreate that business. I can still remember as a small child struggling to push a huge wheel of cheese up a wooden plank into my grandfather's store.

I took those memories and skills that I learned while working at my Grandpa Joe's side and eventually went on to open my own gourmet food store. I tried to recapture that nostalgia and feeling of family and old Italy, and it gave me a great amout of joy to be able to follow in my grandfather's footsteps. Years later I met my business partner, Elana, and together we created The Belvidere Baking Company.

Elana

After my grandparents arrived from Europe in the early 1920's, they opened a successful garment business in Chicago. They literally came with the shirts on their backs, and it was through hard work and perseverence that they grew a business from the ground up. Their success inspired me to dream about opening my own business one day.

Kathryn and I love what we do. We love people and we love good food, and our business allows us to enjoy both. Sharing good food with good friends--there is just nothing better than that!


Our Company


We are the Belvidere Baking Company, and we make soft sweet artisan Belvidere Biscuits. Our special 130-year-old family recipe--passed down to us by our Grandmother Nicolina-is the best sweet you will ever eat. This is a family-owned business. It is much like the business that our grandfather brought from Italy to America in 1925.

We grew up in the food business, and so we know that great food is so much more than just great food--it's a lifestyle. We took our grandmother's recipe and tinkered with it, modified it, expanded it, and perfected it for years. As it turns out, our blood, sweat and tears really paid off. The moment we took our product to market, well...it was nothing short of incredible.



Our Product

Our artisan biscuits are the real deal. Our rich, buttery, nutty, and decadent biscuits are authentically artisan and made with the very best ingredients. Our absolute commitment to quality, freshness, and artisanal authenticity is easy to taste in every bite of our incredibly delicious biscuits. We use no preservatives and no GMO's, and use only the very best top-shelf ingredients like Valrhona chocolate from France, locally sourced produce like fresh Jersey blueberries, and fresh citrus zests from California. The quality, freshness, and obsession that goes into our biscuits are the reason our company is fast becoming a culinary sensation.


While other companies are downsizing their product, we are doing the exact opposite. So yes, you will practically trip over huge chunks of creamy Ghirardelli chocolate, colossal mounds of walnuts and macadamia nuts, mouthfuls of fresh juicy strawberries, cherries, and apples, and gooey swirls of caramel. With 22 flavors and counting, there is something for everyone. Double Cherry Chocolate Walnut, Orange Chocolate Macadamia, Blueberry White Chocolate, Strawberries and Cream, Pear Chocolate Cinnamon, Fresh Lemon Zest, Quadruple Chocolate, Chocolate Hazelnut Caramel...we'll never stop innovating.

When it comes to dessert, less is not more. At our company, we know that more is definitely more! We believe that in order to create a great, stand-out, one of a kind product, you cannot cut corners. There are no shortcuts to churning out a fabulous product. It takes time, attention, and passion to create deliciousness. Just as Grandma Nicolina did so many years ago in her kitchen, we are committed to bringing you the very best there is. 



A Unique Product is Hard to Come By

Nothing like our product has ever been seen or tasted before, so we can honestly and very excitedly say that our product is totally new to market. Not too many products can say this. Our family recipe is an exciting new product out there, and people love it. It's not yet another cookie, biscotti, scone...it's a Belvidere Biscuit. Now how many people can say that a recipe dating back to 1888 is new? We can!

Why This is So Important: The Return of Main Street USA

The Jersey Shore has been home to us for many years. Like so many others along the Jersey Shore, we lost everything during Superstorm Sandy. We chose to rebuild our lives and our business here because so many businesses were completely lost and will never be rebuilt. We know that for every business lost, a new one must grow. We want to be a part of restoring the shore. The return of Main Street is here, and now is the time to build on that momentum. Creating this retail space means more to us than just great baked goods. It's about recreating the nostalgia of yesteryear, the camaraderie of community, and the revitalization of small businesses along the Jersey Shore.



We want to open a retail location, a place where good food and good friends come together. We are ready. We want to expand our line of sweet biscuits, and we are poised to move into a savory line of biscuits, breads, and other artisanal baked goods. We are ready for a brick and mortar location so our customers can buy our bisuits anytime, all the time. We want to be able to fulfill larger orders, to be available to serve more customers, to grow and expand. We want our retail location to be full of delicious things to eat--a neighborhood place that is all about community and friends and good times, kind of the way things used to be.

We need to build on the growing trend of the return of small businesses... those Mom and Pop stores where customers were treated like royalty, where quality and customer service was never sacrificed for anything, when time and attention and love were the cornerstones of business. We are ready to be  part of that. It's about putting out the best quality products. It's about personalized customer service, it's about caring about each and every customer and making sure that they have the best experience they've ever had. We want to be part of the triumphant revitalization of the Jersey Shore. Our strong and solid business plan, our loyal customer base, a surge in sales and increased demand, our momentum and traction, and critical acclaim from the food industry tell us that we are ready. And we need your help to make it happen.

What We Need

Our sweet artisan Belvidere Biscuits have caused a culinary sensation here at the Shore and beyond, and as demand continues to build fast and furious, we know that we are ready to take the next step. We have been asked by thousands of people the million dollar question: When are you opening a store?

 Right now we are renting space in a small commercial kitchen. It's tough working around the schedule of others, to not have the counter or oven space needed to create and bake our product in larger quantities, or the space to store ingredient inventory or the ability to retail our products.

With funds raised we will:

1. Rent a small retail space that will serve as both a baking facility and a storefront. We will need to purchase equipment, such as ovens, stainless steel work surfaces, and other necessary equipment. We will need to purchase bakery cases and retail fixtures for the storefront. We are looking for a former bakery space to minimize startup costs.

2. Expand our product line, such as savory biscuits, our gluten-free line, breads and stuffed breads, and other artisan baked goods.

3. Purchase inventory- ingredients, packaging supplies, labeling, etc.

4. Licensing and permits.

Why We Need It

Because we don't have our own facility, we are unable to grow our product line, to expand, to fulfill larger orders, and to meet customer demand. We cannot be available all the time, anytime--and we want to be! Customers call us all the time--"Where is your store located? I need to get some biscuits!" or "Are you still open? I'm throwing a party and need a tray of biscuits!" It happens all the time. We don't ever want to be forced to turn down any orders. 

What We're Up To Right Now

We currently sell online from our website, in New Jersey retailers like America's Cup Coffee Company in Asbury Park, Just Jersey in Morristown, and others, and at vendor events such as spring and fall festivals, farm markets, arts, music, and food festivals, among others. 

Please visit our website at: The Belvidere Baking Company Online

We are very active on social media. We love talking, tweeting and connecting with our customers, food industry specialists and foodies from around the world. Please join us on any of our social media channels.

Twitter:  @BelviBiscuits


Facebook: facebook.com/BelvidereBaking

Instagram:  instagram.com/belviderebakingcompany

Pinterest:  pinterest.com/belvidereb

Our Customers

We totally love the festivals and farm markets we attend because we get to meet our customers, to interact with them, to get to know them. Our customers are a diverse crowd from all walks of life, but they all have one thing in common--they are addicted to our biscuits! We can honestly say that we have forged lasting friendships with many of our wonderful customers that we have met at these events. There's no feeling in the world as wonderful as being able to share something special that you have created with others, to see the smile on their faces as they bite into something you've made for them to enjoy. We put so much time, attention, and commitment into every single one of our artisan biscuits, and it is so rewarding to see those customer reactions. Good food made with love and care often leads to good friends, and that is exactly what happens everytime someone bites into one of our biscuits.

Our booth--which is our current "storefront"- always seems to be the "happening place" at every event we attend. Maybe it's because we stand out there, greeting customers, offering them generous samples and great conversation. We schmooze, they eat, they buy, they come back with family and friends...and it's loads of fun. We love the camaraderie, the laughter, the love as our customers eat and enjoy and obsess over our biscuits. Yes, we sell out at every event--every single one. It happens every time without exception. Our biscuits have caused a culinary craze--and we are loving it! 

Here's What Our Customers Are Saying
These are actual reviews from our customers. Thanks everyone!

Just got my Belvidere Biscuits in the mail the obsession is real! Chocolate walnut, triple chocolate peanut butter, and triple chocolate cherry walnut. I can't wait to eat them all. If you are looking to treat yourself, or a friend to a scrumptious and delicious gift, order from The Belvidere Baking Company! They have many flavors to choose from- pick your favorite!!

Facebook Post
Kate C. Jan 16 2016 

Your biscuits are wicked good...
Freda.  Nov 2 2015

WOW!!!!  Best ever.  Fabulous, delicious, incredibly decadent.   Have never had better.  Sent some cross country to mom in California...she could not have enjoyed more. (Mom is 93 and loved the assortment)  Thank you.

Domenick B. Nov 1 2015

Hello! 

As I suspected, the biscuits were a HUGE hit!  We ended up at my nephew's new houseSaturday evening and I brought them for dessert. Oh my goodness, everyone went crazy over them.  I can see why the Cherry Chocolate Walnut is your most popular flavor!! Wow!  My Mom said the lemon was her favorite.  Oh and the Blueberry!!! Coconut was my husband's favorite. Glad you were able to give me an assortment. The packaging was very nice with the bow :)
Thank you again!  You have a very satisfied customer!

Blessings,
Fran Septmeber 29 2015

For more customer comments and reviews, visit our customer page on our site by clicking here. 

We Are Honored

When customers and people in the food industry tell you that your product is the best thing they have ever eaten...when you are listed in the 2015 Best of NJ Gift Guide: Presents for Foodies...well, you know you are onto something. 


Risks & Challenges

We all know that almost all business owners have something of a "risk-taker" mentality, and thank goodness for that! It takes a lot of courage and vision to start a business, but a smart, well-prepared, and intuitive business owner has what it takes to not only open a business, but to make sure that the business thrives and flourishes.

While no one can infallibly predict the success of a business, there are some really good indicators that can often guarantee a successful business venture. It takes a strong and solid business plan, proper management, and measured planning for attainable and, more importantly, sustainable growth. That, coupled with lots of hard work and a solid vision for the future, can help insure success.

We have a proven track record of sales and repeat sales, increasing customer and retailer demand, and a solid plan for scaling our business. Our business model is all about sustainable growth, innovation, and absolute commitment to our company. Our consumer base is strong and growing. We've got a great and unique product that consumers want. And that is always the bottom line for successful businesses. 

Our family has industry experience in the specialty food trade, retail operations, marketing and advertising and the most important skill of all--how to create and bake wonderful things.

We have:

  • A Comprehensive and Adaptive Business Plan
  • An Active and Progressive Marketing/Advertising Plan
  • A Growing Customer Base 
  • Begun Executing Plans For Product Line Expansion
  • A Growing Retail Network
  • E-Commerce Expansion Plans
  • The Gift of Gab and a Bit of Comedic Talent
  • Mad Baking Skills

Other Ways You Can Help

By helping us rebuild, you will be making an indelible impact on the individuals and communities along the Shore. As we grow, we will be able to provide jobs and provide service to our community. Your support will not just be helping a small business grow- you will be making a real and lasting difference for both individual lives and larger communities.

Every dollar counts! But if you are unable to contribute monetarily, there are other ways you can get involved. Spread the word about our crowdfunding campaign--share the link on your social media platforms by using the indiegogo sharing tools, and don't forget to tell your family and friends!

Check out our website and explore our Schedule of Events page and plan a visit to our beautiful booth--we'd love to see you at our next event! Stop by, try a free sample, and get to know us and our delicious Belvidere Biscuits!

Help and Hope-Be An Everyday Hero
The Jersey Shore was devastated by Superstorm Sandy. We, along with so many others, had to begin again from the ground up. We had to heal and rebuild. We chose to rebuild our lives and our business right here at the Shore, and we could never have done it without the help of community.
After Sandy, wonderful people from all over came to our small beach town, everyday heroes who came offering help and hope. From the Red Cross to the military to just regular folks from neighboring cities and states who were there offering blankets, warm coats, hot meals, and unconditional friendship--they were people who wanted to make a difference. We will never forget these wonderful people who were there during our darkest hours, and the impact that these loving strangers made is far-reaching and unforgettable.

And now it's our turn. We want to give back, to make a difference, to help rebuild and revitalize the Shore. It's about community and caring.
You can be a part of that. Believe us when we say--every dollar that goes to help small businesses flourish makes a huge difference. So many businesses were lost during Sandy, and some were unable to rebuild. Every business rebuilt means hope, revitalization, a strengthened economy, and a stronger community. By helping us rebuild, you will be making an indelible impact on the individuals and communities along the Shore. Your help and support will insure a long lasting impact on both individual lives and larger communities. Your support will not just be helping a small business grow. Your support will be making a real and lasting difference. 
Who We Are

Kathryn Elizabeth
My grandparents
emigrated from Italy in 1925 seeking the American dream and wanting to bring
their food business to America. Back in Naples, my grandfather Joseph  grew olives and
pressed his own olive oil, grew grapes and made his own wine, and was an
artisanal cheese maker. He ran a small grosseria in Naples, and when he
came to America, his dream was to recreate that business. I can still remember
as a small child struggling to push a huge wheel of cheese up a wooden plank
into my grandfather's store.
I took those memories
and skills that I learned while working at my Grandpa Joe's side and eventually
went on to open my own gourmet food store. I tried to recapture that nostalgia
and feeling of family and old Italy, and it gave me a great amout of joy to be
able to follow in my grandfather's footsteps. Years later I met my business
partner, Elana, and together we created The Belvidere Baking Company.
Elana
After my grandparents
arrived from Europe in the early 1920's, they opened a successful garment
business in Chicago. They literally came with the shirts on their backs, and it
was through hard work and perseverence that they grew a business from the
ground up. Their success inspired me to dream about opening my own business one
day.
Kathryn and I love
what we do. We love people and we love good food, and our business allows us to
enjoy both. Sharing good food with good friends--there is just nothing better
than that!

Our Company


We are the Belvidere Baking Company, and we make soft sweet artisan
Belvidere Biscuits. Our special 130-year-old family recipe--passed down to us

We grew up in the food business, and so we know that great food is so much
more than just great food--it's a lifestyle. We took our grandmother's recipe
and tinkered with it, modified it, expanded it, and perfected it for years. As
it turns out, our blood, sweat and tears really paid off. The moment we took
our product to market, well...it was nothing short of incredible.


Our Product
Our artisan biscuits are the real deal. Our rich, buttery, nutty, and
decadent biscuits are authentically artisan and made with the very best
ingredients. Our absolute commitment to quality, freshness, and artisanal
authenticity is easy to taste in every bite of our incredibly delicious
biscuits. We use no preservatives and no GMO's, and use only the very best
top-shelf ingredients like Valrhona chocolate from France, locally sourced
produce like fresh Jersey blueberries, and fresh citrus zests from California.

story:
Proyecto Resiliencia Desatada

                                        Project Untethered Resilience

Quien Somos:

Somos dos reporterxs independientes de las tierras ocupadas de EU y Canadá. Trabajamos en medio de una red de organizaciones y publicaciones dedicados a la justicia ecológica y solidaridad transfronteriza.  Buscamos a compartir las historias de autodeterminación comunitaria y resiliencia en frente de las industrias explotadoras.

Who we are:

We are two independent journalists from the occupied lands of the US.  We work within a network of organizations and publications dedicated to ecological justice and trans-border solidarity, and seek to share stories of community self-determination and resilience in the face of exploitive industries.  

Objectivos:

  • A publicar el grado en que los modelos del consumo excesivo del Norte son predicados sobre sufrimiento físico por infundir a los medios con las voces de lxs que están viviendo en medio de tales operaciones extractivas como la minería, monocultivos, y maquiladoras.
  • Sacar a luz las historias de lxs que están desafiando activamente contra el capitalismo sin identificarse con la subcultura de las “activistas”  
  • Ofrecer un medio para que las comunidades pueden expresar sus necesidades.
  • Describir la conexión entre la contaminación del Río Sonora por Grupo México y la construcción del Acueducto Independencia.
  • Atraer más atención a la urgencia de la crisis de salud a largo de Río Sonora y la falta de recursos y apoyo internacional.
  • Explorar la relación entre la actividad minera y el flujo de migrantes por la frontera de EU y MX.
  • Investigar la influencia de capital estadounidense y canadiense en provocar la crisis actual.

Objectives:


  • To publicize the extent to which the excessive consumption patterns of the global north are predicated on physical suffering by infusing the media with the voices of those living amidst extractive operations such as mining, water theft, monoculture, and sweatshops.  
  • To surface stories of those who are actively defying the onslaught of capitalism without identifying with the “activist” subculture.
  • To provide a medium for communities to voice their needs.
  • To portray the connection between the contamination of the Rio Sonora by Grupo Mexico’s Buenavista Mine in Cananea and the Independence Aqueduct draining the Rio Yaqui.
  • To bring attention to the urgency of the health crisis caused by the contamination of the Rio Sonora and the lack of resources and international support for affected communities.
  • To explore the connection between mining activity and the flow of migrants across the US-MX border.
  • To investigate the influence of US and Canadian capital in fueling the current mining boom and resultant crisis.

Acercamiento

Viajar extensamente a comunidades afectadas y documentar sus narrativas por el medio de fotografía y entrevistas.

Estudiar el contexto político y económico de la lucha actual.


Approach

Traveling extensively to affected communities and documenting their narratives through the media of photography and interviews.

Researching the economic and political context of the current struggle.


                                              Our Funding Needs

Equipment

While we already have a camera, voice recorder, and a few notebooks, we hope to purchase memory cards, lenses, and a tripod

Transportation

We like to walk, but sometimes it is not the most efficient means of arriving at a place where we are expected.  Money for bus fares, gasoline, chain lube, and horse grain would be appreciated.

Community Support

We like to be able to provide medical supplies, food, drinking water, and any other needed provisions to communities along the contaminated Rio Sonora.

ANY FUNDS NOT NEEDED FOR PERSONAL NEEDS WILL BE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO COMMUNITY SUPPORT.
