Trabajamos en medio de una red de organizaciones y publicaciones dedicados a la justicia ecológica y solidaridad transfronteriza.  Buscamos a compartir las historias de autodeterminación comunitaria y resiliencia en frente de las industrias explotadoras. Who we are:We are two independent journalists from the occupied lands of the US.  We work within a network of organizations and publications dedicated to ecological justice and trans-border solidarity, and seek to share stories of community self-determination and resilience in the face of exploitive industries.  Objectivos:

A publicar el grado en que los modelos del consumo excesivo del Norte son predicados sobre sufrimiento físico por infundir a los medios con las voces de lxs que están viviendo en medio de tales operaciones extractivas como la minería, monocultivos, y maquiladoras.


Sacar a luz las historias de lxs que están desafiando activamente contra el capitalismo sin identificarse con la subcultura de las “activistas”  


Ofrecer un medio para que las comunidades pueden expresar sus necesidades.


Describir la conexión entre la contaminación del Río Sonora por Grupo México y la construcción del Acueducto Independencia.


Atraer más atención a la urgencia de la crisis de salud a largo de Río Sonora y la falta de recursos y apoyo internacional.


Explorar la relación entre la actividad minera y el flujo de migrantes por la frontera de EU y MX.


Investigar la influencia de capital estadounidense y canadiense en provocar la crisis actual.

Objectives:
To publicize the extent to which the excessive consumption patterns of the global north are predicated on physical suffering by infusing the media with the voices of those living amidst extractive operations such as mining, water theft, monoculture, and sweatshops.  
To surface stories of those who are actively defying the onslaught of capitalism without identifying with the “activist” subculture.
To provide a medium for communities to voice their needs.
To portray the connection between the contamination of the Rio Sonora by Grupo Mexico’s Buenavista Mine in Cananea and the Independence Aqueduct draining the Rio Yaqui.
To bring attention to the urgency of the health crisis caused by the contamination of the Rio Sonora and the lack of resources and international support for affected communities.
To explore the connection between mining activity and the flow of migrants across the US-MX border.

To investigate the influence of US and Canadian capital in fueling the current mining boom and resultant crisis.

AcercamientoViajar extensamente a comunidades afectadas y documentar sus narrativas por el medio de fotografía y entrevistas.Estudiar el contexto político y económico de la lucha actual.ApproachTraveling extensively to affected communities and documenting their narratives through the media of photography and interviews. Researching the economic and political context of the current struggle.                                              Our Funding NeedsEquipmentWhile we already have a camera, voice recorder, and a few notebooks, we hope to purchase memory cards, lenses, and a tripodTransportationWe like to walk, but sometimes it is not the most efficient means of arriving at a place where we are expected.  Money for bus fares, gasoline, chain lube, and horse grain would be appreciated.Community SupportWe like to be able to provide medical supplies, food, drinking water, and any other needed provisions to communities along the contaminated Rio Sonora.ANY FUNDS NOT NEEDED FOR PERSONAL NEEDS WILL BE DIRECTLY APPLIED TO COMMUNITY SUPPORT.

story:
Who We Are

Presque Isle Farm is a small family farm owned and operated by Molly and Dion Stepanski in northern Michigan. Deemed a Centennial Farm by the Michigan Historical Society, this homestead has been with the same family for over 100 years. 

In 2014, we began working to transform the land into a thriving market vegetable farm. Our mission is to grow nourishing food, a healthy community, a vibrant local economy, and a restorative environmental system.         

What We Need and Why We Need It

We recently received a $10,000 grant from the Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and a $15,000 zero interest loan from Hoophouses for Health and the Michigan Farmers Market Association.  Hoophouses for Health "increases access to Good Food for vulnerable families while at the same time expanding the Good Food infrastructure and season extension capacity of Michigan farmers." Through this program we will establish relationships with local schools to develop farm to school programs and work with community social networks to increase farm to table access. 

We are more than halfway to our goal, but need another $20,000 to implement our ambitious $45,000 healthy food access and conservation plan. The plan includes building greenhouses, establishing an apiary and permanent bee habitat, and developing an environmental restoration soil fertility plan.

  • The high tunnel greenhouses will  increase healthy food access and allow for a year-round growing season to produce more food for local schools and families while utilizing fewer resources .

  • The establishment of permanent bee habitat and an apiary will encourage healthy pollination, essential to the entire planet’s food production system and ecosystem.

  • The development of an environmental restoration cover crop and soil fertility plan will increase the nutritional value we can provide to the community, solidify the farm’s future in the local economy, and balance the local ecology.


Where Will Your Contributions Go?

The cost of implementing our complete healthy food and conservation plan is approximately $45,000. With $10,000 covered by the NRCS, and $15,000 covered by the Hoophouses for Health loan, we are asking for support towards the remaining $20,000.

Your IndieGoGo funding will support:

  • $8,000 - the remaining funds needed for two 30’ x 96’ high tunnel greenhouses (built by Nifty Hoops)

  • $5,000 - one 14’x 72’ heated propagation greenhouse, greenhouse heater, propagation benches, and irrigation system (built by Nifty Hoops)

  • $5,000 - begin the establishment of permanent bee habitat and an apiary

  • $2,000 - begin developing an environmental restoration cover crop and soil fertility system

Our stretch goals include:

  • establishing more bee habitat

  • building a more efficient washing and packaging facility

  • build more greenhouse space


Your Generosity's Impact

Supporting us necessarily means supporting a local business, bringing true wealth to our regional economy, and helping our communities grow happier and healthier. Local and sustainable food helps combat a food system that floods our grocery stores and schools with nutrient-deficient food. Our agricultural practices act as a regenerative force against climate change and the extinction of bees and other invertebrate pollinators.

In a world where big agriculture and detrimental farming practices continue to destroy the health of our planet and its people, we know your generosity will help begin moving our communities in a different direction.

story:
Aistech Space


  • Español 
Somos una empresa espacial pioneros en el uso del sistema de detección de aviones, ADS-B, desde el espacio. Queremos ayudar a tener un control más exhaustivo de las aeronaves a nivel mundial. 
Esta campaña es importante puesto que nos ayudará a presentar el proyecto en la feria internacional de Aeronáutica de Farnborough. Allí podremos  buscar colaboraciones o inversores interesados en nuestra idea. Esta feria es una de las más importantes del sector Aeroespacial a nivel mundial, es por eso que creemos en que sería la mejor oportunidad para mostrar al mundo un proyecto tan innovador y llamativo en este ámbito. 
Como colaboradores nos ayudaréis a que este proyecte tire adelante ya que sin vuestra ayuda no podríamos presentarlo en Farnborough. A cambio recibiréis imágenes inéditas del festival aéreo más importante del año, donde las empresas más importantes del sector presentarán sus novedades.

story:
Problem

It estimated that 40 percent of middle income Americans will not have saved enough money to retire at age 65. One prime reason is that the current avenues for investing  have such low returns. 

  • The average 401k return is 4.1%

  • IRAs yield only about 6%
  • Mutual funds average 7.5%
  • S&P 500 index has 20 year average return of 9.4%.

Solution

  • Twenty First Century Investor has a unique algorithm for investing in Fidelity Select sector funds that for the past 10 years has returned an average of 19%. In addition our method did not have a single negative year during that time, even in 2008 when the S&P lost 37%! 
  • In this campaign we offering a one year subscription to our investment newsletter with up to 75% off the regular price. This periodic, emailed,  newsletter alerts subscribers when to buy and sell the funds selected by our algorithm so that they can reap the same high returns. The newsletter is issued monthly and during the month if a trade is made.  

What We Need We need your help in raising $10000.00 that will be used to fund a comprehensive marketing program. Full use will be made of all media forms including, website, Blog, Facebook and twitter. This will allow us to reach more low and middle income families so that can use our investing model to aid in reaching their financial goals.

  

 Background

My name is Joe Ryden. I developed the Finfit method of investing by  adapting several techniques that I had used when I worked for a large manufacturing company in product quality control. The basic premise used  is to operate in the present. No attempt is made to predict future events like most  current investing methods, such as the faulty buy and hold. 
During my working career I was awarded 5 patents.

How Does It Work?

  • We invest only in Fidelity Select sector funds of which there are generally 40. Each fund represents a sector of the overall market, such as energy, computers and transportation.
  • Each fund consists of a number of individual stocks that are engaged in that particular sector. This feature offers lower risk over investing in an individual stock. 
  • We only invest in 5 funds at a time These are chosen using by our proprietary selection method.
  • There are times when we will hold fewer than 5 funds. On rare occasions, we park all our money in a market fund.  
  • Our turn-over rate is small. Approximately 50% of our funds are held more than one year.
  • To get started, you first have to have a brokerage account. Since the funds that we purchase are Fidelity funds, it may be easier to open an account with Fidelity Investments. This requires a $ 10,000 minimum for the Fidelity Select funds account. 
  • When you receive our newsletter, either purchase or sell the Select funds indicated. Instructions will be provided as to  where to put the proceeds from a fund sale.

story:
Présentation détaillée du projet

Nous  sommes une société active dans le secteur du transport en taxi et location de voiture avec chauffeur ( LVC ) et de plus en plus nous avons des demandes de transport venant d'institutions comme la commission Européenne, les ambassades et autres organismes établies à Bruxelles mais malheureusement que nous perdons simplement parce que notre flotte actuel de 3 voitures( Peugeot 508,Hyundai i40 et Ford mondeo)ne répond pas à leur demande de confort et luxe car préfère des Mercedes,Audi ,BMW, Jaguard  etc….
Nous travaillons également sur la plate form Uberx c'est à dire uber professionnel avec une License de transport rémunéré de personnes.
Depuis quelques jour cette plate forme uber à lancer uber black à Bruxelles qui rémunère un peu plus au km ces partenaires(1,90€/km) au lieu de 1,20€ pour le uberx malheureusement là aussi il nous faut une voiture de haute standing genre Mercedes classe E,C,S etc où Audi où BMW de la même catégorie pour s'y affilier.
C'est une surprise pour personne, acheter un véhicule haut de gamme répondant aux normes environnementales (CO2) qui soit à la fois récent (règles des licences de taxi), confortable et luxueuse coûte cher sans compter l'assurance spécifique pour le transport rémunéré de personnes.
Pourquoi nous tourner vers le crowdfunding, vous direz vous c'est parce que nous n'avons pas assez de fond propre et être indépendant n'est pas facile et les banques ne suivent pas souvent les projets.
Ce sont toutes ces raisons qui font que nous sollicitons votre soutient pour nous permettre d’acquérir une voiture répondant à toute ces exigences et pourvoir se développer et créer plus d’emplois car chez une voiture emploi 2 .

À quoi servira la collecte ?

Cette levée de fond nous permettra d'agrandir notre flotte avec l'achat d'un véhicule berline "haut de gamme". (Mercedes, Audi,Jaguard, BMW etc.),d'accepter plus de clients,de répondre aux exigences de notre clientèle VIP (institutions européennes,ambassades et autres organismes )en terme de confort, sécurité, luxe et discrétion pour ne plus rater aucune demande de service où de réservation.

Ce véhicule sera utilisé pour le transport  de passagers vers les aéroports ou des aéroports vers le lieu souhaité (domicile, hôtel, lieu de séminaire etc.) mais sera aussi utilisé en location à la demi-journée où à la journée avec chauffeur pour les demandes des institutions européennes, ambassades,OTAN 

,des sociétés, location pour les mariages, des excursions, etc...

Ces fond serviront également à :

Assurer la voiture pour le transport de personne.

Achat de 2 tablettes que nous mettrons à bord du véhicule à la disposition des clients.

Installation wifi 4G à bord du véhicule.

Abonnement au journal "LE SOIR" qui sera également mise à bord pour les clients.

Renouvellement et modernisation de notre site internet en y ajoutant système de localisation ,moyens de paiement en ligne.

Objectif de financement : 30 000€

Réparti comme suit :

*  24 000€ pour achat voiture ( Mercedes,Audi,Jaguard où BMW. 

*     3000€ pour assurance transport rémunéré de personnes.

*      1000€ pour achat tablettes à bord pour clients.

*        500€ pour installation wifi 4G à bord du véhicule avec et abonnement à un journal qui sera à bord pour les clients

*      1500€ pour renouveler et moderniser notre site internet.

story:
The Mongol Rally

Is the biggest and most important charity rally existent, the first rally took place in 2004. 

The Rally starts in Europe and ends in Ulan Ude, Russia. It is considered the greatest motoring adventure on the planet. It is conceived as an adventure for those who participate, and not as a ‘traditional’ rally. Any kind of vehicle is allowed, as long as it has a 1200cc engine.


'Moldova' Special Highschool 

Local Charity

We all heard of Andrea Bocelli, Derek Paravicini, Gordon Mote (the pianist from the Gaither Vocal Band), Ray Charles, Stevie Wonder.. these names are very, very familiar. How about a young girl by the name of Livia Fronea (the pianist), Sebastian Toma (hip-hop artist), Lidia Tiron (guitar player) or Andrei Tarnea (drum player)? Among their extraordinary talents they have another thing in common: unfortunately, they have a decline of vision.

We visited the ‘Moldova’ Special Highschool located in Targu Frumos, Iasi, Romania along with the AMiCUS Student Association, a Non-Profit Organization, in which we are members.(https://www.facebook.com/amicusiasi/?fref=ts) 

‘Moldova’ Special Highscool from Târgu Frumos, Iaşi County, (http://liceulmoldova.ro/first-page/) for its students of all ages is the place where they can learn and grow in harmony with themselves and with society. Their needs are respected and represent a starting point in what the school offers.

In this link - https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.753780901410001.1073741854.746724435448981&type=3 you can see more photos taken there.  

Last time, in a recent project,  we bought them all MP3 players to listen to courses, music, we spoke to them and we invited Livia Fronea, the pianist girl, to play at a Christmas concert and all of them to sing at Jesus' birthplace - an improvised arrangement for children to see, along with real donkeys and sheep -   to experience the best that the world can give. 


PURPOSE

With your help we can offer them specialized courses and guideness for their education, skills for an independent life and specific therapy.

There are approximately 120 students from all Moldova’s county, blind or poor sighted (with sight deficiency), from pre-school class up to class XII.

This is the fact that makes them different from the rest of the people, who are not visually impaired. But, also, there are many other aspects that make them the same: the joy of childhood and adolescence, hopes and dreams, the love that they need and which they want to share with the rest of the people and, last but not least, the wish to become somebody.

About us

This summer we give up the beach, the mountain climbing for something unique. We give up our cozy bed and we sleep in a million star hotel. We will eat as the locals eat and instead of paved street we preferred paths. Yes, we are going to Mongolia! In a Dacia! (as James May, ex-presenter, from Top Gear would like).


THE TEAM

Codrin Tăbăcaru – 24 years old, Dentistry student, passionate about curiosities and motoring

Radu Bompa – 28 years old, Computer Programmer student, passionate about nature

Mario Bompa – 23 years old, Computer Programmer student, passionate about technology

Tiberiu Băsăscu - 26 years old, Dentistry student, passionate about history and motoring




WHY “CAR CU BOYS”

There is a popular painting in Romania, by Nicolae Grigorescu called ‘Car cu boi’ – Oxcart. The idea represents a word game:

  a. Car cu Boys = vehicle with boys

  b. Car cu boi = oxcart

THE CAR

It's a Dacia 1300 (sister of Renault 12), with a 1289 cmc engine. Runs smoothly, drives very well and it's orange! It's gonna be epic!

Supporting us you will:

  • Make a great impression for your future customers 
  • Make yourself/your company more known to public
  • Improve your brand image
  • Get advertised all over the world
  • Share a taste of our adventure

Visible on:

  • Our travel car
  • Our official t-shirt  
  • Our Facebook page
  • The pictures taken on the route
  • The route journey/album
  • Expositions, media

And of course, we are open to any suggestion.

For any other information, please mail us: carcuboys@gmail.com. We are at your disposal to develop a plan to achieve other mutual goals.

This experience is a life changing moment and we want to be take part for making a better world for everyone.

High appreciation for your attention,

Car cu Boys.

It is considered the greatest motoring adventure on the planet. It is conceived as an adventure for those who participate, and not as a ‘traditional’ rally. Any kind of vehicle is allowed, as long as it has a 1200cc engine.'Moldova' Special Highschool Local CharityWe all heard of Andrea Bocelli, Derek Paravicini, Gordon Mote (the pianist from the Gaither Vocal Band), Ray Charles, Stevie Wonder.. these names are very, very familiar. How about a young girl by the name of Livia Fronea (the pianist), Sebastian Toma (hip-hop artist), Lidia Tiron (guitar player) or Andrei Tarnea (drum player)? Among their extraordinary talents they have another thing in common: unfortunately, they have a decline of vision.We visited the ‘Moldova’ Special Highschool located in Targu Frumos, Iasi, Romania along with the AMiCUS Student Association, a Non-Profit Organization, in which we are members.(https://www.facebook.com/amicusiasi/?fref=ts) ‘Moldova’ Special Highscool from Târgu Frumos, Iaşi County, (http://liceulmoldova.ro/first-page/) for its students of all ages is the place where they can learn and grow in harmony with themselves and with society. Their needs are respected and represent a starting point in what the school offers.In this link - https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.753780901410001.1073741854.746724435448981&type=3 you can see more photos taken there.  Last time, in a recent project,  we bought them all MP3 players to listen to courses, music, we spoke to them and we invited Livia Fronea, the pianist girl, to play at a Christmas concert and all of them to sing at Jesus' birthplace - an improvised arrangement for children to see, along with real donkeys and sheep -   to experience the best that the world can give. PURPOSEWith your help we can offer them specialized courses and guideness for their education, skills for an independent life and specific therapy.There are approximately 120 students from all Moldova’s county, blind or poor sighted (with sight deficiency), from pre-school class up to class XII.This is the fact that makes them different from the rest of the people, who are not visually impaired. But, also, there are many other aspects that make them the same: the joy of childhood and adolescence, hopes and dreams, the love that they need and which they want to share with the rest of the people and, last but not least, the wish to become somebody.About usThis summer we give up the beach, the mountain climbing for something unique. We give up our cozy bed and we sleep in a million star hotel. We will eat as the locals eat and instead of paved street we preferred paths. Yes, we are going to Mongolia! In a Dacia! (as James May, ex-presenter, from Top Gear would like).THE TEAMCodrin Tăbăcaru – 24 years old, Dentistry student, passionate about curiosities and motoringRadu Bompa – 28 years old, Computer Programmer student, passionate about natureMario Bompa – 23 years old, Computer Programmer student, passionate about technologyTiberiu Băsăscu - 26 years old, Dentistry student, passionate about history and motoringWHY “CAR CU BOYS”There is a popular painting in Romania, by Nicolae Grigorescu called ‘Car cu boi’ – Oxcart. The idea represents a word game:  a. Car cu Boys = vehicle with boys  b. Car cu boi = oxcartTHE CARIt's a Dacia 1300 (sister of Renault 12), with a 1289 cmc engine. Runs smoothly, drives very well and it's orange! It's gonna be epic!Supporting us you will:
Make a great impression for your future customers 
Make yourself/your company more known to public
Improve your brand image
Get advertised all over the world
Share a taste of our adventure
Visible on:
Our travel car
Our official t-shirt  
Our Facebook page
The pictures taken on the route
The route journey/album
Expositions, media
And of course, we are open to any suggestion.For any other information, please mail us: carcuboys@gmail.com. We are at your disposal to develop a plan to achieve other mutual goals.This experience is a life changing moment and we want to be take part for making a better world for everyone.High appreciation for your attention,Car cu Boys.

story:
Welcome to the Crew


Every day, homebrewers around the world create delicious brews, but they can only share them with their closest friends. Today, in order to reach a greater audience, brewers have to invest hundreds of thousands of dollars in expensive equipment, locations, licenses, marketing, and distribution. It’s simply something most craft brewers can not do, and the world suffers for the lack of their beer.


We plan to change all that.


International Brewers is the world’s first open-source brewery. We are making the investment so homebrewers don’t have to. Craft beer artisans will send us their recipes. We will taste them, and if they’re great, we’ll brew them, cask and bottle them, label them, and distribute them to bars and restaurants in Panama and eventually to the rest of the world.


How will it work?


In the music industry, artists create demo tracks and submit them to record labels. The labels listen to each demo and decide whether or not to produce it. Once they do, they work with the artist to create a high quality recording and cover art, then distribute that final product around the world, sharing the profits with the artist.

We plan to model International Brewers after this system. We will accept brews submitted by craft beer makers and taste them. If we like them, we’ll move forward by producing a test batch and giving it a trial in our taproom. If it proves popular, we’ll work with our marketers to create a label design with the artist’s signature, then bottle and distribute the beer around Panama. Profits from beer sales will be shared with the brew’s original creator.


The Brewery


The brewery will contain:

  • One 2000 liter brewing system (MLT+KWT+HLT),

  • Four 2000 liter unitank fermenters,

  • a semi-automatic bottling line, and

  • a double-station keg filler

All this adds up to a peak production capacity of 2,000 barrels of beer each year, with the ability to grow organically.


The Restaurant


In front of the brewery, we are building a taproom. Along with delicious beers, we’ll offer an impressive fusion of local and international flavors, with beer-friendly delicacies such as shepherd’s pie and moroccan fish tacos.

The restaurant will be built using a converted shipping container, in the style of the almost extinct, locally iconic “Diablo Rojo” buses. Food will be pre-made and served hot. The restaurant and upstairs terrace will have a 50 person seating capacity.


The Distribution System


We have already established relationships with local distributors to ensure that beers are carried at restaurants and bars throughout Panama. We’ll also be running our own distribution system reaching even the smallest businesses, such as food trucks and kiosks. We eventually plan to branch out and establish international distribution channels. This is made possible by Panama’s unique status as a global distribution hub and financial center.


What do we have?


We have already started the process of building the brewery. We have formed the company. We have raised capital for the equipment. We have sourced the ingredients. We’ve even created the first three beers to be bottled and distributed. We’re well on our way to becoming fully operational in six months time.


What do we still need?


We’ve already raised 70% of the capital required. We’re lacking $80,000 which will be spent on operational costs for the first year, including:

  • Rent,

  • Salaries,

  • Utilities,

  • Maintenance,

  • Ingredients,

  • Insurance, and

  • Marketing


What are the perks?


$15 - Lightweight

If you're in Panama, stop by the brewery once we're open and pick up a six-pack from the home collection. Take a tour while you're at it. It's on the house! We'll also add your name to the wall of fame, which will be displayed proudly to guests of the taphouse.


$35 - Heavy Drinker

Are you more serious about your drink? The Heavy Drinker perk will get you everything in the Lightweight package, plus a limited edition BroMaster Growler.


$55 - All About the Beer

Now we're getting somewhere! You'll get all the perks of the Heavy Drinker plus we'll add in a customized BroMaster koozie and bottle opener.


$125 - The BroMaster

Wow! To thank you for your awesomeness, we're going to add an International Brewers BroMaster t-shirt and cap to the schwag bag!


$5000 - CoFounder Respect

You just paid for a fermenter! It will be yours and yours alone, permanently emblazoned with your name, for all the world to see. And as a special reminder, you'll get a personalized stainless steal growler to go along with all the rest of the gear!


Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Use the Indiegogo tools to help spread the word so that the beer makers and beer drinkers closest to you will hear about us and make this crazy idea come true! Here's where you can find us on your favorite social networks!

facebook.com/intlbrewers
twitter.com/intlbrewers
instagram.com/intlbrewers
internationalbrewers.com

story:
Made in Mossyrock, WA USA

We have a passion for helping Senior Citizens
and  created a product that can help with one of the biggest issues affecting Seniors today, falls. 

My Story; In the summer of 2015 I opened a business providing durable medical equipment (DME),  (back braces, knee braces, ankle foot orthotics etc..), and saw a need for a brace that could help with balance for Seniors. I then realized that technology needed to be incorporated into footwear that could be worn everyday that did not look like a brace. I broke out my tools in the garage, researched the subject and set out to find the best materials to develop, design and build the slippers.  The process took on many forms and many failures until I came up with a design that incorporated a polycarbonate plastic frame that provided stabililty.  I then designed the attractive shell with easy to clean and water resistant material and added the features needed to help with slips and trips.  I showed the rough prototype to a Podiatric Doctor  friend who liked the design and performance.  I then showed it to other Doctors and experts who have happily recommended the slipper for fall reduction. I then continued to refine it until I was able to create the current patent pending model. 

We want to help seniors enjoy the best quality life 
while staying independent for as long as they can.  Your contributions and support will provide the funding to produce the best slipper for reducing slips and trips.
We have a production/market ready product and are seeking funding for production of the slippers. We are committed to being part of the engine that provides jobs in the USA.

LibrosVia Slippers is a product that will disrupt the slipper industry with a product benefitting our parents and grandparents' wellness, happiness and independence.
Doctor Recomended:

"As a Podiatric physician, I have wanted to recommend footwear that provided adequate stability and safety features for my elderly patients to wear comfortably at home and easy to don, LibrosVia slippers are the answer."

Dr. Roland Ramdass, DPM

"LibrosVia slippers provide the Support and comfort my patients want. I highly recommend them for all people to help with slips, trips and falls."

Dr Abel C Borromeo V, DC


 
 Slippers Unisex Sizing, size up to: 
X-Small;  Womens 6 1/2 

Small; Men's 7 - Women's 8

Medium; Men's 9 1/2 - Womens 11

Large; Men's 11 1/2 - Women's 12+

X-Large; Men's 14

Widths are adjustable, extensions available for x-wide sizing.

LibrosVIa slippers c

ome in Suede, Red, Blue and Silver.
Water and Stain resistant material, easy to clean 
Stabilizing Polycarbonate frame

Snug heel fit, with collar

Open toe design for comfort and accommodates foot/toe issues 

3-layer 1” foam padding with arch support

Easy to use straps with velcro closures for ease of use

Slip resistant (wet/dry) low profile sole

Hi-top features an ankle stabilizing frame for superior balance support and enhanced strapping for better propioception.

In case there are issues with fit after delivery, we will exchange the products to get you the right fitting product. 

The products come with a  90 day warranty. If you are unsatisfied for any reason or there are any performance issues, we will gladly exchange or refund as needed. 

Press:

Changing The World – One Foot At A Time

Posted by Sara Xia in Business and Corporate, Highlights, News.

Arnold’s made-in-Washington flexible foot brace fits perfectly with Desh’s goal of “Helping Clients Change the World.” Every day in the United States, 10,000 people turn 65. One in three seniors are going to fall. Of those over age 80, 70 percent will fall, Arnold notes. “I could sell several hundred or 1,000 a year of a custom product or a lot more to more people of these off-the-shelf models and hopefully move the needle,” he said. “If you’re helping 2,000 people, that’s great. If you’re helping 200,000 people, it’s even better.”

This article was written by Cynthia Flash.
For media requests, please contact elizabethb.librosbalanceware.com.

story:
Do you think that it is important to have access to food produced locally in way that is respectful of the land, people working to grow it, and the animals?

Do you want to be able to buy meat that was raised outside of confinement systems, not subjected to daily doses of antibiotics, and fed pasture and high quality feed that isn’t made with genetically modified organisms?

Do you want to see the rural communities around Alabama, Georgia, and Mississippi have their economies revitalized?

If so, we are asking for your support.

We are Pell City Processing and Marble Creek Farmstead. Our farm raises pigs, cows, chickens, goats, sheep, ducks, geese, guineas, and rabbit for our local community. The demand for our meats has been high, particularly for chicken. We raise them with a non-GMO feed on fresh pasture. The nutrient density, flavor, and quality of these birds cannot be beat. As a result, we have had interest from restaurants and grocery stores to provide them with chicken.

But there was a problem…

The closest USDA-inspected facility for us to get them processed was in Kentucky. That is too far for the birds and the people. It just wouldn’t work.

We worked with the state and found a recently shuttered facility. We agreed to take it over if we could get approval to process chickens there. Well, they did, and we have been open for business for 3.5 months now. But is a hard and expensive road to be good at operating a processing facility.

You have to balance labor costs, tons of government regulations, high equipment costs, and the need for low prices from the farmers you process for. Although it's a challenge, we can make it with your help.

What do we need?

Operating funds and funds to buy much-needed equipment.

Equipment

In an ideal world, we would raise enough funds to buy all this equipment. If we do not, we will buy the most-needed equipment we can with what we do raise.

Vacuum Sealer:  $5,000 - This is the biggest bottleneck to our production currently. We have one that is too small, and it slows the whole process down significantly.

Poultry Line        

Poultry Stun Knife:  $2,075 - This will allow us to humanely slaughter the poultry quickly and efficiently

Hock and Neck Knife:  $1,265 - This greatly improves the speed of processing.

Vent Cutter:  $2,475 - This also greatly improves the speed of processing.

Lung Remover Flush Valve:  $400 - This improves the speed of processing and the cleanliness of the birds.

Chill Tank:  $986 - This increases our capacity from 300 birds per day to 600 birds.

Evisceration Shackle:  $550 - This greatly improves the speed and sanitary conditions of processing.

Shackle Conveyor:  $2,200 - This greatly improves the speed and sanitary conditions of processing.

Poultry Line Build Out:  $3,200 - This allows us to operate both a poultry line and red meat line on the same days, doubling our capacity in both areas.

Hog Scald and Scrape     

Electric Stunning:  $4,505 - This allows for a more humane slaughter and allows us to use the pig's ears, cheek, head, etc. It also allows us to use beef tongue. Without it, these items are wasted.

Scalder/Scrape:  $8,000 - This allows us to leave the skin on the hogs which many chefs and farmers want. It decreases waste of the animal by 20%.

Total:  $30,656

 

Operations

Currently we are operating a deficit. Our farm is paying that deficit, but that limits how long we can keep the doors open. Many farmers are excited about using our plant, but it takes time for them to grow the chickens and hogs to keep us busy enough to become profitable. Processing is a very labor-intensive business. We are asking for help with our operations during this grow-out period. Every dollar really matters. Here is what we need.

Operations Monthly

Building and Equipment Lease:  $4,250

Hide and Tallow:  $150

Water:  $100

Internet:  $120

Insurance:  $500

Power:  $1,500

Alagasco:  $150

Ice:  $250

Butcher Supplies:  $2,500

Kill Floor Lead:  $2,000

Kill Floor Assist:  $1,250

Butcher: $3,000

Butcher Assist:  $1,760

Packer:  $1,600

Post Slaughter Clean Up:  $1,000

Poultry Evisceration:  $800

Poultry Evisceration:  $800

Total:  $21,730

We are currently averaging $17,000 - $19,000 in monthly revenue. So we are asking for $10,000 - $20,000 to help us cover that deficit while the farmers in the area grow their businesses with the new options they have available to them.

We thank you for your support!

Here are some links to help explain why this processing plant is so important, and a little more about sustainably-raised meats:

http://www.foodandwaterwatch.org/news/contract-...

http://modernfarmer.com/2014/02/chicken-farming...

http://www.sustainabletable.org/1649/the-meat-t...

 

Here's a link to a very informative recent podcast about our family, our farm, and our processing plant:  http://alabamaignite.com/marble-creek-farmstead/

Testimonials from Other Farmers

"The addition of a poultry processing space catering to small producers like us will be a game changer. Last year we raised 400-500 broilers. This year we would like to increase that to 800-1,000. With the market Matthew has opened up and the adequate processing capability created by this project, we would increase production in 2017 and 2018 up to 4,000 birds per year and commit to bringing them to the new facility. We hope to see this project funded as it will help us and other small producers in Alabama expand our operations."

------

"When we found your farm and processing facility online back in April, we could not have been more thrilled. We have struggled to produce enough pasture raised poultry in our State of Mississippi due to limited to no access for small scale poultry producers to process their birds. We were only allowed to process 1,000 birds ourselves, and this limited our growth drastically over the last six years.

Since we have partnered with you to not only process our own pasture raised poultry, but also to purchase your pasture raised poultry it has helped our business grow immensely. We are now able to sell pastured poultry at farmers markets, grocery stores, restaurants, and our own buying clubs. Without your hard work and dedication to growing and processing poultry, we would continue to struggle to have the birds needed for our markets."

------

"If they [Marble Creek] are able to create a market for poultry then we will be interested in growing for it. We currently raise 50 to 100 broilers annually for our retail channels. If a market existed that was profitable for us we could grow 2,400 (200 a month) annually in addition. We hope to see this project funded as it can really make a difference to the financial sustainability of our operation." 

Credits 

Thank you so much to our great friends at the Alabama Sustainable Agriculture Network (ASAN) for their support of this campaign.  Thank you so much to Andrea Mabry for shooting the video.  Thank you very much to Joshua Hamilton for editing the video.  Thank you especially to all our consumer and farmer customers who support both our businesses!

It decreases waste of the animal by 20%.Total:  $30,656 OperationsCurrently we are operating a deficit. Our farm is paying that deficit, but that limits how long we can keep the doors open. Many farmers are excited about using our plant, but it takes time for them to grow the chickens and hogs to keep us busy enough to become profitable. Processing is a very labor-intensive business. We are asking for help with our operations during this grow-out period. Every dollar really matters. Here is what we need.Operations MonthlyBuilding and Equipment Lease:  $4,250Hide and Tallow:  $150Water:  $100Internet:  $120Insurance:  $500Power:  $1,500Alagasco:  $150Ice:  $250Butcher Supplies:  $2,500Kill Floor Lead:  $2,000Kill Floor Assist:  $1,250Butcher: $3,000Butcher Assist:  $1,760Packer:  $1,600Post Slaughter Clean Up:  $1,000Poultry Evisceration:  $800Poultry Evisceration:  $800Total:  $21,730We are currently averaging $17,000 - $19,000 in monthly revenue. So we are asking for $10,000 - $20,000 to help us cover that deficit while the farmers in the area grow their businesses with the new options they have available to them.We thank you for your support!Here are some links to help explain why this processing plant is so important, and a little more about sustainably-raised meats:http://www.foodandwaterwatch.org/news/contract-...http://modernfarmer.com/2014/02/chicken-farming...http://www.sustainabletable.org/1649/the-meat-t... Here's a link to a very informative recent podcast about our family, our farm, and our processing plant:  http://alabamaignite.com/marble-creek-farmstead/Testimonials from Other Farmers"The addition of a poultry processing space catering to small producers like us will be a game changer. Last year we raised 400-500 broilers. This year we would like to increase that to 800-1,000. With the market Matthew has opened up and the adequate processing capability created by this project, we would increase production in 2017 and 2018 up to 4,000 birds per year and commit to bringing them to the new facility. We hope to see this project funded as it will help us and other small producers in Alabama expand our operations."------"When we found your farm and processing facility online back in April, we could not have been more thrilled. We have struggled to produce enough pasture raised poultry in our State of Mississippi due to limited to no access for small scale poultry producers to process their birds. We were only allowed to process 1,000 birds ourselves, and this limited our growth drastically over the last six years.Since we have partnered with you to not only process our own pasture raised poultry, but also to purchase your pasture raised poultry it has helped our business grow immensely. We are now able to sell pastured poultry at farmers markets, grocery stores, restaurants, and our own buying clubs. Without your hard work and dedication to growing and processing poultry, we would continue to struggle to have the birds needed for our markets."------"If they [Marble Creek] are able to create a market for poultry then we will be interested in growing for it. We currently raise 50 to 100 broilers annually for our retail channels. If a market existed that was profitable for us we could grow 2,400 (200 a month) annually in addition. We hope to see this project funded as it can really make a difference to the financial sustainability of our operation." Credits Thank you so much to our great friends at the Alabama Sustainable Agriculture Network (ASAN) for their support of this campaign.  Thank you so much to Andrea Mabry for shooting the video.  Thank you very much to Joshua Hamilton for editing the video.  Thank you especially to all our consumer and farmer customers who support both our businesses!

story:
Bewilder is Blooming!

Bewilder Floral is founded by on a love for all things wild. With 20 years of floral experience behind us, we base our designs from nature, using primarily local and foraged materials.

`

In 2017, we hope to launch our sustainable floral design business, providing the Bay Area with personal, natural florals for weddings and events, as well as arrangements on a weekly and monthly basis for homes and businesses. All the while, spreading our love of the wild with meaningful and inspiring online and print content.

But we need your help to make it through the winter!

Join Our Workshop Series:

Support our launch and help us get through the slow season by taking a class and learning something new in the new year. Here's how:

  1. Select the classes you want to take from section on the right.
  2. When the campaign ends Larisa will get in touch with you to schedule a class time that works for you. Classes can be held in our home or yours, or in our new studio!
  3. Classes begin with a short meditation to focus and center ourselves and will end with a group mandala with whatever petals and foliage are not used.
  4. All participants will learn a new skill and go home with a unique floral creation all their own.

Or if workshops aren't your thing, choose from a selection of handmade goods.

Endless Thanks for Your Support!

Your Contribution will help us:

  • Launch our business
  • Find clients that share our vision
  • Secure our studio space
  • Generate original content online and in print that shares our love of all things wild
  • Continue volunteer work at the Zen Hospice Project

More about Bewilder:

Founded in 2016, our mission is to share our awe for the natural world with both clients and students. We believe there is so much more to floral design than what meets the eye--human connection with flowers is ancient and sacred. Flowers signify the passing of seasons, and in their brief and beautiful lives teach us about the ephemerality of our world. 

As a part of this mission, Larisa leads a team of volunteers at the Zen Hospice Project to provide donated flowers to hospice patients each week. The Bewilder team also aims to provide a quarterly zine and regular online posts, featuring everything from how-tos to botanical musings, for anyone wanting to get in touch with their wilder side.

Other Ways You Can Help:

As a baby business, it is crucial that we get through the slow season and into our growing line up of 2017 weddings.

If you cannot take a class, please consider signing up for our email list at Bewilderfloral.com and sharing our work with friends and loved ones. We are currently booking weddings for 2017 and seeking clients in need of florals for their home or business. 

Sign up for a monthly flower subscription:

Bay Area residents can also join our monthly subscription plan, featuring a seasonal floral selections in a handmade ceramic. Sign up at bewilder-floral.cratejoy.com. Gift cards are available to give the gift of flowers as well.

And don't forget to share our campaign!

story:
About Me: My name is Nikkya Hargrove, the daughter of a formerly incarcerated woman.The fact that my mother was in jail or prison for much of my childhood, was a secret I held onto well into my adulthood. That is, until I found the courage to tell my story. Today, I am a freelance writer for The Washington Post, a place where I share my own stories of life and parenthood. My passion for reading and writing propelled me to pursue my dreams and shaped my view of the world.

With supportive programs and access to literacy and education, I graduated from high school and Bard College with a passion and enthusiasm to shape the youth and the communities I served. It is with this passion, to empower my own community of Stratford, Connecticut that Serendipity Books was born.

Together we can create a safe place to engage in diverse and inclusive storytelling and make Serendipity Books a place we can grow together through our love for books and community!

(Reading at an early age...)

Founded in 1639, Stratford, Connecticut is a quaint settled town in upper Fairfield County that borders the thriving urban environment of Bridgeport, Connecticut. Our communities support a diverse population of varied ethnic, cultural, and socioeconomic backgrounds. Yet we have ZERO independent bookstores in Stratford or Bridgeport. Serendipity Books will provide LITERACY for ALL through affordable books, free children’s events, and joint community programs.

(Even a children's costume party for Halloween!)

We will provide local jobs for residents of Stratford and Bridgeport. It is our duty to give back to the place we call home and the people we live near! We seek to be an employer which supports the livelihood of our community. We are a business which will buy from our local coffee shops and offer tea/coffee daily. Our wine nights will be supplied by our local wine store. And other goodies will be served/sold thanks to our talented local artists, authors, chefs, bakers and more!

(And don't forget, coffee will be readily available)

Our bookstore would be the first of its kind. A small independent bookstore focused on educating our community about social issues which impact us all. Our programs and services will be diverse and include, in part: Paint and Wine Friday Night Out, monthly social group (a discussion group), a volunteer experience for community members to read during story time, healthy Saturday - in which local produce is provided and a cooking demonstration is given to encourage healthy eating and so much more! It will provide discounted and free books on specific days, so everyone can be served!

Your contribution will help us with: 

  • Inventory
  • Renovations to include: book shelves and furniture
  • Space on Paradise Green (a girl can dream, can't she)?

Want to keep in touch and see what we are up to?

Find us here:

www.serendipitystratford.com

Twitter @ SerendipBooks

Instagram: serendipstratford

Thank you for taking the first step to help make a difference for Stratford, Bridgeport, and our neighbors!

story:
The NEED
Fairfield County is one the richest counties in the state of Connecticut.
Bridgeport, Connecticut is one of the poorest cities in Fairfield County.
Startford borders Bridgeport and our communities are diverse, inclusive, and in need of a bookstore like Serendipity Books!

With over 200,000 residents between Stratford and Bridgeport, we have ZERO bookstores!

SERENDIPITY BOOKS IS IN THE NEWS!

Daily Voice Fairfield article is HERE

Westfair Online Business Journal article is HERE

Shelf Awareness article is HERE

 

About Me:

My name is Nikkya Hargrove: wife, mother and a visionary who wants to open an independent bookstore in Stratford, CT. Today, I am a freelance writer for The Washington Post, a place where I share my own stories of life and parenthood. My passion for reading and writing propelled me to pursue my dreams and shaped my view of the world. 

Together we can create a safe place to engage in diverse and inclusive storytelling and make Serendipity Books a place we can grow together through our love for books and community!

Founded in 1639, Stratford, Connecticut is a quaint settled town in upper Fairfield County that borders the thriving urban environment of Bridgeport, Connecticut. Our communities support a diverse population of varied ethnic, cultural, and socioeconomic backgrounds. Yet we have ZERO independent bookstores in Stratford or Bridgeport. Serendipity Books will provide LITERACY for ALL through affordable books, free children’s events, and joint community programs.

We will provide local jobs for residents of Stratford and Bridgeport. It is our duty to give back to the place we call home and the people we live near! We seek to be an employer which supports the livelihood of our community. We are a business which will buy from our local coffee shops and offer tea/coffee daily. Our wine nights will be supplied by our local wine store. And other goodies will be served/sold thanks to our talented local artists, authors, chefs, bakers and more!

 

Our bookstore would be the first of its kind for our community. A small independent bookstore focused on educating our community about social issues which impact us all. Our programs and services will be diverse and include, in part: Paint and Wine Friday Night Out, monthly social group (a discussion group), a volunteer experience for community members to read during story time, healthy Saturday - in which local produce is provided and a cooking demonstration is given to encourage healthy eating and so much more! It will provide discounted and free books on specific days, so everyone can be served!

Your contribution will help us to: 

*Stock our shelves with inventory from books to apparel!

*Renovations - book shelves, furniture, and inviting amenities 

*Reserve a location! 

**YOU spoke and we listened...consensus from our first pop-up shop was that Paradise Green would be the best place for our bookstore!**

We need $125,000 to open our doors! In addition to small business loans and other grants, your donation will get us closer to reaching $125,000!

Want to keep in touch and see what we are up to?

 

Find us here:

www.serendipitystratford.com

Twitter @ SerendipBooks

Instagram: serendipstratford

Thank you for taking the first step to help make a difference for Stratford, Bridgeport, and our neighbors!

story:
Hi, my name is Kyo Pang and I am the owner/ chef at Kopitiam.  Kopitiam was opened since September 2015 in Lower East Side. Thanks to all the loves and supports from our followers, Kopitiam has become one of the local scene in the neighborhood, and the interest in our food has grown to the point that we have many social media followers follow us around five boroughs.

Kopitiam means "coffee shop" in our language back home. Kopitiam serves as a specific spot for the locals just like their second home. Kopitiam not only serves as a coffee shop, but also offering local street foods that people will never get bored with, even for everyday. 

When I opened up this place, I wanted to create a store for people who are just like me, who had left home for many years, and still missed the taste back home. I wanted to create a spot where people will feel like home, a warm and friendly spot that people started any conversations comfortably with anyone that are sitting right next to them everyday. I believe that this is something New York City has always been lacking of. 

In Kopitiam, we specialized in traditional Baba Nyonya cuisine. Baba Nyonya cuisine is one of the oldest and fading tradition because the preparation process is so delicate and time consuming.  Our delicacies are very colorful, flavorful and visionally exciting. On top of that, we do not use any additive, just like in the old days, we use flowers and leaves to create the colors of the treats that we carefully handcrafted. 

I'm the third generations from a Baba Nyonya family and my family were well known for a wide variety of traditional Baba Nyonya cuisine and Kuih or the past 50 years in Malaysia. I wasn't raised to be a chef nor I was once proud that I was raise as the eldest Nyonya in my family. With all the feedbacks we received from the customers, I finally understand and accept my duty as a Nyonya, a woman who is dedicate to cook for loves.

Unfortunately, our current landlord has requested for another 25% increase after our 2 years rent ends. Therefore, we have decided to move to a bigger location and expand to a larger menu.  However, our abilities are limited and the expansion is expansive. So, please help us to keep this beautiful tradition alive by supporting Kopitiam.

Our final day will be until end of this coming December. We have found another location nearby and was hoping that we can lock down the location as soon as possible. With your help, the funds we received will be used for renovations and equipments purchases. We hope to be up and running by February/March 2018. We are not asking for just donation but for the amount you put in, will be used as gift credits and can be redeemed at our new store. 

Your support will be extremely appreciated. Please follow our updates and hope to see you soon at our new Kopitiam!

story:
ABOUT US

Lyddie's Goods LLC is a small food business that provides a wide range of meals including classic American comfort food, Thai cuisine and Thai fusion dishes. Lyddie's Goods started as a not so serious part time gig to provide eggrolls, crab rangoon and other snacks to friends and family about 2 summers ago.  As things started to pick up and orders started to roll in we found it difficult to balance both our full-time jobs and the orders from Lyddie's. One year later, Lydia decided to take a leap of faith to pursue her biggest goal.  She always had a love for cooking and dreamed of opening a small restaurant one day, so she left her full-time job in order to take the necessary steps to grow her food business. Lydia's partner Brad stood by and helped every way he could as she took every step possible in order to legitimize Lyddie's Goods. Over time, Lydia found a commercial kitchen to cook out of and was able to get her food license. Currently, the business runs weekly meal specials that are available for pick up/delivery and you can catch them at the Milford Farmers Market twice a month or grab a cup of hot soup at The Nashua Garden located in downtown Nashua, NH. Lydia does most of the cooking by herself but sometimes has assistance from her mother, Noy and of course her biggest supporter and partner, Brad. 

As you can see, Lyddie's is a small operation but it is so dear to us. Most of our greatest memories revolve around our family, friends and great food. Those three things create this feeling that is almost indescribable and it's something that you feel in your heart. It truly is the best feeling being around the ones that you love - talking, laughing, sharing and bonding together over a great meal. It makes you feel happy and whole. We want to create that environment for you so if you choose to dine in, you not only enjoy our food but you can enjoy it in a space that was geared to make you feel comfortable and at ease.

A Couple Of Our Goals 

  • To provide you with a wide array  of food using fresh ingredients that will rock your taste buds. We love making things in small batches because it allows us to pay close attention during the process and we can assure you that everything was made with extra love and care. 
  • Build and create long lasting relationships and connections with our customers. We want to make an impact by bringing people together and being interactive with our community.  

Your contribution will help us on our journey to find our first home for Lyddie's Goods. Starting a business is never easy and we've laid the ground work to get our food business growing but now we are asking for support from our friends, colleagues and community to help us fund this massive undertaking. 

What Your Contribution Will Go Towards

Opening your own restaurant is never easy or cheap, so with that being said....here is a brief breakdown of what your contributions will go towards. 

  • Securing a store front location. 
  • The first 6-9 months of operating costs.
  • New/Refurbished/Second-Hand Equipment for our kitchen and dining room. 
  • Cost of renovations if any are needed. 
  • Furniture, decor, business sign and marketing supplies. 

There are certain perks designated for each contribution amount - we'd like to give back to you and show you that we appreciate your help and kindness!

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are hard these days - we know, and that's why we are here asking for help! However, we know that everyone is not always able to make a monetary donation and that's okay. If you're comfortable with sharing our message and speaking on our behalf to help us raise funds, it would help us immensely and we'd be so grateful! 

Thank you for taking time out of your day to read through this! We hope you've had the chance to try our food and if not - we hope you will visit our first home whenever we find it! 

Please feel free to drop us a line. You can find us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/lyddiesgoods or you can email us at lyddiesgoods@gmail.com

Peace & Love, 

Your Friends - Lydia & Brad
story_txt:
ABOUT US
Lyddie's Goods LLC is a small food business that provides a wide range of meals including classic American comfort food, Thai cuisine and Thai fusion dishes. Lyddie's Goods started as a not so serious part time gig to provide eggrolls, crab rangoon and other snacks to friends and family about 2 summers ago.  As things started to pick up and orders started to roll in we found it difficult to balance both our full-time jobs and the orders from Lyddie's. One year later, Lydia decided to take a leap of faith to pursue her biggest goal.  She always had a love for cooking and dreamed of opening a small restaurant one day, so she left her full-time job in order to take the necessary steps to grow her food business. Lydia's partner Brad stood by and helped every way he could as she took every step possible in order to legitimize Lyddie's Goods. Over time, Lydia found a commercial kitchen to cook out of and was able to get her food license. Currently, the business runs weekly meal specials that are available for pick up/delivery and you can catch them at the Milford Farmers Market twice a month or grab a cup of hot soup at The Nashua Garden located in downtown Nashua, NH. Lydia does most of the cooking by herself but sometimes has assistance from her mother, Noy and of course her biggest supporter and partner, Brad. 
As you can see, Lyddie's is a small operation but it is so dear to us. Most of our greatest memories revolve around our family, friends and great food. Those three things create this feeling that is almost indescribable and it's something that you feel in your heart. It truly is the best feeling being around the ones that you love - talking, laughing, sharing and bonding together over a great meal. It makes you feel happy and whole. We want to create that environment for you so if you choose to dine in, you not only enjoy our food but you can enjoy it in a space that was geared to make you feel comfortable and at ease.
A Couple Of Our Goals 

To provide you with a wide array  of food using fresh ingredients that will rock your taste buds. We love making things in small batches because it allows us to pay close attention during the process and we can assure you that everything was made with extra love and care. 
Build and create long lasting relationships and connections with our customers. We want to make an impact by bringing people together and being interactive with our community.  

Your contribution will help us on our journey to find our first home for Lyddie's Goods. Starting a business is never easy and we've laid the ground work to get our food business growing but now we are asking for support from our friends, colleagues and community to help us fund this massive undertaking. 

What Your Contribution Will Go Towards
Opening your own restaurant is never easy or cheap, so with that being said....here is a brief breakdown of what your contributions will go towards. 

Securing a store front location. 
The first 6-9 months of operating costs.
New/Refurbished/Second-Hand Equipment for our kitchen and dining room. 
Cost of renovations if any are needed. 
Furniture, decor, business sign and marketing supplies. 

There are certain perks designated for each contribution amount - we'd like to give back to you and show you that we appreciate your help and kindness!

Other Ways You Can Help
Times are hard these days - we know, and that's why we are here asking for help! However, we know that everyone is not always able to make a monetary donation and that's okay. If you're comfortable with sharing our message and speaking on our behalf to help us raise funds, it would help us immensely and we'd be so grateful! 
Thank you for taking time out of your day to read through this! We hope you've had the chance to try our food and if not - we hope you will visit our first home whenever we find it! 
Please feel free to drop us a line. You can find us on Facebook - www.facebook.com/lyddiesgoods or you can email us at lyddiesgoods@gmail.com
Peace & Love, 
Your Friends - Lydia & Brad

story:
What Hero Shop Is

Hero Shop is a highly-curated fashion and lifestyle concept store in San Francisco founded by me, Emily Holt, a former Vogue editor and Bay Area native. Opening in the Tenderloin in 2016, the store will showcase an exciting and accessible mix of clothing, accessories, home items, gifts, and tech, while championing and supporting one of the city’s most dynamic neighborhoods. In short, it will be a "must see" destination. 

 

Why I’m Opening It

 

 

Every major city in the country has a unique store that defines its particular style and projects it onto the global scene: Ikram in Chicago, Capitol in Charlotte, The Webster in Miami, Totokaelo in Seattle, and the list goes on. San Francisco doesn't have a store like this, and I'm in a special position to do something about it. 

As a former editor at Vogue, Women's Wear Daily and W magazine, I have a New York City, high fashion background. As a native of the Bay Area, I speak California. Which is to say that I understand what products work for this lifestyle and I know how to make a store exciting for national and international press. 

I also simply love San Francisco, and while I'm living here, there needs to be a store like this where I can shop, discover, and meet people. So I’m building it—with your help.

Assortment, Services, and Programming

Hero Shop will focus on established designer brands and West Coast labels. This will give the store a distinctly California vibe and help promote local talent. A wide range of prices—from $20 to $5,000—means that everyone can participate, from the fashion conscious to the fashion curious. 

An expert team of Hero Shop stylists will be available for wardrobe curation, personal shopping, and personal styling. Friendly staff will cater to customers' busy lives with flexible, personal service. 

Hero Shop events will build community within and around the store. Designer dinners, book parties, speaker series, and movie nights are all in the works! Also, conversations with organizations like Raphael House and 826 Valencia have already begun to explore how Hero Shop can support the important work they do.

Indiegogo Campaign

 

I'm raising $100,000 to cover the build out of our location at 982 Post Street. Permits, contractors, inspectors, compliancy requirements, lighting, dressing rooms, display fixtures and cosmetic improvements are all costs we'll be incurring over the next 5-6 months. 

I know it's a busy time of year, and I'm grateful for all contributions. Even $5 helps! 

 

The Impact

Hero Shop is my vote of confidence in San Francisco style and the Tenderloin neighborhood. My hope is that the store’s success inspires more people to open diverse businesses that speak to artistic communities, bring distinct style to the city, and pay attention to San Francisco’s vibrant neighborhoods.

Other ways you can help

It takes a village, and so it will with Hero Shop. If you know anyone we should know, please email me at emily@heroshopsf.com!

story:
Wildwood Organics has been around for 2 years as a home based business serving friends, family, and others in the local area. We have been under 2 different names and have finally settled on Wildwood Organics to cover the wide range of products we have available. The photo pictured is some of our products when we were Sun Kissed Essentials.

Our goal now? To go big or go home! We want to begin serving the entire country of the United States and expand our business outside our local area. We need your help to do this.

What We Need & What You Get

Let's take a look at why we are asking for $5,000.

To get our website up and running, and being fully functional after launch is $720.
To register as a business locally is only $25, but still needed nonetheless.
To prepare a room in my home for my supplies (such as stove, blenders, thermometers, fire extinguishers, pots, pans, spoons, storage) will run just over $1,500.
To stock myself full of proper containers and labels to make at least 50 of each of our products is just around $650
To get all of the natural, organic ingredients to make at least 50 of each product is another $1,225
To stock this room full of customized boxes of different sizes for different sized orders will run at a quoted cost of $800

This adds up to $4,920.

Now what do you get? Well it depends on how much you can contribute. Everyone who contributes will get recognized on our website as a contributor, no matter how much you help us out with. The perks are greater the more you help us reach our goal. The more you spend, the more products that will be shipped to you when we launch. The biggest perk is a lifetime discount code that gets you 30% off our products. We will also have novelty items like mugs, buttons, shirts, etc. 

The Impact

So why help launch Wildwood Organics? Because there are so many unnecessary chemicals in everyone's homes and they are causing bad reactions to families everywhere. Do you even know what's in your laundry detergent? Can you pronounce them? Or how about your face wash? Shampoo? Conditioner? If you cannot pronounce it, chances are it isn't needed. 

Natural products help you feel safer with what you put on your body, and are also amazing for our environment. The less chemicals going into our products are the less chemicals going back into the ground when things get thrown away (and thank you to those who recycle!). 

Risks & Challenges

As with starting any business, there are always risks. However, we have already been up and running for 2 years locally so have already overcome the initial client basis needed to get going. We have already had our trials and errors with creating our products and are just now looking to expand and go bigger and better! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love the idea of our small business but are unable to help financially, please give us a Like on Facebook and help us share our story and products that way. The more likes we have, the more potential contributors we have.

story:
Fund the Tim Kopra Room at the Thayer Hotel

NASA Astronaut Colonel Tim Kopra, USMA 1985, is currently in space as the Commander of the International Space Station.   His historic accomplishments are worthy of a dedicated room at the Historic Thayer Hotel at West Point.   

This room dedication is being led by Colonel (Ret) Jeanette McMahon, USMA 1983, who is dedicating the room in loving memory of her late husband, Colonel Mike McMahon, USMA 1985, who was Killed in Action in Afghanistan.  Mike and Tim were lifelong friends since they met during their cadet days.  After Mike was killed in Afghanistan, Tim carried Mike's dog tags into space to honor his late friend and so it is befitting that the McMahon family lead this effort to now honor Tim.     That photo, of Colonel Kopra in space with Colonel McMahon's dog tags floating in zero gravity, will be one of the photos displayed permanently in the Kopra room.    

The Historic Thayer Hotel at West Point was built in 1926 and is one of our national treasures, located on the grounds of West Point, high above the banks of the Hudson River.   The 151 guest rooms of the hotel are being dedicated in honor of some of West Point's most famous graduates: Presidents,Generals, Astronauts, Medal of Honor recipients, CEOs, Governors and other distinguished leaders of character.    See the FOX News show that highlights the program:  FOX NEWS SHOW FEATURING THE ROOM DEDICATION PROGRAM

Over half the guest rooms have now been funded by families, friends, classes and corporations including  USAA, Pentagon Federal Credit Union, OshKosh, Remington, Jostens and many other corporations   There are two steps to achieving a dedicated room:  first is a nomination and second is a sponsorship.  First, a committee chooses graduates who are worthy of a room nomination.  Out of 60,000 West Point graduates in history there are many incredible leaders who have shaped our world.   There is certainly no way to provide a definitive list of the top 151 graduates.   Rather, this program seeks to honor a representative cross section from all aspects of leadership and that list is several hundred graduates long, more than the number of rooms available. Colonel Tim Kopra is one of those who has received a nomination and is worthy of a room dedication.     So it is important to raise these funds to ensure Colonel Kopra gets his room funded prior to all of the rooms being sponsored to other graduates.         

A list of the rooms that have been dedicated can be found here: List of Dedicated Rooms and Explanation of the Thayer Hotel Room Dedication Program 

  • A plaque will go outside of the door with the highlights from Colonel Kopra's lifetime of accomplishments.  The current photo of the plaque is only a mock-up, he will provide edits after the room is funded.   
  • The room will be filled with photos and memorabilia chosen by Colonel Kopra.  
  • The room will be a permanent testament to the bravery and fortitude of one of our West Point astronauts.   Colonel Buzz Aldrin, USMA 1951, already has a room dedicated in his honor and several other astronauts have been nominated including Colonel Frank Borman, BG Michael Collins, LTC Ed White and others.  

In order to fund the room and conduct the ceremony

  • Anyone sponsoring more than $300 will receive a ticket to the dedication ceremony.  
  • Anyone sponsoring $1,000 will have their name permanently displayed in the room on a framed sponsorship.  
  • The first $5,000 raised will go to the dedication ceremony.  
  • The rooms are $25,000 for a standard room, $35,000 for an Executive Suite and $45,000 for a Super Suite, plus the $5,000 for the dedication ceremony (Party).    This fundraise is seeking to provide him with an Executive Suite ($35,000, plus $5,000, with 8% credit card and website fee for a total of $43,200).    
  • The McMahon family has generously offered to donate the first $10,000.   The sponsorship plaque that will be permanently displayed outside of the Kopra room will read "Proudly Sponsored by the  Class of 1985 and the McMahon family in honor of Michael McMahon, USMA 1985, friend and classmate of Colonel Kopra. Colonel McMahon was killed in action in Afghanistan"   
  • If the funds are not completely raised through this site, private donors will be sought to complete the raise to ensure the room is dedicated.  So all funds donated will be accepted.   There is a 5% fee for this site and a 3% credit card processing fee, so the raise is 8% higher than needed in order to accommodate.  If more funds are raised above and beyond the executive suite, those funds will go towards the dedication of other West Point astronaut rooms.   

Other Classes Have Already Done This

Several other West Point classes have already led the effort to raise the funds for their classmates rooms.   These include: 
1959:  The Class of 1959 has rallied around several rooms including the 1958 Football Room- the last undefeated Army football team, the Rocker Versace Room (POW/MIA/KIA/Medal of Honor).  
1960:  The class has led the effort to dedicate the Colonel Nick Rowe room.
1974:  The class dedicated the room to General Martin Dempsey while he was the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. 
1986:   The class has led the effort to dedicate two rooms: Joe DePinto, CEO of 7-Eleven and Steve Cannon, CEO Mercedes-Benz USA.  
There are several other classes who have contributed to the 80 dedicated rooms and who are currently organizing their planned class dedicated rooms.     

The Impact

Thus far the Historic Thayer Hotel has 80 rooms dedicated out of a total of 151 rooms in the hotel.  The remainder will likely be dedicated by the end of 2016.  Colonel Kopra returns from space in June 2016 and his dedicated ceremony would ideally be held within a few months of his return at his convenience.   .  

  • By donating you will be helping to ensure the millions of guests who visit West Point will remember this seminal moment in history  
  • You can currently visit the Thayer Hotel to see other rooms and stay in rooms dedicated to Buzz Aldrin, BG Becky Halstead, Henry O. Flipper (1st African-American graduate of West Point) and other amazing people.  
  • Future cadet candidates, men and women, can come to visit West Point and be inspired by the leadership shown by Colonel Kopra and understand the opportunities afforded to them if they are accepted into West Point are limitless. 

Risks & Challenges

The Thayer Hotel management team has already raised the funds to dedicate 80 rooms out of the 151 rooms in the hotel.   They are rapidly dedicating the remaining rooms.  If this and other fundraising efforts are not successful for this particular room, then Colonel Kopra will not be honored in a way that they deserve.  

  • Potential corporate sponsors for any of these rooms can contact Dan Rice at danrice88@yahoo.com  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can contribute, thank you for making history!  If you cannot contribute, please help get the word out!  
  • This is not a tax deductible contribution and should be considered in a similar way to sponsorship of the naming of a stadium or building.  
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
