story:
My Mission!

My Name is Mel Birchett, I am a Licensed Cosmetologist in the State of Michigan. I have been a Stylist/Skin Care Specialist in the Metro Detroit area for over 10 years. My area of expertise is in healthy hair, skin and nails. For years I have taken a more holistic approach to my products and services, and it is my main goal to educate my clients and others with textbook knowledge and knowledge of my experiences.

This campaign was created with the customer in mind. Many women and men suffer from some sort of hair, skin, and nail conditions caused by either themselves or a careless professional. It is my goal to develop a Salon and Clinical Spa that will not only leave the client looking their best but feeling confident that they are on the road to being their best, inside as well. Definitely NOT your ordinary salon! 

With your donations, Stylz Salon and Clinical Spa will be able to offer its customers services in ALL areas of Cosmetology. This salon will include; Hair Care, Skin Care, Nail care, Massage Therapy, and also treatment from a Board Certified Dermatologist/Trichologist as needed.  The Beauty Industry is FULL of horror stories and cases of disease transfer, hair loss, chemical burns, etc.! It is my goal to restore faith in the beauty industry, one stylist, one client, one salon at a time.

This is a give and take campaign!

To begin building this business, I am asking the public (or should I say consumer) for a total of $30,000. While I know this is a small amount for such a big project, I am confident that more investments will be made. These funds will go toward the purchase(or lease) and renovation of the salon as well as supplies.

As a thank you to you, your donations will also go toward your first visit at the salon! That's right, you will be able to benefit from your investment into my dream!

           In the event that my goal is not reached in the time allowed, all donations will              go towards a smaller version of this business. Either way....THE VISION WILL             HAPPEN!

The Impact on the Community!

I am a giver, and my salon will give as well! 

In my personal life, I donate to many medical awareness funds, the homeless, and many others who are in need. I've always said, "If I have it, you have it. If I don't have it, I'll figure out how you can get it."  With that said, It is my goal to help Detroit's homeless with free haircuts once a month, and also free meals once a month. Currently, under my business name, I collect boots for the homeless and pass them out to homeless men and women in downtown Detroit. This is my second year collecting and it is rewarding to be able to help in some small way. I am excited to see the growth of this Boot Drive in the years to come!

We will also have discounts for college students in the area and business professionals in the area as well!

Bumps in the road....

I am pretty sure there will be bumps in the road along the way. I count them as learning moments and growth for my business. Many people don't know the technicalities of opening a business, that's why many startups fail.

  • Because I have made a plan for action, I believe I can overcome hurdles.
  • I have, and will continue to, connect with my salon owner friends. Asking questions and listening to sound advice! I will also work closely with my management team to make this business very successful. Not just for myself, but for my community! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • I understand that some may not be able to contribute financially but please help get the word out!
  • SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, ETC.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!
story_txt:
My Mission!
My Name is Mel Birchett, I am a Licensed Cosmetologist in the State of Michigan. I have been a Stylist/Skin Care Specialist in the Metro Detroit area for over 10 years. My area of expertise is in healthy hair, skin and nails. For years I have taken a more holistic approach to my products and services, and it is my main goal to educate my clients and others with textbook knowledge and knowledge of my experiences.
This campaign was created with the customer in mind. Many women and men suffer from some sort of hair, skin, and nail conditions caused by either themselves or a careless professional. It is my goal to develop a Salon and Clinical Spa that will not only leave the client looking their best but feeling confident that they are on the road to being their best, inside as well. Definitely NOT your ordinary salon! 
With your donations, Stylz Salon and Clinical Spa will be able to offer its customers services in ALL areas of Cosmetology. This salon will include; Hair Care, Skin Care, Nail care, Massage Therapy, and also treatment from a Board Certified Dermatologist/Trichologist as needed.  The Beauty Industry is FULL of horror stories and cases of disease transfer, hair loss, chemical burns, etc.! It is my goal to restore faith in the beauty industry, one stylist, one client, one salon at a time.
This is a give and take campaign!
To begin building this business, I am asking the public (or should I say consumer) for a total of $30,000. While I know this is a small amount for such a big project, I am confident that more investments will be made. These funds will go toward the purchase(or lease) and renovation of the salon as well as supplies.
As a thank you to you, your donations will also go toward your first visit at the salon! That's right, you will be able to benefit from your investment into my dream!
           In the event that my goal is not reached in the time allowed, all donations will              go towards a smaller version of this business. Either way....THE VISION WILL             HAPPEN!
The Impact on the Community!
I am a giver, and my salon will give as well! In my personal life, I donate to many medical awareness funds, the homeless, and many others who are in need. I've always said, "If I have it, you have it. If I don't have it, I'll figure out how you can get it."  With that said, It is my goal to help Detroit's homeless with free haircuts once a month, and also free meals once a month. Currently, under my business name, I collect boots for the homeless and pass them out to homeless men and women in downtown Detroit. This is my second year collecting and it is rewarding to be able to help in some small way. I am excited to see the growth of this Boot Drive in the years to come!
We will also have discounts for college students in the area and business professionals in the area as well!

Bumps in the road....
I am pretty sure there will be bumps in the road along the way. I count them as learning moments and growth for my business. Many people don't know the technicalities of opening a business, that's why many startups fail.

Because I have made a plan for action, I believe I can overcome hurdles.
I have, and will continue to, connect with my salon owner friends. Asking questions and listening to sound advice! I will also work closely with my management team to make this business very successful. Not just for myself, but for my community! 



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

I understand that some may not be able to contribute financially but please help get the word out!
SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! FACEBOOK, TWITTER, INSTAGRAM, ETC.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

story:
My beloved Mom is not a professional chef but she's a passionate artist in and out of the kitchen, with flavors and paintings alike. When she was making jam and syrup for the local Food Fest, my dad and I believed that everyone should indulge in her art. Chillies, ginger, pears, wild blackberries, blueberries, elderflower berries preserves and syrups... ohh, that flavor fantasy...

That's why I've started this campaign! Our goal is to display her wonderful jams and syrups at UK's biggest fair on the 6th of September 2015, the Speciality & Fine Food Fair 2015. The minimum entry fee is 2500 USD (4sqm display space).

My Mom's preserves are traditional, with a sophisticated twist (pear and ginger confiture anyone?). We're not fans of supermarket fruits at all and her jams and syrups are made from home(forest)-grown, seasonal fruits, roots and healthy plants. Call them limited edition if you will because you never know what recipes next year's seasons will bring.

This delicious business has the potential of growing into a local factory, encourage local economy by using local suppliers  for our ingredients (which are many) and offer jobs. We'd like to make a difference locally and industry wise, delight everyone's taste buds at the UK Fair and create some fruitful opportunities but we need YOUR help for starters!

Every little help counts! Please share this if you believe in jam power!

We're currently working on packaging, logo and name but since my dad was mom's main helper, how does Ma&Pa's Preserves sound?

Deeply appreciated,

Loving daughter

story:
Who we are:

We are a wholesale citrus, mango and tropical fruit tree nursery in operation for 3 years with 20 years' experience in the nursery industry, based in the Kimberley (outback) of Australia. 

Our Business has substantial horticultural experience and has been supplying fruit trees and working with several of the local aboriginal communities for some time. We see a great opportunity to expand this model to be able to provide greater number of communities across the Kimberley, Pilbara and Northern Territory.

The nursery currently supplies some indigenous communities, garden centres and community groups throughout Western Australia and Northern Territory.  Being in the Kimberley, we have seen the chronic health issues in remote communities and their difficulties in supplying healthy food to their people. We are passionate about giving communities something that will have a long term, direct impact on their health and well being.  By investing in our business it will give us the means to develop this project, which given the chance, will do exactly that. 

What We Need:
Our nursery business has been approached to introduce three new varieties of mango trees to Australian commercial growers, which are in the early stages of development and, which when established, will provide new and exciting varieties. 

Fruit tree growing is our business and we believe that we produce a high quality product, however for us to release the new variety of mangoes we are required to upgrade our facilities and apply for NIASSA accreditation. This is a nursery industry standard in Australia.  This involves installing a new water source in the form of a bore, raising all our plants off the ground to keep them from contamination and upgrading the nursery infrastructure. We would like to upgrade and establish a teaching and research section, that will be used to fulfill our passion for helping Aboriginal communities.

We have a firm belief that we can assist Aboriginal communities in achieving healthier lifestyles through fruit and vegetables.

Capital Expense:

  • Bore, Water Tanks and Pump ($42,000)
  • 20 mm Stone to cover Nursery Floor ($20,000)
  • Nursery Benches ($36,000)
  • Nursery Infrastructure upgrades (18,000)
  • Education Centre (12,000)
  • Kubota Tractor (30,000)
  • NIASSA Accreditation (22,000)
  • Total ($180,000)
What You Get:

Our business is partnering with community groups to provide fruit trees and vegetable seedlings so that Aboriginal communities not only have the supply of the plants but ongoing support with technical advice.

It is a well-known fact that aboriginal communities spend a great deal of their money on cheaper priced fast food in comparison to overpriced fresh fruit and vegetables at community shops.  While supplying trees to some aboriginal communities in the past, we have witnessed the positive impact that having access to fresh fruit and vegetables has on their families and children.  Your investment in our business will directly influence aboriginal families to better health and well-being by providing nutrition that is so essential to achieving healthy lifestyles.  Your contribution will help plant tropical trees and set up irrigation systems for tress and vegetables. In addition, providing master classes in grafting and plant nutrition and sustainable trees will ensure that your investment in communities has a tangible impact. 

"Your contribution to this crowd funding campaign will assist us to establish a fruit orchard and a vegetable garden whereby we will be able to grow our own food."          (Edna and her son Vincent from Molly Springs community)

We are so excited to have given our first gift of fruit trees to Wugguban Community, who are forward thinking and innovative in their approach.  In the photo you see Aimee Trust receiving the plants, who tells us that they getting a new meeting hall and these trees will be planted around the hall for everyone to share.  Please also see wuggubantourism.com to have more insight into this community.

Aimee Trust from Wugguban receiving the first gift of trees!

story:
WHO WE ARE!

Veteran Owned and Operated! 

Through extensive research Integrated Response Solutions has determined that most small to medium sized organizations lack adequate response plans and more importantly training in emergency preparedness. Our research shows that most of these smaller organizations lack updated response plans for events such as active shooters and natural disasters/ weather related events. Given the current climate active shooter and similar events are happening with a more regular frequency

In a recent study the FBI determined that from the year 2000 to 2013 active shooter incidents were up dramatically with a total of 160 incidents nationwide. On average for those 13 years 11.4 incidents were occurring either wounding for killing 1,043 people.  However since then the FBI has reported that our nation endures an active shooter incident every three weeks. There is a strong need for businesses to introduce active shooter event training to their employees. Furthermore it is imperative that these employers provide adequate training on how to handle an active shooter or natural disaster to their management team. 

About our team

Grant Y. has been in the public safety industry for over 13 years serving as a fire fighter at a major airport and in the United States Military. Grant served in the United States Marine Corps from 2003-2007 and served as an Aircraft Rescue and Firefighting Marine in Okinawa, Japan & Cherry Point North Carolina. After his active duty service ended he took a position as a fire fighter/ EMT in the Washington DC region. Most recently Grant joined the Maryland National Guard as an all source intelligence analyst. Grant holds a Bachelor of Science in Homeland Security and a Master of Science in Information Assurance. This diverse background in public safety coupled with his training and education have resulted in a unique set of skills and abilities. His diversified background spans  military installations, major airports, and residential areas. He is considered a subject matter expert in these areas. 

Scott B. has served as a firefighter for over 15 years serving in a Chiefs level position for a major volunteer organization for over 5 of those years. Scott has extensive knowledge in building evacuations, active shooter events, fire protection, emergency medical services, and training. Scott has served with distinguished service at all levels of his career and is considered a subject matter expert in this field. 

What we need! 

We are two full time dads, fire fighters, soldiers, and husbands. We need assistance getting our business off the ground and flying high. We have set a goal of $15,000 to help us achieve this. Here is how we intend to spend any capital raised. 

Currently we will run this business out of our homes using our personal lap tops and work space. However what we lack is a mechanism to get our name out there. We have over 28 years of knowledge and experience in this field, we need to get this information out to employers and people just like you. 

 We need to set up a capital account and an operating account to get our business growing. From these two accounts we will need to invest heavily in marketing and traveling on our spare time to get our name out there. 

We will need to purchase quality advertising equipment such as tables, signs, banners, logos, etc. Our plan is to attend as many trade shows and vendor shows as possible over the next year. This is an easy way to get noticed. In addition we will be contracting a website developer and contract attorney to get a website up and running and our L.L.C. in place. 

In addition other start up cost will include print material for possible clients, travel expenses to get to trade shows outside of our home base of the greater Washington DC area. 

For any potential investors please feel free to contact us for a copy of our business plan, SOW, or any other information you wish to know. We have a very transparent frame of mind and were willing to work with anyone to accomplish our goals. 

The Impact we could make!

Our service is becoming a vital necessity for every workplace around the globe. It is the unfortunate truth that natural disasters and domestic incidents such as active shooters are becoming all to normal for our society.  Its proven that education and preparedness can save lives. Smaller organizations shouldn't have to have to leave they're fate to chance. We can help save lives through policy, education, training, and practical skills. 

We strongly believe in preparation. There's an old saying "bad preparation leads to bad performance", how will your organization handle a active shooter event? How will your organization handle a natural disaster? How will your organization function if after an event? These are all topic areas in which we can help you. Unfortunately these types of incidents cannot be prevented on a global scale, however using an "all hazards approach" we can help limit the impact to your organization and most importantly: #savelife

Other ways you can help us! 

We understand times are tough and not everyone can help. We are most certainly open to networking. If your are not willing or able to donate to help us get going please forward any, and all contact information for anyone you think could benefit from our business! We want to reach as many people as we can!

story:
Feed, Teach, Develop, & Repeat

(Please read the updates to understand the huge momentum happening outside of Indiegogo. Click Here)

Thank you so much for all the donations.

We have seen so much kindness during this campaign.

  • Donation of 8 “Old Trusty” tractors

  • The development of the Solar and Wind powered pumps that will fill the water tanks during the night and will provide electricity to a couple of the schools and medical facilities.

  • Huge shipping containers donated.

  • Harbor Freight helping to fill a 20 foot shipping container.

  • John Deere employees helping to rebuild the 8 donated tractors and the 7 tractors to make sure they were ready to be put to great use in the 30 villages.

  • The successful negotiations of the 6 African countries and addition requests for many others.

  • A five year old family project successfully becoming a NonProfit organization that is operated by volunteers so 100% of all donations are used as promised.

  • The wonderful Indiegogo support from so many friends and family.

We can't thank you enough for this experience.


Imagine 60 new high output water wells throughout Africa, thousands of new African farm acres managed by the villagers themselves, five schools that include computers, buses, and solar/wind energy.  25 full time employees (farming professionals and teachers) and hundreds of volunteers.  The project as a whole is doing amazing things! FTDR is currently leasing a water rig in Zimbabwe, our own is currently being shipped to Zimbabwe.  These Indiegogo funds will be used to purchase a second Water drilling rig, doubling our humanitarian efforts.  Any extra funds will be used for the school's needs or water storage tanks. 

The Need:

Many of our projects are already underway. We have discovered that when a village has food, water, farms, school access, and medical the news spreads quickly and families are drawn in from surrounding areas magnifying the needs to a much greater level.  This is great because it is what we are there to assist with.  These additional people are always willing to help work to make the project  successful. We share in the hope of so many as they assist in helping their villages to become self sustaining.

Feed, Teach, Develop, & Repeat
  • 30 new high output water wells and storage units
  • 5 new schools with buses and computers
  • 5 new medical facilities staffed by other organizations
  • Farmland developed by professionals, managed by villages

  • Wind and Solar energy supporting schools, medical facilities, water pumps to fill the storage tanks.

  • 25 full time employees (farming professionals, teachers, bus drivers, drilling rig foremen, equipment manager)

  • Reality TV. Documenting the joys, challenges, and experiences of these amazing people! There are two television networks currently creating bids for rights for this opportunity. (This will start after Zimbabwe, since video recordings or news agencies are currently not allowed.)

To show our debt of gratitude:

  • Feed, Teach, Develop, & Repeat

  • We will duplicate our success world wide to under-privileged third world villages.

  • We have many partnerships in food development focusing on the nutritional needs of these African villages. These are being freely donated. Anything we develop will be made available at wholesale to all donors. Long term high nutrition food storage.  True wholesale.

Excitement

  • These people are amazing! Their joy in the face of incredible challenges is absolutely inspiring!  Thank you for sharing the adventure.

  • Also use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
At Hope Farm Organics we believe that food security and environmental sustainability go hand in hand. In fact it's why we started farming. Now that we are starting year 5 on the farm, we realize that to really make a difference in the food security sector and the farm's sustainability, we need root storage. But to make this dream happen we need community support from you!

     Andrew and Janie have always had a deep concern with the modern world's environmental issues. Farming organically and sustainably seemed to be the only means by which the two could truly contribute to a more sustainable world. Andrew grew up in Kansas and attained a science degree in Agriculture before moving to Alaska where he met Janie (from Quebec) and they both moved to Prince George to start their new life together.

 While in Kansas Andrew watched in horror as the landscape was slowly dying due to conventional agriculture. As witness to the devastation that our modern food system has created, Andrew vowed to not do as the system does and reject it for an alternative framework of local, organic production. 

After a short time in Prince George, the idea was born to create a sustainable farm that would produce vegetables truly sustainably and to give to those wanting an option and connection to healthy food.Thus Hope Farm was born in 2011 in the glacial valley of Eaglet Lake and Aleza Lake. Janie and Andrew are naturalists and often do wild harvesting via hunting and foraging and are always happy to put on workshops and school/library presentations for those wanting to learn these skills along with farming and homesteading skills. Knowledge is power when it comes to obtaining and growing your own food and they encourage everyone to do the same and reject the current food system that has caused  the problems we have today (health issues, climate change).  Join us in our mission to change the food system! Three meals a day can change the world!


  • Sustainability means the capacity to endure. For northern cities to endure we need food security in an ever changing world of climate uncertainties and corporate control of food plant genetics. For food security in the north we need storage. For the farm to be sustainable we need storage. A root cellar will extend the season of produce for people in the region and allow us at Hope Farm Organics to spend more time on the farm by providing more on farm income and less off farm income.


What We Need & What You Get


  • We are asking for $8,000 Cad (Hey that is really cheap if you are in the USA right now!) to build our 20ft x 35 ft root cellar which will also double as a walk in cooler during the summer months.  We Hope to find the least expensive means to build with at the time of construction. If there are any left over funds after building this project they will be used to aid in a more efficient vegetable processing area.
  • We believe in the community as our long hours and scarred hands show and we now know that the community believes in us from all your purchases, but to make our goal of creating a real difference for the masses of the Prince George we need your help.
  • In case we don't meet the funds required we will continue with the building of the root cellar but we will make it smaller with options to expand when funds are available. 

The Impact

Food security in BC is a real threat to the mass of citizens, though we do not really see it when we go to the grocery store. The grocery store holds three days of food in it, one if there is a panic. BC is importing the likes of 70-80% of it's produce. That means we are relying on places like California, Peru etc and their farming practices (think drought). By contributing :

  • With an ever changing climate, comes with it uncertainties in food security.One only has to look at the root cause (famine) of the situation in Syria to see how this can impact a nation quickly and violently.
  • Since we bought Hope Farm in 2011 we have transformed an unused farm of 60 years to a successful 34 vegetable box CSA program as well as shipping vegetables to a major organic produce distributor in BC.  This year alone we have fed over 100 people through out the summer each week by our CSA program alone.  All of this has been achieved while Janie was finishing her degree and I (Andrew) was working in the bush 50 hours a week or more as a forest ecologist on a modest income.
  • No one becomes a farmer of a small organic operation to become rich. We do it for the love of humanity and the environment that sustains us and with your support we will make the region's food security lessen and feed more families organic sustainable food.

Risks & Challenges

As we all know farming is gamble. I tell everyone that I have never played the lottery or gambled but yet every time a farmer puts a seed in the ground it is just that. If we didn't take risks as farmers the world's history would be dramatically different.

  • Here on the farm we use deep organic methods of production to limit the risks with environment and pests. Our raised 3ft beds allow for mitigation of large rain events drowning the produce while our drip line irrigation makes the most efficient use of water in times where the rains are needed but make no appearance. We grow heirloom varieties of vegetables and continue to improve seed (we grow Cantaloupe!) to match our unique and challenging northern climate to further our food security.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
  • We can always use a hand on the farm during the season and you won't leave empty handed.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
At Hope Farm Organics we believe that food security and environmental sustainability go hand in hand. In fact it's why we started farming. Now that we are starting year 5 on the farm, we realize that to really make a difference in the food security sector and the farm's sustainability, we need root storage. But to make this dream happen we need community support from you!

     Andrew and Janie have always had a deep concern with the modern world's environmental issues. Farming organically and sustainably seemed to be the only means by which the two could truly contribute to a more sustainable world. Andrew grew up in Kansas and attained a science degree in Agriculture before moving to Alaska where he met Janie (from Quebec) and they both moved to Prince George to start their new life together.

 While in Kansas Andrew watched in horror as the landscape was slowly dying due to conventional agriculture. As witness to the devastation that our modern food system has created, Andrew vowed to not do as the system does and reject it for an alternative framework of local, organic production. 

After a short time in Prince George, the idea was born to create a sustainable farm that would produce vegetables truly sustainably and to give to those wanting an option and connection to healthy food.Thus Hope Farm was born in 2011 in the glacial valley of Eaglet Lake and Aleza Lake. Janie and Andrew are naturalists and often do wild harvesting via hunting and foraging and are always happy to put on workshops and school/library presentations for those wanting to learn these skills along with farming and homesteading skills. Knowledge is power when it comes to obtaining and growing your own food and they encourage everyone to do the same and reject the current food system that has caused  the problems we have today (health issues, climate change).  Join us in our mission to change the food system! Three meals a day can change the world!


 Sustainability means the capacity to endure. For northern cities to endure we need food security in an ever changing world of climate uncertainties and corporate control of food plant genetics. For food security in the north we need storage. For the farm to be sustainable we need storage. A root cellar will extend the season of produce for people in the region and allow us at Hope Farm Organics to spend more time on the farm by providing more on farm income and less off farm income.     What We Need & What You Get   We are asking for $8,000 Cad (Hey that is really cheap if you are in the USA right now!) to build our 20ft x 35 ft root cellar which will also double as a walk in cooler during the summer months.  We Hope to find the least expensive means to build with at the time of construction. If there are any left over funds after building this project they will be used to aid in a more efficient vegetable processing area. We believe in the community as our long hours and scarred hands show and we now know that the community believes in us from all your purchases, but to make our goal of creating a real difference for the masses of the Prince George we need your help. In case we don't meet the funds required we will continue with the building of the root cellar but we will make it smaller with options to expand when funds are available.     The Impact Food security in BC is a real threat to the mass of citizens, though we do not really see it when we go to the grocery store. The grocery store holds three days of food in it, one if there is a panic. BC is importing the likes of 70-80% of it's produce. That means we are relying on places like California, Peru etc and their farming practices (think drought).
